Job Title: Office Manager for an Educational Training Provider
Job Description:
Job Title: * Office Manager for an Educational Training Provider
Responsible to: * Compliance & Operations Manager
Key Working Relationships: * *Internal: * Managing Director, Development Manager, Compliance Operations Manager, Human Resources Manager, Assessors, Tutors, Support Workers, Apprentices, and Students.
External: *Awarding Bodies, Primes, Colleges, Stakeholders, Business Partners and External Agencies.
Purpose of the job: *
This is an exciting time to join our team as office manager in a thriving office located in Blackheath. With 3 years’ experience managing a busy office, your role will be to oversee the administrative activities that facilitate the smooth running of an office and delivery centres, organising people, information and other resources. You'll ensure that office equipment is maintained to the appropriate quality, relevant records are up to date and all administrative processes work effectively. It is essential that you have knowledge of Government funded contracts and audit checks that comply too Ofsted and awarding body requirements.
Key Responsibilities *
· Provide accurate, timely and monthly reports for the Senior Management Team.

· Effectively manage the MIS online and paper filing systems, to ESFA and Ofsted compliance.

· Manage the signup and exit paperwork to meet ESFA funding regulations.

· Work with Managers and subcontractors in order to share good practice and raise standards.

· To develop, maintain and implement new administrative systems.

· To assist the Senior Management Team with the SAR & QIP.

• To use a range of software, including email, spreadsheets and databases, to ensure the efficient running of the office.

• To record office expenditure and manage the budget.

• To maintain supplies of stationery and equipment and the condition of the office and arrange for necessary repairs.

• Organise and chair meetings with staff.

• To carry out staff appraisals, manage performance and targets, promote staff development and training and staff teams’ directed continuous professional development.

• Delegate work to staff and manage their workload and output.

• Implement and promote equality and diversity policy.

• Respond to customer enquiries and complaints.

• review and update health and safety policies and ensure they're observed

• Check that data protection laws are being adhered to in relation to the storage of data, and review and update policies.

· Manage the social media.

· Monitor and report on EDIMS (Equality and Diversity Impact Measures), quality measures and customer satisfaction; proactively responding to improvement implementation and feedback from other departments.

· Preparation and readiness for internal and external audits.

General Duties

Play an active part in the Beats Learning staff team, attending staff and other appropriate meetings and events as required by the Compliance and Operations Manager and Senior Management Team.
Receive and participate in supervision and training as deemed necessary and in line with Beats Learning policies.
Operate within and promote Beats Learnings policies in all areas including Equality and Diversity.
Undertake such duties as the development of the post and longer-term plans may make necessary and desirable.
An ability and willingness to travel as required and necessary to enable the fulfilment of the role.
To demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with a wide variety of people.
Strong written communication skills and accuracy are very important as you will be responsible for submitting monthly Government funded paperwork in a timely fashion.
You will have day to day responsibility for running the office and will ensure that paperwork is completed accurately, so the ability to work quickly and methodically to meet deadlines is essential.
To play a key role in developing the policies and procedures with the Compliance & Operations Manager.
You will need to have previous experience of working within the Education sector in a customer-focused environment.
Be able to provide management information to the senior team and meet our data obligations with Ofsted, DWP, lead funders and support our move into new markets.
The provision of management information to facilitate effective senior management decision making and to support continuous improvement in our Apprenticeship schemes.
Complete review of the data within our systems to ensure it is compliant and meets of the needs of our funding stakeholders.
Uploading relevant data to external systems e.g. Primes.
Ensuring that actions related to individual apprentices have been processed correctly in MAYTAS including breaks in the learner’s programme.
Manage In-House Beats Learning Apprentices.
Managing paper-based filing systems.
Assisting with the administration of external audits such as OFSTED and the ESFA.
Attending departmental meetings, standardisations and taking minutes where appropriate.
Raising purchase orders as and when required.
Manage the petty cash on a weekly basis.
Share best practice and contribute to improvements across all the Beats Learning Teams.
Keeping updated on and complying with all Beats Learning policies and regulations (i.e. Health and Safety, Data Protection etc).
Representing the organisation as required at recruitment events, fairs, open days and end of term shows.
To manage and support the apprentices in their daily duties.
PERSON SPECIFICATION*
Applicants for this post should demonstrate how their skills and experience meet the following Person Specification.
Qualification Knowledge and Experience*
Essential: *
Knowledge of Government funded contracts and audit checks

Level 2 in English & Maths

Proven experience as a cooperative team member who can also work independently.

Experience of providing a responsive, customer-focused service – on the telephone, via electronic medium or face-to-face.

Experience of prioritising tasks and of managing busy workloads successfully to ensure that deadlines are met.

Experience of effectively managing, developing, delivering and monitoring training provision.
Desirable: *
Broad knowledge of, and an interest in Higher Education.

Experience of working in an Admissions Team or similar relevant area (e.g. student recruitment or student services).

Experience of using databases to store, manipulate and retrieve information.

NVQ 3 or first level of professional qualification (as appropriate) Business Administration
Skills and abilities: *
Essential: *
Excellent customer service skills.

Excellent written and oral communications skills.

A high level of accuracy and attention to detail.

The ability to assess and analyse problems and suggest solutions.

Strong IT skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), email (Outlook) and the ability to learn and use other software packages.

Good numeracy skills.
Desirable: *
Advance level IT skills.

Experience of conducting data analysis.

Knowledge of Maytas.
Personal attributes and aptitudes: *
Desirable: *
Professionally and personally committed to complete tasks successfully and produce excellent results.

Flexibility and a capacity to adapt to the changing demands of the job and the needs of the team.

Respect for confidentiality, including the integrity and sensitivity of records.

Awareness of and sensitivity to Equality & Diversity and Prevent.
Desirable: *
Excellent relationship building skills.

A positive approach to Equality & Diversity and Prevent.

Proactive attitude to suggesting improvements to working processes and practices.

Ability to obtain a satisfactory Disclosure Certificate

Job Title: Head of reward and workforce information
Job Description:
£49,488 p.a + Benefits

Ravensbourne University London is exceptional. A world-class digital destination developing talented individuals and leading edge businesses though learning, skills, applied research, enterprise and innovation.

We are based at Greenwich Peninsula in an iconic building next to The O2. Our aim is to become a portal for talent across London driving growth in the knowledge economy and creative industries.

We are looking to appoint a Head of reward and workforce information. This key role reports to the director of human resources and organisational development.

The successful candidate will be the university’s internal expert on pay, reward and the HR information systems. The postholder will research, develop and implement reward strategies and solutions that support the university’s business and lead the development and implementation of the university’s HR information system (Midland HR’s iTrent) rolling out use of key modules.

The role will also manage benchmarking of salaries, sourcing data and drafting reports, undertake equal pay audits, research pay and benefits in the higher education sector and other relevant sectors and to devise appropriate pay and benefit schemes for use in the university.

The successful candidate will also be responsible for developing and managing the iTrent HR/Payroll system, head projects to implement further associated systems to support workforce management, build and maintain effective working relationships with IT and payroll colleagues. In addition this role is also responsible for the delivery of third party returns, including HESA staff return, ONS, and UCEA salary surveys

The successful candidate must demonstrate knowledge in the following areas: HR information systems, preferably in the public sector; up to date knowledge of practice in higher education and underpinning employment law, knowledge of job evaluation and understanding of reward, compensation and benefits and grading structures.

Energy Services – Associate Director

Ci is an ambitious business in a dynamic and purposeful sector. We intend to grow at least threefold within the next 3 years.

The Purpose

Our mission is to be the market leader in helping business play its part in building a zero-carbon world. We do this by working with our clients to achieve their sustainability, energy and carbon reduction targets, aligning their business goals with their sustainability goals. Last year we were instrumental in driving over 10,000 tonnes of carbon out of the atmosphere, saving our clients £6m in the process.

Our team of sustainability strategists, software engineers, data scientists and building engineers are brought together by a unique purpose-driven, entrepreneurial culture, valued by clients for our ability to deliver action.

The Person

Carbon Intelligence is recruiting for an experienced Energy Services leader engineer to take forward our growing Energy Services department as we expand our Smart Building Programmes for clients. The role will include the leadership of our strategy to drive decarbonisation into the built environment for our clients, including delivery of Net-Zero smart buildings, BMS Optimisation, Capital works programmes, renewable energy procurement and energy audits.

The Associate Director role works with the Principal Engineer to lead a team of 12 engineers on the overall commercial development and operational delivery of all client Energy Services programmes, while actively contributing to the future development and direction of our services.

The successful candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of energy services experience – specifically focused on energy efficiency and BMS optimisation programmes, as well as having fantastic client stakeholder management skills.

They will also align with our company values of Courage, Curiosity, and Collaboration. For us, this includes being purpose driven, a great communicator, flexible, adaptable, inquisitive, commercially minded, and great at building relationships. These are the attributes we believe will take us to our vision.

The Role

Key elements of the role will include:

Ownership of the energy services department delivery and commercial plan
Management of ongoing Energy Services programmes for portfolios of buildings
Develop and maintain key client stakeholder relationships at multiple levels to drive programmes forward and develop further opportunities
Coordinate and develop a team of junior engineers
To support and QA monthly exception reviews and identify opportunities for further energy savings across client buildings
Using advanced technical knowledge and skills lead on projects with new client buildings – from initial analysis through to confirmed implementation of identified energy saving opportunities
Develop proposals, pricing and leading on sales calls and meetings for the sale of Energy Services Programmes and renewal of contracts

Desired Experience

8 years + experience working within an energy services environment
Strong team leadership and commercial acumen
Operational team leadership – ensuring KPIs are agreed and achieved
Management of company workload management software for team
Continuous development of systems and processes
Chartered Engineer / Energy Manager BEng Mech Engineering – focus on buildings and plant infrastructure
Energy efficiency and renewable energy industry experience
Project and Programme management experience
Energy auditing of large commercial buildings across multiple client and portfolio types
BMS optimisation and Energy data analysis
Ability to share information in a clear, concise manner
Exceptional time management skills
Client stakeholder management at all levels
Cultural and Values fit

The Culture

The culture of Carbon Intelligence is collaborative, innovative and open. Our employees have described us as ‘a really special business’ and one where ‘people are valued and can both grow themselves and help with our core purpose of driving businesses towards a zero-carbon economy’.

Our clients describe us a ‘breath of fresh air’.

ABOUT Relief International.

Relief International (RI) is a leading nonprofit organization working in 16 countries to relieve poverty, ensure well-being and advance dignity. We specialize in fragile settings, responding to natural disasters, humanitarian crises and chronic poverty.

Relief International combines humanitarian and development approaches to provide immediate services while laying the groundwork for long-term impact. Our signature approach — which we call the RI Way—emphasizes local participation, an integration of services, strategic partnerships and a focus on civic skills. In this way, we empower communities to find, design and implement the solutions that work best for them.

RI includes the four corporate members of the RI Alliance: RI-US, RI-UK, MRCA/RI-France and RI-Europe. Under our alliance agreement, we operate as a single, shared management structure.

Position Summary.

The ERP (NetSuite) Analyst provides data management and end-user support for an organization-wide ERP system and related programs. Supporting staff, end-users, and the Financial Systems Director on data imports, user assistance, training, and software/configuration changes.

Work with technical resources to develop, test, and document software in order to implement and maintain an operational system.
Coordinate and collaborate with functional users and IT/Finance staff to find solutions to problems identified in testing, ensure that requirements documentation is easily understood, and that proper testing of all systems functionality is completed.
Prepare workflow charts and diagrams to specify in detail business process supported by enterprise systems.
Ensure pertinent system, user guide, and training documentation are complete, current, and stored appropriately
Performs other information technology and business analysis duties as required to support assigned enterprise systems.
Uphold and promote RI’s commitment to ensuring the safeguarding and safety of the vulnerable communities we serve.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS

This position will require a demonstrated ability to achieve results in a demanding and fast paced environment.
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business/operations analysis, MIS, Accounting or a related field
Previous experience in related positions or equivalent work and education experience will be considered
Advanced Excel and spreadsheet skills
Familiarity with ERP systems, specifically NetSuite, is highly desired
Comfort with basic principles of accounting
Strong communication skills in English including speaking, reading and writing
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, deadlines, tasks efficiently
Excellent time management skills and resourcefulness with strong attention to detail
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Ability to think critically and creatively
Excellent interpersonal skills, including patience, diplomacy, willingness to listen and respect for colleagues.
Ability to work strategically and practically across multi-cultural teams
Must be capable of working both individually and as part of a team.
RI Values:

We uphold the Humanitarian Principles: humanity, neutrality, impartiality and operational independence. We affirmatively engage the most vulnerable communities.

We value:
Inclusiveness
Transparency and accountability
Agility and innovation
Collaboration
Sustainability

KTN 2025 Strategy


We connect ideas, people and communities to drive innovation that changes lives.

Innovation is complex. The journey from idea to market is not straightforward and requires a diverse range of know-how, investment, market knowledge and research. KTN exists to connect innovators with new partners and new opportunities beyond their existing thinking - accelerating ambitious ideas into real-world solutions.

The future holds both challenges and opportunities. We are passionate about working with innovative businesses to overcome these challenges and shape the opportunities and solutions that follow.

Our vision is to create a network of innovators so powerful its ideas will change the world.

While business is at the heart of our work, our diverse connections span government, funders, research and the third sector. This unrivalled overview and connectivity enable us to be a trusted guide through a complex global landscape of research, development and innovation. Over the next five years, we will build collaborations at a local, national and global level.

Purpose of the role


The role is responsible for designing and delivering KTN’s Integrated Systems plan to ensure it reflects the IT and data requirements to support the ambitious commitments laid out in our five-year strategy.

The role will lead the IT and Data & CRM teams in support of the organisation through a professional high-quality provision of IT infrastructure, telecommunications, business systems and strategic planning of future IT and data architecture requirements to support the strategy and our employees.

The role will have full responsibility for the IT Service Desk, Asset Management, Security/Compliance, including on and off boarding of all staff on IT related matters. It will also be responsible for an integrated data architecture that serves KTN’s data strategy and supports KTN’s communications & analytical activity.

As a senior leader of the Operations Directorate, the role will collaborate with colleagues across the organisation exploring the best and most effective ways of supporting the business’ systems and data requirements.

Roles and Responsibilities
Collaborate to design and deliver KTN’s IT plan, to ensure it reflects the IT requirements to support the ambitious commitments laid out in our five-year strategy.
Provide expert knowledge, experience and an innovative approach to support and develop the IT plan ensuring it is continually appraised and updated to reflect the IT requirements to support the strategy of KTN. Drive KTN to best practice for all software and hardware including all SaaS (Software as a service).
Work in partnership with internal key teams to include Innovation, Insights and Policy, Reach and Engagement directorate.
Work closely with other teams to maximise synergy of systems within the overall IT systems structure.
Take ownership and accountability for the Information Security policy, including developing and implementing best practice in line with Government Communications Headquarters (GCHQ) and National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) guidelines.
Lead and oversee the management of the Data & CRM team.
Provide expert strategic knowledge and inspirational leadership, training and coaching to the team.
Take an active leadership role, developing influential working relationships internally throughout across KTN.
Be the decision maker, in consultation where appropriate, providing strategic and professional leadership on IT and systems related projects and development. Sharing of best practice, driving continuous improvement in compliance with policies and procedures and ensuring that key stakeholders are kept informed.
Continually review technical developments to ensure where feasible that efficiency and fit for purpose are achieved.
Ensure that user requirements are met and communication during the project journey is transparent and realistic.
Responsible for the operational, strategic planning and provision of resource for the delivery of projects and support across the organisation.
Ensure that all suppliers are contracted in accordance with company policy and have the experience and security credentials to reduce any associated risk to KTN as an organisation.
Keep abreast of IT industry changes and legislation to ensure compliance in all areas including Data Protection (in liaison with Data Protection Officer) and Cyber Security standards and recommend the implementation of appropriate advancements.
Responsible for the IT service desk and be available in a hands-on approach. Provide proactive comprehensive solution orientated support to the Executive and Senior Managers teams and staff on all IT matters.
Sharing of best practice, driving continuous improvement in compliance with policies and procedures.
Own, develop and maintain business relationships with all 3rd party providers.
Promote the use of Data Science within the Data & CRM team to deliver insightful data.
Oversee the Data & CRM’s team construction and maintenance of an evolving integrated data architecture and its automations.


Requirements

Experience
Experience of leading and developing strategic programmes to include budgeting responsibilities.
Senior level experience of managing a portfolio of projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Senior level experience of standard network architecture and relevant systems and technologies.
Admin level experience in modern standard software as a service (SaaS) office tools.
Experience in gaining and maintaining Cyber Security standards accreditation.
Experience of change management, proven experience of developing, gaining organisation wide support and implementing robust systems and solutions.
Experience of supporting multi-site offices and large home-based employees.
Experience of cloud only infrastructure based on core services utilising Gsuite and Office 365 on Apple based hardware macOS/iOS managed through JAMF Pro Mobile Device Management (MDM).
Experience of databases, data querying methods and data architecture.
Experience of CRM systems.
Skills
Ability to establish and maintain the confidence, trust and support of IT staff and users alike through periods of significant and organisational change.
Strong inclusive team working approach and understanding of and ability to work with non IT staff to translate organisation and customer needs into successful service delivery.
Strong leadership capability with the ability to effectively lead and motivate a team working in a complex and challenging environment and who need to effectively balance short and long-term priorities.
Ability to look continuously for opportunities for improvement and to develop approaches for change to influence and shape the future direction of the business. Keeps abreast of IT industry changes.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate confidently and build effective relationships
Team player with good relationship building and influencing skills; enjoys working in a collaborative manner in an open, honest, and diverse environment
Capable of working across organisational boundaries and with senior internal stakeholders.
Ability and confidence to make sound judgments, drawing on relevant sources of information.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

Job Title: Research and Data Officer - Resource Governance Index (Maternity cover)
Job Description:
NRGI Background: For the one billion people living in poverty in resource-rich countries, the oil, gas and mining sectors have failed to deliver on the promise of better quality of life. Instead of fact-based public debate, populist promises dominate many political systems. Corruption and state capture have spread, and democracy is under threat. Those who demand accountability face harassment and violence. The climate crisis looms large and the transition to green energy risks replicating governance misdeeds in the sector. Unless governance improves, half of the worlds poor will live in resource-rich countries by 2030.

The Natural Resource Governance Institute (NRGI) mission is to secure a future where countries rich in oil, gas and minerals achieve sustainable, inclusive development - one where people receive lasting benefits from extractives, and the negative impacts associated with the sector are minimized. Intelligent data, capacity building, policy analysis and advice are key tools to delivering impact. Our international staff of more than 90 country and issue experts, lawyers, economists and governance specialists contribute evidence-based knowledge, advocacy, and technical expertise to make gains for the public good.

Job purpose: The Research and Data Officer is responsible for the global coordination of the Resource Governance Index, a flagship project that assesses transparency and accountability of oil, gas and mining sectors of countries around the world. The 2021 Resource Governance Index project is underway and details are available here

The maternity role cover will include management in numerous stages of the project, from data checking and composite index calculation, through to results analysis and development of key findings that will be disseminated to stakeholders, including governments, civil society and the private sector. The successful candidate will be highly skilled in composite index methodologies, project management, data analysis and research processes and in generating evidence from a variety of data types and sources.

Major responsibilities:
Apply strong project project management discipline to effectively manage and deliver the 2021 RGI project, under the leadership of the Director of Research, Data & Learning.
Coordinate primary research for the Resource Governance Index (RGI) in 18 countries, working closely with colleagues and consultants to ensure timely and robust data are collected.
Lead the Resource Governance Index Committee, a body of RGI country project managers from NRGI program countries that meet regularly to prepare for the upcoming stages of the project, share experiences and ensure the project is on-track.
Apply index construction methodologies to translate raw data into index scores and rankings
Compile and organize analysis datasets and provide detailed interpretations of index results, identify areas of further research inquiry
Develop interactive Excel-based tools to assist in the presentation and interpretation of the Resource Governance Index results
Coordinate technical adaptations to the Resource Governance Index website.
Support the development and implementation of the Resource Governance Index advocacy and communications priorities
Support country work streams which utilize the 2017 and 2021 Resource Governance Indexes in technical assistance and capacity development interventions, including through the development of compelling and accessible graphics, presentations and learning resources
Manage the budget so that physical and financial resources are utilized in line with donor expectations and value for money requirements
Manage consultants and vendors, including by developing contracts, managing work flow and performance, paying invoices and budgeting. Collaborate with the Finance team and follow NRGI procurement procedures
Drive continuous improvement of data management and presentation standards across the organization, by supporting application of best data practice
Participate in MEL activities to ensure learning and improvement related to the RGI project
Participate in learning reviews and determining how to adapt future projects
Analyze results and compile lessons learned.
Adopt and apply best practices.
Job Requirements:

Experience. & Technical Skills Required
Minimum 5 years directly relevant work experience in analytics, research and/or data intelligence.
Experience building and managing composite indexes, generating trend reports and interpreting results.
Working knowledge of mining, oil and gas sectors and the governance challenges related to extractive sectors.
Experience presenting data and information through charts and visualization to improve ease of comprehension for a range of stakeholders.
Experience in database design and development and open data platforms.
Experience managing data solutions, both back-end data storage and hosting and front-end content management and user experience.
Ability to communicate well with diverse user groups in a multicultural setting.
Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken are required. French and/or Spanish language skills are desirable.
Education & Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (economics, political science, mathematics, computer sciences, etc.).

Work Environment:Remote working environment dependent upon location and suitable support provided.

Application deadline: Applications should be submitted by way of a covering letter and an up to date CV. Applications will be assessed on a rolling basis up Friday 27 November 2020.

NRGIs Values: NRGI seeks candidates who align with our values:
Integrity

Maintaining our independence and credibility. Willing to speak truth to power. Engaging with respect. Practicing what we preach. Upholding the highest standards of excellence in all we do.
Impact

Strategic and selective in approach. Mindful of context, adapting to changing realities and seizing new opportunities. Looking critically and openly at what works and what doesnt, and why. Integrating that learning into our forward-looking work. Accountable to our mission, the actors with whom we work and each other.
Collaboration

Partnering internally and externally to affect change. Capitalizing on NRGIs comparative advantage. Valuing teamwork, diversity and inclusion. Working with different stakeholders and across different stakeholder groups. Commitment to building the field and inspiring others to act.
Passion

Commitment to social justice. Prudently optimistic that we can and will shift entrenched power dynamics. Dedication, creativity and resiliency in the fact of obstacles. Investing in change makers and strengthening NRGI.
Rigor

Technical competence, intellectual leadership and commitment to quality. Generating and leveraging the evidence base. Interrogating our work. Innovation and initiative to push the boundaries of our field.

NRGI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. NRGI considers all applicants based on merit without regard to race, gender, sex, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Your privacy is important to us and we are committed to collecting, processing, storing and destroying all information in accordance with the GDPR, UK data protection laws and the NRGI Privacy policy

The Commercial and Contract Management Directorate (CCMD) is looking for an Assistant Systems Support Manager to support the Systems Manager. This role is available on level transfer or promotion.

The MoJ spent circa £3.5bn though its contracts in the last financial year, all of which are sourced and managed by CCMD. Isotropic is seeking an experienced Director of Systems Engineering to define, develop and manage all aspects of the critical systems engineering for a range of innovative end-user terminals for satellite communications. Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Engineering and working closely with peers across other engineering disciplines, the successful candidate will have a broad perspective and understanding of satellite or related communications engineering with a view of overseeing and ensuring the successful introduction and integration of new systems. The Director of Systems Engineering, along with the other Engineering Directors, will be jointly responsible to the SVP Engineering for ensuring that the product vision is realised through excellence in execution such that product lifetime quality metrics, manufacturable cost and performance goals are all met, in programs that are delivered within the project budget and on schedule. A key business need will be the dissemination of product requirements into system and subsystem specifications from RF to baseband. The Director of Systems Engineering will evaluate, plan, and implement the company processes, disciplines, and software tools for excellent systems engineering. Related responsibilities include: systems design; systems analysis; adherence to recognized and disciplined generation of top-level specifications and their proper flow down to subsystems; validation; coordination with integration and test teams to ensure the successful interoperation of all subsystems including RF, beam tracking and control, modem integration and interfaces, signal processing, mechanical, packaging, environmental, thermal management, and reliability. A good understanding of overall communications terminal requirements is essential.

The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in building and leading a team in the development of complex systems, with strong managerial and technical capability. Desirable qualities include: familiarity with procedures for achieving product interoperability and connectivity with other systems on aeronautical, maritime and land mobility platforms; modem integration with a dynamically-tracking SATCOM terminal; certifications such as understanding ARINC and DO-160 requirements for aeronautical applications; familiarity with wired and wireless terrestrial communication channels; and regulatory compliance such as for interference mitigation. The candidate should have strong interpersonal, oral and written communications skills, enabling effective coordination among subsystem design, integration, manufacturing, and test teams.

The Director of Systems Engineering is expected to bring a high degree of creativity and problem-solving capability to search outside the box for new solutions to questions in the design, assembly, and mass production of a cost-effective Satcom terminal. In addition, technical leadership is expected in the areas of analysis of complex antenna systems for all-electronic antenna systems and motion-controlled stabilized platforms, and monitoring and maintaining trends of performance across multiple product lines and customer development projects.

Initially they will act as an individual contributor towards the development of the terminals, but will be required to lead and manage a world class systems engineering team that has responsibility for requirement and interface management, configuration and change management, document control within the greater engineering organization.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage and report on the daily activities of Systems Engineering to deliver designs and products on time and on budget
Lead a Systems Engineering team that facilitates scale and growth in line with company objectives
Deliver technology and products that meet performance, cost and quality metrics
Manage the systems design and analysis for all products
Manage the link, cost, and power budgets for all products
Manage the product implementation configurations and documentation
Work with the product line management team and SVP Engineering to generate top-level specifications and properly distribute down to subsystems
Coordinate with integration and test teams to ensure the successful interoperation of all subsystems including RF, beam tracking and control, modem integration and interfaces, signal processing, mechanical, packaging, environmental, thermal management, and reliability
Drive continuous improvement initiatives in the areas of analysis, design, and performance of the systems within our terminal products
Support the certification of products under electrical, environmental, and operational standards
Implement, manage, and control the configuration, requirements, document, and change control processes within the organization
Manage multiple programs/products simultaneously and able to manage through times of conflicting and dynamic priorities
Provide effective and efficient design support during the conceptual design, detailed design, integration, and test phases of a product development program, with the goal of achieving project completion on time and on budget
Prepare and present design and analysis summary material during internal and external design reviews
Contributes towards Company design procedures and corporate policies
Other tasks, as assigned from time to time
Requirements
BS or MS in Systems, Electrical, Mechanical, or related Engineering discipline
10+ years of experience in the fields of Systems Engineering for satellite and/or terrestrial communications and terminals, including modem integration
Strong communications skills
Translation of product requirements and specifications into system and subsystem requirements and specifications
Experienced in writing design and performance reports and summaries
Technically proficient in MS Office products
Strong leadership ability
Other Abilities:
Ability to communicate calmly in a well thought out response, verbal and written
Must have substantial problem-solving abilities
Extensive experience in Avionic component development and release process (Desirable)
Proficiency with standard scientific computing toolkits, languages, and packages, such as Matlab/Python etc. (Preferred but not essential)

Interpersonal skills to effectively work with Isotropic staff internally as well as working effectively with suppliers and customers
Ability to effectively present information in team meetings and design reviews as needed

Familiarity with wired and wireless terrestrial communication channels

Innovation is complex. The journey from idea to market is not straightforward and requires a diverse range of know-how, investment, market knowledge and research. KTN exists to connect innovators with new partners and new opportunities beyond their existing thinking - accelerating ambitious ideas into real-world solutions.

The future holds both challenges and opportunities. We are passionate about working with innovative businesses to overcome these challenges and shape the opportunities and solutions that follow.

Our vision is to create a network of innovators so powerful its ideas will change the world.

While business is at the heart of our work, our diverse connections span government, funders, research and the third sector. This unrivalled overview and connectivity enable us to be a trusted guide through a complex global landscape of research, development and innovation. Over the next five years, we will build collaborations at a local, national and global level.

Purpose of the role


The role is responsible for designing and delivering KTN’s Integrated Systems plan to ensure it reflects the IT and data requirements to support the ambitious commitments laid out in our five-year strategy.

The role will lead the IT and Data & CRM teams in support of the organisation through a professional high-quality provision of IT infrastructure, telecommunications, business systems and strategic planning of future IT and data architecture requirements to support the strategy and our employees.

The role will have full responsibility for the IT Service Desk, Asset Management, Security/Compliance, including on and off boarding of all staff on IT related matters. It will also be responsible for an integrated data architecture that serves KTN’s data strategy and supports KTN’s communications & analytical activity.

As a senior leader of the Operations Directorate, the role will collaborate with colleagues across the organisation exploring the best and most effective ways of supporting the business’ systems and data requirements.

Roles and Responsibilities
Collaborate to design and deliver KTN’s IT plan, to ensure it reflects the IT requirements to support the ambitious commitments laid out in our five-year strategy.

Drive KTN to best practice for all software and hardware including all SaaS (Software as a service).
Work in partnership with internal key teams to include Innovation, Insights and Policy, Reach and Engagement directorate.
Work closely with other teams to maximise synergy of systems within the overall IT systems structure.

Lead and oversee the management of the Data & CRM team.
Provide expert strategic knowledge and inspirational leadership, training and coaching to the team.
Take an active leadership role, developing influential working relationships internally throughout across KTN.
Be the decision maker, in consultation where appropriate, providing strategic and professional leadership on IT and systems related projects and development. Sharing of best practice, driving continuous improvement in compliance with policies and procedures and ensuring that key stakeholders are kept informed.
Continually review technical developments to ensure where feasible that efficiency and fit for purpose are achieved.
Ensure that user requirements are met and communication during the project journey is transparent and realistic.
Responsible for the operational, strategic planning and provision of resource for the delivery of projects and support across the organisation.
Ensure that all suppliers are contracted in accordance with company policy and have the experience and security credentials to reduce any associated risk to KTN as an organisation.
Keep abreast of IT industry changes and legislation to ensure compliance in all areas including Data Protection (in liaison with Data Protection Officer) and Cyber Security standards and recommend the implementation of appropriate advancements.
Responsible for the IT service desk and be available in a hands-on approach. Provide proactive comprehensive solution orientated support to the Executive and Senior Managers teams and staff on all IT matters.
Sharing of best practice, driving continuous improvement in compliance with policies and procedures.
Own, develop and maintain business relationships with all 3rd party providers.
Promote the use of Data Science within the Data & CRM team to deliver insightful data.
Oversee the Data & CRM’s team construction and maintenance of an evolving integrated data architecture and its automations.

What you'll do

The Team

The Cabinet Office is undergoing a significant Digital Transformation. Over the next three years we aspire to make UK Government digital services the best in the world, meeting or exceeding the benchmark set globally by the best public or private sector standards. For us to meet this ambition we are aiming to further improve the conditions, processes and expertise we have in place to be set up for success. This means we need to go much further and faster, and strengthen delivery of DDaT in government.

To support these ambitions we have established a new Chief Digital Information Office (CDIO) directorate for the Cabinet Office to build on existing strengths. The Cabinet Office CDIO directorate is based on six principles to:

Build trust by stabilising services and getting the basics right.

Be the gateway for all non-GDS digital, data and technology services delivered by Cabinet Office.

Provide impeccable service to our users

Drive digital, data and technology thought leadership

Transform ways of working

Build sustainable capabilities

The directorate is organised and led by six teams who work collaboratively to combine existing expertise while simultaneously building new capabilities

You will form part of the IMAC Team that sits under the Delivery Function of the organisation and works closely with the Delivery Managers. You will also work in partnership with the other functions of DaTT such as Cloud Service, Network Operations, End User Compute and the Business Operation Function which include the Commercial and Training teams.

This role is a unique opportunity within the DaTT function. As an IMAC Engineer you will support a variety of small, medium and large projects in close collaboration with the Delivery Managers. You will support the IMAC Operations Managers on office relocation/setups working alongside Cabinet Office Estates and Government Property Agency championing DaTT values.

We currently support over 15,000 users across a range of sites based nationwide and there will be occasions where you will travel to our regional sites with some overnight stays to assist with office relocations and other wider projects.

Supporting the delivery of projects; installations, building Windows laptops, Macbook, android and apple phones, creating accounts, arranging deployments; delivering remote and classroom training and support for users. A good understanding of standard IT technologies and have a strong desire to deliver high quality service

Able to understand and identify problems, analysing and help identify appropriate solutions, taking ownership of problems and proactively resolving technical issues, ensuring you meet business requirements by troubleshooting and diagnosing or escalating faults as appropriate

In this ever changing environment the production and accurate maintenance of documentation is essential to the success of the team and sharing knowledge is encouraged to ensure the team is able to fulfil its objectives.

A combination of service provision and change management knowledge, as an IMAC Engineer you must have:

Proven and detailed experience working in deskside support with experience of Windows, Mac OS devices, iOS and Android phones. Able to build these devices, configure and remotely deploy to users in a timely manner, creating guidance where appropriate.

Isotropic is seeking an experienced Director of Systems Engineering to define, develop and manage all aspects of the critical systems engineering for a range of innovative end-user terminals for satellite communications. Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Engineering and working closely with peers across other engineering disciplines, the successful candidate will have a broad perspective and understanding of satellite or related communications engineering with a view of overseeing and ensuring the successful introduction and integration of new systems. The Director of Systems Engineering, along with the other Engineering Directors, will be jointly responsible to the SVP Engineering for ensuring that the product vision is realised through excellence in execution such that product lifetime quality metrics, manufacturable cost and performance goals are all met, in programs that are delivered within the project budget and on schedule. A key business need will be the dissemination of product requirements into system and subsystem specifications from RF to baseband. The Director of Systems Engineering will evaluate, plan, and implement the company processes, disciplines, and software tools for excellent systems engineering. Related responsibilities include: systems design; systems analysis; adherence to recognized and disciplined generation of top-level specifications and their proper flow down to subsystems; validation; coordination with integration and test teams to ensure the successful interoperation of all subsystems including RF, beam tracking and control, modem integration and interfaces, signal processing, mechanical, packaging, environmental, thermal management, and reliability. A good understanding of overall communications terminal requirements is essential.

The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in building and leading a team in the development of complex systems, with strong managerial and technical capability. Desirable qualities include: familiarity with procedures for achieving product interoperability and connectivity with other systems on aeronautical, maritime and land mobility platforms; modem integration with a dynamically-tracking SATCOM terminal; certifications such as understanding ARINC and DO-160 requirements for aeronautical applications; familiarity with wired and wireless terrestrial communication channels; and regulatory compliance such as for interference mitigation. The candidate should have strong interpersonal, oral and written communications skills, enabling effective coordination among subsystem design, integration, manufacturing, and test teams.

The Director of Systems Engineering is expected to bring a high degree of creativity and problem-solving capability to search outside the box for new solutions to questions in the design, assembly, and mass production of a cost-effective Satcom terminal. In addition, technical leadership is expected in the areas of analysis of complex antenna systems for all-electronic antenna systems and motion-controlled stabilized platforms, and monitoring and maintaining trends of performance across multiple product lines and customer development projects.

Initially they will act as an individual contributor towards the development of the terminals, but will be required to lead and manage a world class systems engineering team that has responsibility for requirement and interface management, configuration and change management, document control within the greater engineering organization.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage and report on the daily activities of Systems Engineering to deliver designs and products on time and on budget
Lead a Systems Engineering team that facilitates scale and growth in line with company objectives
Deliver technology and products that meet performance, cost and quality metrics
Manage the systems design and analysis for all products
Manage the link, cost, and power budgets for all products
Manage the product implementation configurations and documentation
Work with the product line management team and SVP Engineering to generate top-level specifications and properly distribute down to subsystems
Coordinate with integration and test teams to ensure the successful interoperation of all subsystems including RF, beam tracking and control, modem integration and interfaces, signal processing, mechanical, packaging, environmental, thermal management, and reliability
Drive continuous improvement initiatives in the areas of analysis, design, and performance of the systems within our terminal products
Support the certification of products under electrical, environmental, and operational standards
Implement, manage, and control the configuration, requirements, document, and change control processes within the organization
Manage multiple programs/products simultaneously and able to manage through times of conflicting and dynamic priorities
Provide effective and efficient design support during the conceptual design, detailed design, integration, and test phases of a product development program, with the goal of achieving project completion on time and on budget
Prepare and present design and analysis summary material during internal and external design reviews
Contributes towards Company design procedures and corporate policies
Other tasks, as assigned from time to time
Requirements
BS or MS in Systems, Electrical, Mechanical, or related Engineering discipline
10+ years of experience in the fields of Systems Engineering for satellite and/or terrestrial communications and terminals, including modem integration
Strong communications skills
Translation of product requirements and specifications into system and subsystem requirements and specifications
Experienced in writing design and performance reports and summaries
Technically proficient in MS Office products
Strong leadership ability
Other Abilities:
Ability to communicate calmly in a well thought out response, verbal and written
Must have substantial problem-solving abilities

Proficiency with standard scientific computing toolkits, languages, and packages, such as Matlab/Python etc. (Preferred but not essential)

Ability to effectively present information in team meetings and design reviews as needed

Job Title: Research and Data Officer - Resource Governance Index (Maternity cover)
Job Description:
NRGI Background: For the one billion people living in poverty in resource-rich countries, the oil, gas and mining sectors have failed to deliver on the promise of better quality of life. Instead of fact-based public debate, populist promises dominate many political systems. Corruption and state capture have spread, and democracy is under threat. Those who demand accountability face harassment and violence. The climate crisis looms large and the transition to green energy risks replicating governance misdeeds in the sector. Unless governance improves, half of the worlds poor will live in resource-rich countries by 2030.

The Natural Resource Governance Institute (NRGI) mission is to secure a future where countries rich in oil, gas and minerals achieve sustainable, inclusive development - one where people receive lasting benefits from extractives, and the negative impacts associated with the sector are minimized. Intelligent data, capacity building, policy analysis and advice are key tools to delivering impact. Our international staff of more than 90 country and issue experts, lawyers, economists and governance specialists contribute evidence-based knowledge, advocacy, and technical expertise to make gains for the public good.

Job purpose: The Research and Data Officer is responsible for the global coordination of the Resource Governance Index, a flagship project that assesses transparency and accountability of oil, gas and mining sectors of countries around the world. The 2021 Resource Governance Index project is underway and details are available here

The maternity role cover will include management in numerous stages of the project, from data checking and composite index calculation, through to results analysis and development of key findings that will be disseminated to stakeholders, including governments, civil society and the private sector. The successful candidate will be highly skilled in composite index methodologies, project management, data analysis and research processes and in generating evidence from a variety of data types and sources.

Major responsibilities:
Apply strong project project management discipline to effectively manage and deliver the 2021 RGI project, under the leadership of the Director of Research, Data & Learning.
Coordinate primary research for the Resource Governance Index (RGI) in 18 countries, working closely with colleagues and consultants to ensure timely and robust data are collected.
Lead the Resource Governance Index Committee, a body of RGI country project managers from NRGI program countries that meet regularly to prepare for the upcoming stages of the project, share experiences and ensure the project is on-track.
Apply index construction methodologies to translate raw data into index scores and rankings
Compile and organize analysis datasets and provide detailed interpretations of index results, identify areas of further research inquiry
Develop interactive Excel-based tools to assist in the presentation and interpretation of the Resource Governance Index results
Coordinate technical adaptations to the Resource Governance Index website.
Support the development and implementation of the Resource Governance Index advocacy and communications priorities
Support country work streams which utilize the 2017 and 2021 Resource Governance Indexes in technical assistance and capacity development interventions, including through the development of compelling and accessible graphics, presentations and learning resources
Manage the budget so that physical and financial resources are utilized in line with donor expectations and value for money requirements
Manage consultants and vendors, including by developing contracts, managing work flow and performance, paying invoices and budgeting. Collaborate with the Finance team and follow NRGI procurement procedures
Drive continuous improvement of data management and presentation standards across the organization, by supporting application of best data practice
Participate in MEL activities to ensure learning and improvement related to the RGI project
Participate in learning reviews and determining how to adapt future projects
Analyze results and compile lessons learned.
Adopt and apply best practices.
Job Requirements:

Experience. & Technical Skills Required
Minimum 5 years directly relevant work experience in analytics, research and/or data intelligence.
Experience building and managing composite indexes, generating trend reports and interpreting results.
Working knowledge of mining, oil and gas sectors and the governance challenges related to extractive sectors.
Experience presenting data and information through charts and visualization to improve ease of comprehension for a range of stakeholders.
Experience in database design and development and open data platforms.
Experience managing data solutions, both back-end data storage and hosting and front-end content management and user experience.
Ability to communicate well with diverse user groups in a multicultural setting.
Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken are required. French and/or Spanish language skills are desirable.
Education & Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (economics, political science, mathematics, computer sciences, etc.).

Work Environment:Remote working environment dependent upon location and suitable support provided.

About Us

The Financial Times is one of the world’s leading business news organisations, recognised internationally for its authority, integrity and accuracy. The FT has a record paying readership of one million, three-quarters of which are digital subscriptions. It is part of Nikkei Inc., which provides a broad range of information, news and services for the global business community.

We have offices in more than 35 cities, including London, New York, Hong Kong, Beijing, Manila, Sofia, San Francisco and Tokyo. Join us and find an inclusive and fast-paced environment with unique opportunities to support every step of your career.

Role Overview

The FT prides itself on delivering outstanding, proactive and engaging service to its global readership. In order to do so, our teams must receive the highest quality of training in order to improve productivity and effectiveness across our teams by driving adoption of B2B business technologies, processes, skills and tactics.

Our B2B teams are responsible for growing the base of group/corporate subscriptions and helping our customers to engage with the content. In order to do this, there are a number of business systems that provide further insight and support the teams in making strategic and tactical decisions. These systems include a number of internal and external solutions, which provide the ability to view and manage Leads and CRM (Salesforce), visibility of account usage and engagement figures in web analytics systems, contract management (SpringCM + DocuSign), email tracking (Yesware), and Marketing Leads (Marketo), amongst others.

This role will be responsible for the creation of training courses and relevant material in order to support and improve the performance of our B2B teams. Working in this global role, your focus will be on working with relevant stakeholders to gather requirements for the development and delivery of training. In turn, you will also share performance and system improvement opportunities identified from training analysis and evaluation with relevant stakeholders. Stakeholders will include Directors and Board Members.

This role will support a number of global offices, with training often delivered remotely to a variety of roles within Sales, Marketing, Customer Success and Support teams. The role will have direct responsibility for Product and Systems training.

What you will be responsible for

Design and deliver high-quality training courses and material, managing the global roll-out to all B2B teams, ensuring the training meets the learning objectives and empowers our teams to achieve and exceed their targets.

Build and maintain an in-depth understanding of the B2B business and how the FT is used within organisations so that the training may be tailored to effectively support B2B teams.

Be responsible for the systems element of the B2B onboarding program ensuring its effectiveness and ability to accelerate time to competence.

Review existing training materials produced by in house and third parties to determine appropriateness and relevance.

Conduct comprehensive training needs analysis to support the delivery of business initiatives/objectives, such as increased audience engagement

Champion our ‘digital first’ approach that challenges the traditional thinking of classroom-based training being the norm.

Assist with the management of our hybrid Sales Enablement + Learning Management System (Showpad)

Design and utilise measurement tools and feedback mechanisms to evaluate the effectiveness of existing and new training.

Work with regional teams to ensure training alignment globally, allowing for regional differences where appropriate

Create learning materials to support the training that will enable a “self-serve” approach, in order to drive efficiency and end-user ownership

Work closely with product management and delivery teams to support system rollouts, in order to drive adoption and the effective use of business tools

Collaborate with the Head of Sales Programmes on other tasks, as and when required.

Experience/skills you need to be successful in this role

Essential

Proven experience as a system trainer

Significant experience in systems and process-oriented training programme delivery

Excellent track record in designing and executing successful online and face-to-face training programmes

Experience of working with Salesforce Lightning

Experience in managing stakeholder expectations and working with ‘subject-matter experts’

In-depth understanding of adult learning principles and their application in traditional and modern training methods (mentoring, coaching, on-the-job or in-classroom training, e-learning, online, workshops, simulations etc)

Ability to plan, multi-task and manage time effectively

Strong writing and record-keeping abilities for reports and training manuals

Experience of working with global remote teams

Excellent communication and collaboration skills, proven by experience working across teams/projects that have spanned multiple locations.

Experience of working within an Agile environment and/or with Agile development teams

High level of initiative and self-motivation

Excellent Google Suite & Microsoft Office skills

Ability to travel

Desirable

Experience of working in a B2B sales environment

Demonstrable change management skills with cultural awareness

A background in print and/or digital media products

Experience in Marketing or Sales

Training qualification/certification

Experience of delivering “train-the-trainer” programmes

Experience in designing onboarding experiences.

Job description

Organisational overview

Nest is a great government delivery success story. Established in 2010, Nest has been a critical pillar of the government’s automatic enrolment programme, with a public service obligation (PSO) to accept any employer wishing to use the scheme to discharge their automatic enrolment duties.

From a standing start, we have delivered a high quality, low cost pension scheme, open to all, which has not only delivered on its mission, but helped to drive up standards and best practice across the industry. Now with over 6 million members, Nest is playing a critical role in helping people save for their retirement many of them low to moderate earners who may be saving for the first time and moving jobs frequently.

Nest now occupies a place in the market as a major Master Trust, a sector that has grown following the introduction of automatic enrolment and that we believe has great potential for delivering pensions to mass market consumers for many years to come, leveraging scale to offer low cost, modernised services in the context of strong Trustee governance.

To best serve our diverse customer base, it’s important that Nest has an equally diverse workforce and
promotes an inclusive culture. This is in line with the organisation’s values and ensures that Nest is a corporation fit for the future.

Departmental overview

The Risk & Compliance Directorate is made up of six teams and all function as part of the second line of defence. These six teams are Information Security, Compliance Assurance, Enterprise Risk and Compliance Management (including Financial Crime Prevention), Data Protection and Pensions Technical.

The Information Security function consists of 6 roles and is accountable for the development, implementation and on-going maintenance of the ISMS (Information Security Management System) across Nest Corporation, Scheme Arrangement and Nest outsourced IT provider in line with ISO27001. It supports and provides assurance over the implementation of security requirements for Nest Corporation and the Scheme Arrangement by 3rd party suppliers. Information Security collaborate closely with the Enterprise Risk function which is accountable for the development, implementation and on-going maintenance of the risk management framework across Nest and oversight of the management of key risks. The Compliance Management Team is accountable for second line of defence functions with regard to Financial Crime, such as bribery and corruption investigations, reporting and training awareness across Nest Corporation and compliance advisory including FCA compliance management.

The Technical Controls Manager reports to the Head of Information Security. This role is responsible for providing expertise in technical information security controls as part of the second line of defence Information Security team. The successful candidate will oversee and support the design, delivery and management of technical security controls delivered by Nest Corporation and third party service suppliers. They will also support the management of Nest’s ISMS as well as supporting compliance checks on technology based information security controls. This role requires a passion for the technical aspects of information security controls and the candidate will be expected to maintain an understanding of current capabilities and innovations in the field to make sure that Nest maintains appropriate technical controls across its enterprise.

Role requirements

Experience and technical skills

The Technical Controls Manager will be able to demonstrate:
Teamworking skills, capable of collaborating with Information Security team members, members of other teams in the organisation and various dynamic resourcing options (e.g. contractors and consultants) when necessary
Detailed understanding of network technologies and information security technologies such as IDS/IPS, SIEM monitoring and alerting, Firewalls etc. and Information Security domains including Identity & Access Management, Mobile Device Management, Data Management, Data Protection, Security Architecture, Network Security, Vulnerability Management, Anti-Malware, Cloud Security and Software Development
Analytical skills; capable of critically examining security controls to gauge their effectiveness in mitigating Nest’s risk
Experience auditing an organisation's compliance to the technical components of ISO27001 (and other information security frameworks e.g. NIST CSF)
Experience of working within the Financial Services, whilst beneficial, is not essential

Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust (GOSH) is the leading hospital for children in the UK and renowned the world over for its dedication to paediatric research and medicine. This is an exciting time to join the Trust as we have recently launched our ‘Above and Beyond’ strategy which is a 5 year plan to advance care for children and young people with complex health needs.

At GOSH we are constantly planning for the future and we are investing significantly to replace and develop our ICT infrastructure, reshaping the business to deliver the highest levels of performance and best clinical outcomes possible. This extensive strategic investment in Information Management and Technology builds on our existing systems to deliver digital enhancements across all aspects of care. We have a strong enterprise electronic patient record (EPR) which sits at the very heart of the Trust digital footprint.

We have an opportunity for a talented and experienced senior technology leader to join our ICT directorate in the role of Assistant Director of ICT Services.

The Assistant Director of ICT Services will provide senior team leadership and be responsible and accountable for managing and maintaining the delivery of ICT Services, ensuring that GOSH ICT services are delivered to the business, aligned to Trust standards, and performing within KPIs that will allow the Trust to deliver a first class service. The role will cover:

Defining and managing Key Performance Indicators relating to ICT Services.
Managing ICT Service Contracts budgets and pay budgets of circa £2M.
Collaborating with executive officers and senior managers to constantly improve and develop services to the organisation.
Collaborating with the communications team to ensure there is a defined strategy for communicating ICT service-impacting messages to the organisation, ensuring they meet Trust standards.
Providing dashboards and regular service updates to all relevant Boards on service delivery and escalating any service related risks or issues, as appropriate.
Developing robust Service Level Agreements, working with key organisational and ICT stakeholders to ensure the agreed service levels can be delivered.
Constantly reviewing agreed Service Level Agreements to ensure they remain within the service expectations of the organisation provide proposals for change if appropriate and ensure approval is through relevant governance frameworks.
Managing and improving the maturity of ICT Services. This includes building trust wide confidence in ICT’s capability to deliver services in accordance with agreed Service Level Agreements to the organisation.
Working with the other Assistant Directors of ICT to ensure that all ICT Services are delivered efficiently and effectively across the organisation.

This is a crucial role within the organisation and the post holder will play a key strategic role helping the directorate achieve its objectives and deliver results.

This is a challenging role and we are looking for a driven, exceptional candidate who is excited by the challenge and thrives in a busy and ever changing environment. You will be expected to have significant and wide-ranging previous knowledge and experience within the ICT field preferably in a healthcare setting including management of significant operational budgets and a strong track record of delivery.

You will also have exceptional leadership qualities with the ability to lead, manage and motivate your team in addition to strong core values in line with those at GOSH.

Role/Responsibilities
Moody’s Investors Service (MIS) is seeking an MD, Process Excellence/Master Black Belt who will lead the strategy and vision setting towards a unified Continuous Improvement plan globally. This will include driving the implementation of initiatives and best practices for enhancing operations, processes, and efficiency. In addition, this individual will be responsible for measuring and reporting results to ensure business goals are achieved. This work will coincide with transformational work within MIS and Moody’s Corporation (MCO) more broadly. The MD, Process Excellence will:
Evaluate all existing processes across MIS globally: prioritize, sequence and implement recommendations to improve organizational process performance by improving productivity and customer experience, supporting digitization and reducing costs.
Manage and scale the MIS Design Center, which is comprised of full-time and rotational high potential employees who are taught to apply Design Thinking, Lean Six Sigma, and Agile methods and mindsets on transformation projects.
Partner closely with the MD, Product lead in MIS Technology as processes align with the product life cycle with a targeted goal of improving customer-centric delivery.
Collaborate in a matrixed environment across MIS teams as change initiatives are incubated, solved for and implemented.
Create a Six Sigma dashboard/business scorecard with appropriate KPIs to then leverage as we monitor continuous improvement and/or address problem areas.
Coach business leaders in Design Thinking, Lean Six Sigma and Agile management mindsets and behaviors to instill a culture of continuous improvement.
Teach and train designated process, product and data owners to measure, manage and improve processes, develop process/product roadmaps, collaborate with scrum teams to automate and digitize processes where appropriate, and successfully incorporate technology improvements into work processes.
Transformation Strategy
Partner with the MIS Senior Leadership Team to provide leadership and direction to develop and execute the strategy for breakthrough levels of improvement in operational excellence, process capability, continuous improvement and customer satisfaction across MIS.
Work with MIS leaders to establish, measure and monitor business capabilities, baseline key performance indicators, establish performance targets and monitor progress; partner to ensure collaborative solutions are identified for current and future requirements.
Orchestrate and oversee the strategic development, planning and execution of various transformation programs and projects targeted toward improving business performance.
Serve as a transformation change agent by stimulating, communicating and institutionalizing key initiatives.
Process Management
Use quality improvement strategy to inform, develop and oversee the annual project deployment plan, goals, and priorities, in coordination with MIS senior leaders.
Supervise and manage Design Center participants contributing to transformation projects. Coach and manage project teams to:
Define, measure, analyze, improve and manage processes and end-to-end solutions that optimize process efficiency and effectiveness, mitigate risks and right-size employee work effort to provide high quality products and services to Moody’s customers and constituents.
Lead efforts to improve quality and/or minimize process cost. Use data analysis and process modeling to craft appropriate solutions that meet business and customer/constituent requirements. Assess risks associated with current and proposed processes against business objectives and ensure solutions align with the risk appetite and risk management framework.
Work with process, product and data owners to develop and manage all aspects of a process, including roles, responsibilities, training, operations and business systems.
Pilot and introduce new processes in a smooth and effective manner. Mentor individuals and teams to build capabilities to ensure continuous improvement after initial implementation.
Set KPIs for each project team in cooperation with executive and operations leadership and execute on those targets.
Institute, direct and facilitate the improvement process using methods and mindsets, such as: Design Thinking, Value Stream Mapping, Continuous Improvement Process, Kaizen, Statistical Process Control, Six Sigma DMAIC, Design for Six Sigma DMADOV, etc..., for sustained improvements in productivity, efficiency, end-to-end process management and continuous process improvement.
Independently gauge effects and provide regular updates to MIS senior leaders on progress, issues, or needs.
Confirm effectiveness of implemented actions via financial and non-financial reporting.
Lean Six Sigma Mentorship & Skill Development
Teach, train, coach, and mentor selected MIS employees who will participate in the rotational program in the Design Center on the implementation of Design Thinking, Lean Six Sigma, and Agile skills.
Support overall development across MIS executives, managers and employees as they seek to manage processes, data, and products that will drive best-in-class service for customers.
Instruct and oversee teams who will apply Design For Six Sigma principles and methods to creating new processes and building new products and service offerings.
Develop and execute on product/process roadmaps in partnership with MIS Technology and Compliance (and other functional areas as needed).
Certify employees who demonstrate required skills and competencies to earn Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, Black Belt, and Master Black Belt qualifications.
Oversee and report upon all Lean Six Sigma activities, including trainings, certifications and events, in addition to cost savings achieved.
