Interim Change Management Specialist required for a 6 Month contract with a leading Pharmaceutical organisation.

The role will focus on the people side of change - including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures.

You will develop and execute change plans that inspire employees to change behaviours whilst minimising resistance. This will include stakeholder management, assessing organisational readiness and liaison with Internal Communication on communication strategies and preparation of communication tools, as well as the preparation of communication, training and other change management materials.

You will use sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgement and identify innovative solutions to resistance and other complex problems regarding the change in focus.

You will also provide direct support and coaching to senior managers and middle managers, as required, as they support their direct reports through transitions. This will often require communicating difficult or 'hard to accept' concepts and negotiating with others to adopt a different point of view.

Principal Accountabilities
Creation and execution of organizational change management plans on all assigned projects which includes at a minimum:
Leadership/Sponsorship Alignment: Guide and coach leaders and sponsors to establish and maintain the commitment necessary for the change programme
Stakeholder Impact: Proactively work with project teams to identify and assess stakeholders in context of change being introduced. Anticipate and manage stakeholder change readiness and resistance challenges and develop mitigation strategies
Communications: Liaise with the Internal Communication team to develop plans and strategies to support the project. Interact with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and translate the information into change activities
Change Assessment: Complete change assessments and create change management strategy. Work with teams to assess change impact and evaluate user readiness. Identify risks and issues related to Change Management and identify resolution/action plans.
Support training efforts and enable the change successfully

Job Title: Business & Relationship Management (BRM) Corporates - Market Research Associate
Job Description:
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

Department overview:

The role is based within the Business & Relationship Management (“BRM”) group in London, which leads business development and marketing efforts for Fitch Ratings.

The role is within the Fitch Ratings’ EMEA Corporate BRM team, which is responsible for the growth and development of the Corporate Ratings portfolio. This team is responsible for managing Fitch Ratings' relationships with Corporate Issuers, Investment Banks, Debt Advisory firms and Private Equity firms. The team has a primary focus on relationships based in London and also oversees coverage across Fitch’s network of offices in the EMEA region.

Role Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the relationship development and marketing efforts of senior team members and demonstrate the ability to prioritise workflows and adapt to changing deadlines. The principal objective of the team is to generate new Corporate bond and loan rating mandates through direct interaction with Issuers, Bankers, Debt Advisors and Private Equity Sponsors.

Research and develop business development strategies:


Working in partnership with senior team members to research and identify transaction opportunities with Issuers, Bankers, Debt Advisors and Private Equity Sponsors. Development and execution of marketing plans aimed at pursuing opportunities to generate new rating mandates for Fitch Analytical teams. Manage and update databases to produce lists of comparable transactions in order to provide benchmarks for Bankers, Debt Advisors and Private Equity Sponsors.

Research and prepare business development materials


Produce engagement letters, case studies and tombstones for new and existing rating mandates. Create bespoke pitchbook slides for use in client meetings, by liaising closely with senior team members and relationship managers to understand the objectives of presentations. Develop new persuasive business development materials to support marketing efforts including research on clients and gathering previous meeting notes. Ensure slides are updated as necessary. Support senior team members and relationship managers in their negotiation of fees and terms.

Work closely with the Marketing Director and use Marketo to create and distribute regular mailings highlighting new Fitch research to Bankers, Debt Advisors and Private Equity Sponsors.

Capital markets data analysis & Reporting


Utilise data relating to the Debt Capital Markets (provided by Bloomberg, FactSet, Reuters, Dealogic, etc) to monitor market activity. Manage and update databases, identify trends relevant to Fitch Ratings’ business development efforts, and develop tools to support BRM’s wider marketing aims. Assist with competitor intelligence and analysis.

Using both external and internal data, undertake regular analysis of team KPIs, including billing forecasts.

Attend internal meetings, draft minutes, using the information to assist your analysis. Utilise Salesforce to record marketing activity, manage targeted mailing, and measure performance.

Client interaction


On occasions, attend external London based meetings with senior team members and assist proactively in following up on action points. Take an active role in participating in meetings and interacting with external clients, building relationships with Issuers, Bankers and Debt Advisors.

Events


Represent Fitch at internal and external industry events/conferences, with some organisational responsibilities. Network with market participants, gather market intelligence and promote the Fitch proposition.

Qualifications and experience:
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (example, Vlookup, IF functions, Pivot Tables)
Demonstrable knowledge of research, analysis and interpretation of large data sets
Financial industry experience, ideally gained through exposure to debt capital markets, banking, corporate finance, or credit analysis
Degree educated (a finance or business-related subject would be an advantage)
Strong knowledge of preparing marketing/business development materials using Microsoft Word and PowerPoint showing excellent attention to detail
Experience with CRM (Client Relationship Management) systems (ie Salesforce) – and report generation and Excel downloads
Knowledge of Capital Markets data systems such as Bloomberg, ThomsonReuters, Dealogic
Strong communication and presentation skills, verbal & written
Ability to work independently within a strategic framework, with supervision and guidance from senior team members, and demonstrating the flexibility to meet tight deadlines
Team-oriented, with the ability to confidently establish relationships internally and externally within an international business environment
Enthusiastic and willing to learn
Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.

For more information about this policy, please visit the code of ethics and conduct page - http://www.fitchratings.com/web/en/dynamic/about-us/code-of-ethics-and-conduct.jsp

About the job
Summary
The Cabinet Office is undergoing a significant Digital Transformation. Over the next three years we aspire to make UK Government digital services the best in the world, meeting or exceeding the benchmark set globally by the best public or private sector standards. For us to meet this ambition we are aiming to further improve the conditions, processes and expertise we have in place to be set up for success. This means we need to go much further and faster, and strengthen delivery of DDaT in government.

To support these ambitions we have established a new Chief Digital Information Office (CDIO) directorate for the Cabinet Office to build on existing strengths. The Cabinet Office CDIO directorate is based on six principles to:

• Build trust by stabilising services and getting the basics right.
• Be the gateway for all non-GDS digital, data and technology services delivered by Cabinet Office.
• Provide impeccable service to our users
• Drive digital, data and technology thought leadership
• Transform ways of working
• Build sustainable capabilities

The directorate is organised and led by six teams who work collaboratively to combine existing expertise while simultaneously building new capabilities.
Job description
The Live Service Team is an integral part of DaTT. Live Service is responsible for the provision of all Live Service offerings to the Cabinet Office and partner organisations including support for all services, applications and platforms in the production technology environment, and fulfilment of service requests from eligible users, including build of EUC and mobile devices.

Supporting over 14,000 users, we are also responsible for incident management, major incident management, problem management and change & release management on behalf of the wider department and directorate.

The team also works within the ITIL framework, and knowledge of, or foundation qualifications would be useful.

As a Service Desk Analyst you’ll be acting as the first point of contact for all users of the Official platform using an array of Laptop devices (Windows and MacOS operating systems), Smartphones (Android and iOS) and VoIP systems for all telephony and Google Cloud Services for standard office tools. Some specialist applications are also used throughout the estate.

Responsibilities
As a Service Desk Analyst you’ll:

• be the face of DaTT/Live Service providing first and second line user facing support for all IT related issues at our Tech Hub. This will include supporting users with a wide range of experience and knowledge
• be providing over the phone and email, first and second line support to users at locations throughout the UK, utilising an array of remote support tools to resolve user issues.
• build, manage, support, asset track and maintain all associated hardware devices
• track all incidents and requests for change, prioritising as necessary and resolving within agreed timescales;
• create, issue and manage/maintain corporate accounts for joiners/leavers
• work collaboratively across the wider IT Team and DaTT ensuring internal processes are delivered efficiently and reviewed and updated as necessary

We’re interested in people who:

• have experience of working in a 1st/2nd line service desk environment dealing with a varied mix of users
• are experienced in working and solving problems in multidisciplinary teams, using desktop and software management and fault finding resolutions
• are user centred focused and adopt an end user approach by taking ownership and accountability of incidents raised and creating resolutions to deliver an excellent IT service
• have experience in explaining technical issues to technical and non technical people, using and understanding new and emerging technologies to support this
• takes ownership of problems and proactively resolves technical problems, ensuring that technical solutions continue to meet business requirements. Takes full accountability for actions taken and decisions made.
• have a commitment to developing your skills and knowledge so as to provide an excellent service.

The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is a world-leading centre for research and postgraduate education in public and global health. Our mission is to improve health and health equity in the UK and worldwide; working in partnership to achieve excellence in public and global health research, education and translation of knowledge into policy and practice.

Department of Health Services Research and Policy

The Department (headed by Professor Ellen Nolte) was established in 1988 and aims to carry out research that helps to improve the quality, organisation and management of health services and systems. This work extends from establishing the most effective practices and policies, including how care can be best organised and delivered through assessing the quality of existing services and policies, to how improvements can be brought about. It aims to improve the understanding of how health services and systems behave, both for its own sake and as a precursor to more applied research. This includes policy analysis, sociological studies of care and studies of the organisation of care.

The post holder should have excellent quantitative research skills and experience as specified in the job description. This includes experience of different quantitative approaches to evaluation, analysis and experience of writing-up. A postgraduate degree, (ideally a doctoral degree) in a field related to public health is essential.

The post is full time, fixed-term and funded by NIHR SPHR. It’s available from January 2021 for 15 months.

The salary will be on the Academic Pathway salary scale at Grade 6 £40,011 per annum (inclusive of London Weighting). The post will be subject to the LSHTM terms and conditions of service. Annual leave entitlement is 30 working days per year, pro rata for part time staff. In addition to this there are discretionary “Director’s Days”. Membership of the Pension Scheme is available. The post is based in London at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine.

Applications should be made on-line via our website at http://jobs.lshtm.ac.uk. Applications should also include the names and email contacts of two referees who can be contacted immediately if shortlisted. Online applications will be accepted by the automated system until 10pm of the closing date. Any queries regarding the application process may be addressed to jobs@lshtm.ac.uk.

Job Title: Executive Director - Chief Data, Information & Intelligence Officer
Job Description:
Location
12 Endeavour Square, London, E20 1JN

Division
CEO's Office

The Role
The Financial Conduct Authority has been driving significant organisational, people, process and technology change in order to continue its evolution towards becoming a regulator of the future. This involves the ability to use data more effectively to drive our regulatory decisions and build greater internal cohesion across a wide variety of financial services industry players, as well as a broad remit as set by our statutory objectives. Significant improvements in digital enablement, business intelligence, market data, knowledge and information management maturity are being pursued in order to allow the FCA to remain a world leader in financial services regulation and a data driven organisation.

The CDIIO will be a member of the FCA Executive Committee (ExCo), directly accountable to the CEO. The successful candidate will participate fully in high-level FCA management initiatives and, by doing so, will be pivotal in shaping and improving the organisation’s strategic and operational performance.

They will be responsible for ensuring that the digital strategy, delivered by the Director of Technology, is consistent and aligned with the aims and ambitions of the data and I&I strategies.

The role holder will drive the leadership and management of data and digital development to support the safe and efficient design, implementation and use of informatics solutions to deliver improvements in the quality of delivery and outcomes of regulatory, enforcement and associated enabling functions.

The CDIIO will own the FCA Data and Information Strategy and will be responsible and accountable for executing associated plans, ensuring coherence with the Bank of England, Treasury and other associated regulators or infrastructure bodies.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?
This is a unique opportunity to join an internationally respected financial services regulator at a critically important time in the organisation’s development and the financial services sector and to influence its transformation into a regulator fit for the future.

You will need broad and deep data and analytics experience, combined with the leadership experience to influence the wider strategy, and the ability to engage with senior leaders.
Significantly enhance the FCA’s ability to analyse and utilise the large volumes of data which it collects on the firms it regulates (60,000 firms). The Executive Committee wishes to continue to develop sophisticated analytics to make better use of this data and to allow enhanced regulation across the largest to the smallest of the regulated entities.
Develop and maintain a clear and accessible view/ framework of what categories of information are being used, for what purposes, and with what controls and ownership. This is to help people across the organisation understand the full FCA picture, but also to identify potential areas of challenge or opportunity for greater efficiency and improvement of process, insight or approach.
Lead a central Information and Intelligence (I&I) centre of excellence that works with teams across the business to collaboratively improve management of I&I across the I&I life-cycle – identifying local actions and thematic interventions required. Lead on implementation of more thematic interventions (e.g. sponsoring systems changes or driving new approaches to cross-FCA responses to harms)
Lead provision of a service for people across the organisation to highlight areas of potential harm-related concern that are not currently being addressed or have been de-prioritised but may need further review. Ensure the central team is recording these, prioritising and actioning appropriately – either directly or through local teams.
Business owner for key information, intelligence and insight systems, ensuring cross-divisional needs are represented and that systems are adopted and utilised as intended across the business.
This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a major transformation within an organisation that sits at the heart of the UK Financial Services industry. This is a critical and highly visible role with the ability to have impact not only within the organisation but across the sector as a whole.
Alongside the FCA Senior Leadership team peers, continue to drive forward our diversity and inclusion agenda, building a highly inclusive culture ensuring colleagues thrive and organisational outcomes are met.
Organisational leadership - You will work closely with the CEO and your peers to deliver the FCA’s Mission

What will the candidate get from the role?
You will join the FCA’s Executive Committee at an exciting period of change for financial services and its regulation. You will have the opportunity to shape and lead a department of talented and committed people working collaboratively on significant projects and programme of work. You will get exposure to a broad range of issues and will contribute to the wider FCA’s senior leadership team, helping to shape and influence the organisation’s strategy.

Skills/Experience Required
Minimum

We’re a signatory to the Government’s Disability Confident scheme. This means that we guarantee an interview to any disabled candidates entering under the scheme, should they meet the minimum criteria for a role. A minimum criterion needs to be measurable from reviewing a candidate’s CV.
Systems and digital expertise, with proven experience in using data for better technological use, as well as applications integration
Significant track record of working in an environment with high data collection and utilising it in developing a more cohesive organisational strategy
Proven written and verbal communication and influencing skills at executive and board committee levels on issues of broad ranging and technically complex information.
At minimum, an insight into the collection and use of intelligence within organisations with a high volume of critical and sensitive data gathering.
Role model strong leadership behaviours in line with the FCA values and capabilities, embedding the Mission and delivering organisational priorities.
Essential
Extensive experience of leadership and people management, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams through a growth mindset
Exceptional relationship management and communication skills, with the credibility and breadth of vision to operate at all levels of the FCA and ability to earn the full trust and confidence of colleagues
A highly strategic thinker, with the ability to develop and communicate an exciting vision of the future and adapt their communication approach for different audiences
The ability to understand and synthesise a wide range of stakeholder views, constantly listening whilst remaining focussed on the overall goal.
The ability to meet challenging deadlines in respect to both time constraints and budgetary pressures
A strong quality ethic - experience of raising standards, effectively challenging with a view to finding common sense solutions to problems, and delivering high quality outcomes
Strong team management experience, including the ability to delegate and deliver through others
Desirable
Knowledge of the objectives and activities of the FCA.
Successful track record of integrating better cultural and data solutions into large and complex organisations.
Understanding of the financial services market in the UK and how firms operate within it.

About the FCA
We are creating a fair and more resilient financial system. We’re establishing more transparent relationships between financial services firms and their customers, building trust in financial markets and protecting vulnerable consumers.

The FCA’s Values & Diversity
Our ambition is to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the society we serve, helping us to be a better regulator. We serve the public and our decisions directly affect the wellbeing of people, businesses and the UK economy. So, our values matter. They represent the culture we aspire to every day, guiding our judgements, building trust and helping us to be ‘At our best’.

All FCA colleagues are expected to demonstrate behaviours in line with our five values – Deliver in the public interest, Act with integrity, Be ambitious, Work inclusively and Connect and deliver. These are embedded in all roles, and through the selection process we check for alignment to our values. For more detail on our values and core skills, please see here.

As an inclusive employer, we are open to considering flexible working arrangements. Please contact Rupert O’Donovan if you wish to apply for this role on a flexible basis.

Useful Information
The closing date for this role is 23.55 on 1st December.

Odgers are managing this role on our behalf.

To apply go to www.odgers.com/81217. For an informal, confidential discussion about the post, please contact Rupert O’Donovan.

Following shortlisting, selection will be via a two-stage panel interview, and half-day assessment with our executive assessment partners, Mercuri Urval.

Conflicts of interest

All applicants to the FCA are required to demonstrate that they do not have other interests likely to conflict with their responsibilities as an employee of the FCA.

You should declare any potential conflict of interest as early as possible in the selection process (via the named recruitment contact), and also disclose information or personal connections that, if appointed, might be open to misperception.

Any potential conflicts of interest will not prevent candidates going forward to interview but may, if appropriate, be explored during the interview to establish how the candidate would address the issue(s) should they be successful in their application.

Role Purpose
Defines and delivers a client’s information management and exploitation strategy to transform the way an organisation derives value from its data assets, whilst securing and managing them appropriately. The Data Strategist has expertise in data exploitation, data solutions, data management, problem solving and business consulting and analysis. This puts them in a position to advise client organisations on data-driven transformation.

The Data Strategist focuses on the people, process, business change, requirements and planning aspects of data challenges, but will have a good high-level understanding of approaches, techniques and tools in data architecture, data solution delivery and data science.

Understands and distils business challenges in complex environments, providing thought leadership.
Develops and actions data strategies and roadmaps, for example through undertaking maturity assessments and user needs analysis to define a vision and articulate the steps to achieving it.
Considers business and cultural change aspects alongside technical data challenges.
Defines and supports the implementation of an organisation’s data governance framework.
Defines the operating model required to support an organisation’s data vision.
Develops relationships with senior client stakeholders and represents their interests.
Translates business goals into actionable plans.
Communicates complex data challenges and strategies to senior client stakeholders and delivery teams.

Established in 2015, the Global Awards Management Unit (AMU) is a global unit spanning New York, Washington DC, London, Berlin, Bonn, Brussels, Stockholm, Geneva, Nairobi and Amman. It has responsibility for identifying, securing and managing all funding from statutory donors, and was designed as an end-to-end business process owner and support structure for IRC’s grant lifecycle. The Unit is organized into five teams, called ‘pillars’: Strategic Partnerships & Analytics; Program & Grants Support; Compliance & Policy; Business/Program Development; and Training & Curriculum Development.

The Global AMU is a bridge between donors and the field: providing expert technical advice to the field, while maintaining portfolio-level visibility to ensure consistency and compliance, and manage risk. This unit ensures that donor compliance policies and procedures are implemented consistently, and supports all staff working across the grants management cycle for all restricted funding from global government sources. The unit operates within a matrix management system across the teams in the US, Germany and the UK, driving functional integration between all relevant units and staff, in collaboration with the Senior Vice President of the Global AMU and the Senior Vice President for Europe in relation to overarching issues with European donors. The matrix management structure ensures that AMU staff support the Europe strategy and work towards the pursuit of new opportunities, while IRC UK maintains accountability for European funding.

Purpose of the Role

A member of the AMU Compliance and Policy team, the Director (Large Awards and Contracts) is responsible for leading a variety assignments and activities to support organization readiness for large awards and contracts. The Director provides support leading to successful implementation and compliance with donor terms and conditions, and reports to Senior Director, Compliance and Policy.

Key Responsibilities

• Serve as the AMU Compliance and Policy team’s lead for organizational readiness for large awards and contracts

• Liaise with relevant IRC departments to support their alignment with organizational readiness for large awards and contracts

• Provide key inputs to the proposal process to ensure program, structural and operational design for large awards and contracts is in alignment with donor compliance requirements

• Support the large awards and contracts negotiation teams by interpreting regulations and advising on risks

• Oversee assessments of systems, processes, tools, etc., and work with IRC department and field staff to revise existing and/or develop new systems, processes and tools necessary to ensure compliance and strengthen IRC’s ability to win bids and implement projects

• Working closely with country offices, lead and advise on compliance requirements in order to support the country offices’ readiness and ability to implement large award and contracts

• In collaboration with relevant CRRD/RAI leadership, analyze contractual commitments, specifications, and modifications to ensure donor compliance controls are in place

• Provide compliance assistance to the Program & Grants Team implementing large awards and contract, including but not limited to support on negotiation, inception, implementation, closeout, audit file documentation, and donor requirements

• Ensure activities are compliant with donor agreements and relevant statutory regulations and policies including but not limited to FAR, AIDAR, and ADS

• Develop and maintain an IRC global staff roster of contract subject matter experts (SMEs), to be activated to travel or work remotely to assist start-up activities, partner due diligence and capacity building, monitoring, and donor relations

• Travel to conduct training, capacity building, and compliance reviews of activities and projects

• Develop and implement donor specific large award and contract e-learning modules and in person trainings

• Develop and oversee field monitoring team to support large grants and contracts compliance

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Banking, Payments and Innovation Directorate supports the Bank’s mission to maintain monetary and financial stability by using and sharing its expertise to: develop and operate resilient and efficient banking, payment and custody services; set and influence policy; and to promote innovation.

We are at the heart of the Bank both in terms of our core role in Monetary and Financial Stability, and the wide range of internal stakeholders we collaborate with. BPI has a lead role in one and a significant role in four of the Bank’s strategic priorities. The variety and immediacy of the work we do means we are one of the most outward facing and fast moving areas of the Bank, operating the UK's high value payments system (the Real Time Gross Settlement System and CHAPS), maintaining the Bank’s readiness to provide Emergency Liquidity Assistance to banks and other financial institutions, and acting as the 'bank' within the Bank of England for government, UK CCPs and other central banks.

Department Overview

The Collateral Management and Custody (CMC) team sits within the Central Banking Operations Division of Banking, Payments and Innovation (BPI) Directorate.

CMC currently comprises; 3 Operations Technical Analysts, 1 Team Leader, 9 Technical Specialists and 10 Team members.

Whilst based in the BPI Directorate, the team’s work has strong links with the Bank’s Sterling Markets Division, Customer Banking Division and regularly interacts with other financial institutions.

Job description
The Collateral Management and Custody (CMC) team is responsible for the settlement of collateral in support of the Bank’s Sterling Monetary Framework (SMF) and other Official Operations; settlement of custody trades on behalf of other Central Banks, the Debt Management Office (DMO), and other customers; and the asset servicing of the associated securities holdings.

The team has close links to the Bank’s Sterling Markets Division and Customer Banking Division and regularly interacts with other financial institutions.

You will be expected to learn all aspects of the work of the operational roles associated with the above responsibilities in order to provide flexibility and staff coverage.
Supporting and monitoring of daily operations, to ensure the settlement of the Bank’s official operations, to provide liquidity to the market during both normal and stressed conditions through regular operations; and to provide effective asset servicing and custody services to our Clients. Help coordinate testing of the Bank’s contingency facilities to ensure smooth settlement in all operational scenarios.
Produce and present management information on the values and volumes of the work of the team, identifying trends in the data.
Being a source of technical expertise in all aspects of the team’s work; both process and systems related, in order to provide support and guidance for team members in resolving any issues or queries that arise. Providing training and mentoring to team members as well as providing feedback on performance.
Managing change initiatives impacting CMC’s business operations and systems from analysis through to delivery, both in response to Markets’ requirements, technology and the team’s own initiatives. Technical Specialists will be expected to complete the requirements for changes and improvements to CMC’s settlement systems and help implement changes through testing and reviewing test output. Liaising with CMC’s User Acceptance Team, Business Support Team and system vendor would be needed to ensure successful implementation of changes.
Working with the other CMC Technical Specialists and the team to identify operational risks and contributing to the production of risk reporting both within CMC reporting and also wider divisional risk reporting.
Operational excellence and continuous improvement; identifying and driving improvements within CMC as well as promoting a culture of continuous improvement among the team members.
Relationship and Stakeholder management; meeting with our clients and custodians to discuss existing and new business. This includes internal Bank customers as well as external clients from Central Banks to SMF participants and also I/CSDs to other third parties.
Role Requirements

Essential Criteria
Strong organisation and workload management skills including the ability to prioritise and switch between tasks to meet deadlines
Ability to work accurately and to tight (sometimes urgent) deadlines
A proven track record of problem solving including identifying and providing resolutions or recommendations
Good written and oral communication skills, with the ability to adapt as necessary in order to build strong relationships with a range of internal and external stakeholders
A self-starting and pro-active attitude
The ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Desirable Criteria

Asset servicing experience;
Collateral processing and settlement experience;
Project/change management experience;
Knowledge of the Bank’s SMF and other operations.
Experience managing and delivering change or small projects, from the analysis of requirements through to testing and implementation.

Job Title: Director, Clinical Systems and Analytical Reporting
Job Description:
Career Category
Clinical Development
Job Description


The Director, CSAR (Clinical Systems and Analytical Reporting) Analytics is a leadership role accountable for the delivery of both patient and operational analytics and reporting within Global Development Operations. Analytics plays an instrumental role in the progression of clinical programs and supplier oversight and this role will advance and set an enhanced vision focused on modern statistical, algorithmic, and reporting techniques, including those from machine learning, natural language processing, and improved graphical interfaces. The position will have direct global line management and lead a team of analytical analysts responsible for the design, deployment, maintenance of important analytical and reporting capabilities.

The position will work in close partnership with senior leaders from other organizations including clinical study teams, center for design and analytics, and other cross-functional teams to ‘combine forces’ that will meet commitments for “speed to market,” risk-based models/central monitoring, and other company initiatives. In addition, the role will help embed new analytical platforms and construct a future data lake. Similarly, the position will advise and help manage downstream data marts, integrations, and set data governance principles such as confirming to proper structures and data cleanliness rules – building upon the strong framework and reporting solutions which exist today.

Through active service management of analytical and reporting service providers, the Director is responsible for representing Amgen within a key leadership position, and thus will co-chair Operational Management Team and Functional Management Team governance bodies in partnership with Amgen Global Supplier Services to ensure quality and timely service delivery alongside monitoring supplier performance across reporting disciplines.

Importantly, in addition to the leadership and oversight within the development of reporting solutions, the Director and team, will help the business assess trends and collect insights from the data driven approaches. This data intelligence will be used to make meaningful decisions and aid in course of action. As such the role will need to have an extensive background in data analysis, modeling, and superlative communication skills to be able to translate the data signals into meaningful summaries.

The following are key competencies for the Director CSAR - Analytics position:
Strong agility to manage a wide breadth of different reporting service areas and guide staff to emerging needs.
Ability to influence others, make data-driven decisions while seeking input from team members and cross-functional stakeholders.
Understanding and experience with new reporting and statistical techniques (e.g. Predictive analytics, ML models)
Results-driven providing progressive monitoring and tracking to performance against goals, leading actions and accountability to remain on track.
Advanced skills in application software and analytical development methodologies in a validated and regulated system environment
Proficient in analytical, clinical data assessments, and topics of varying complexity in order to present insights based on business acumen and broad subject matter expertise to senior leadership staff.
Strong understanding of regulations which govern clinical system and clinical development practices.
Act as a strong coach, providing constant feedback and mentoring to fellow staff members.
Ability to lead organization change by influencing others across various functions and navigating the team through new processes and/or technical advances.
Superior planning and communication skills; able to plan, set goals and define approach in highly ambiguous situations.
Basic Qualifications

Doctorate degree and 4 years of data analysis experience

OR

Master’s degree and 8 years of data analysis experience

OR

Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of data analysis experience

AND

4 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources

Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree or equivalent in life science, informatics, Data Analytics, business administration or related discipline
Extensive experience in information technologies / data analysis in the Pharmaceutical / Biotech / life sciences industry
Broad experience of working in a global organization
Broad biopharmaceutical clinical research experience (clinical research experience obtained working on clinical trials at a biotech, pharmaceutical or CRO company)
Previous line management experience, including management level staff and strong experience working with analytical and reporting providers.
Previous experience at or oversight of outside clinical research vendors (CRO’s, central labs, imaging vendors, etc)

Responsible for managing and maintaining large Wintel server and desktop fleet across the organization.
Installs, configures, tests and maintains CIS1 hardened operating systems, application software and system management tools for both on-prem and cloud solutions.

Tests application performance for potential bottlenecks, identifies possible solutions, and works with developers to implement those fixes.

Write and maintain custom scripts to increase automation capability.

5+ years of experience as a Sr. Systems Engineer or equivalent.

AWS SysOps Administrator

Drive necessary changes in systems for reporting needs whilst flagging system issues early to follow through to resolution.
Actively involved in the global finance efficiency project, specifically in relation to the UK entities

An experienced Part / Fully qualified Financial Accountant with strong ERP systems and BI Systems knowledge.
Technically competent in US and UK GAAP reporting.
An ambitious, proactive, self-starter with ability to grow in this role and take on increased responsibilities for entity Financials and Reporting, whilst working to deliver within tight deadlines
Commercially aware with an appreciation of key business risks; and
Actively seeks out opportunities to 'add value'.
Strong Microsoft Office knowledge
Strong interpersonal skills and good communicator.

Perks. Gym reimbursement up to £25 per month, an onsite Gym, an Office bar, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries, a dog friendly workplace and the ability to earn £350+ per year for taking care of yourself and more!

On behalf of our client we are currently looking for a Senior Trade and Transaction Monitoring Manager.

The ICT Directorate is responsible for all IT infrastructure and related services at GOSH including IT hardware & software and many clinical and non-clinical IT systems and applications, for example the Imaging suite and Microsoft 365 which encompasses email, Office, SharePoint and Teams. General customer service, including strong rapport building and communication skills

ITIL knowledge – Overview / Foundation

Job Title: New Technology Development Engineer (London OR Leeds)
Job Description:
Summary:
MHPS-EU is responding to the dynamic energy market and changing energy mix by developing products in a wide range of existing and new technologies. The Engineering Team are leading the technical development and evolution of these projects in addition to our core business (gas/steam turbines and generators) to bring added value to our customers. The main areas of development are hydrogen firing and flexible operation; energy storage, fuel cells, grid-balancing (inertia) and carbon capture. We are also working to improve the scope of data analytics and its application to enhance the operation & maintenance of equipment by MHPS “Tomoni”, aiming to deliver an “Autonomous Power Plant”.
The New Technology Development Engineer will report to Engineering Manager/Director and will liaise with other internal teams and product delivery groups within the MHPS group companies and other external companies.
Job Description:
MHPS-EU are seeking a “New Technology Development Engineer” to work and lead the new technology products development area of GTCC (Gas & Steam Turbine) and Thermal Steam power applications.
The New Technology Development Engineer will liaise with other product development groups and teams within MHPS and subsidiary group companies in order to evaluate requirements and develop technical solutions that will meet end-user expectations. They will also work in conjunction with internal customer facing teams, acting as the key Technical Advisor and product advocate for enhancement and upgrades of the power plant.
The role will be required to work and support on Power & Energy Solution Business (PESB) development solutions/products.
The role is required to evaluate/feasibility of the PESB product applications for GTCC power plants.
The role requires strong combustion system knowledge to work with Hydrogen Firing technology.
A flexible and entrepreneurial Engineer will be able to understand and assess the feasibility of products within the MHI/MHPS group as well as researching more developmental offerings from start-ups or EU based organisations. Resulting in package solutions of interest for existing and new customers.
The successful applicant will be responsible for providing the Engineering department with a detailed understanding of a wide range of technologies across the EMEA region. Proposing additional solutions or technologies of interest, and developing a pipeline of novel technologies for review, along with detailed project plans to take them through the evaluation process and beyond.
To demonstrate a detailed understanding of energy systems especially relating to Gas/Steam turbines, as well as:
Combustion Dynamics and design
Energy storage system
Fuel cells
Hydrogen and ammonia production
Carbon Capture
Tomoni Applications
To understand the potential for data-analytics for system monitoring, real-time analysis and predictive maintenance.
Respond to internal and external customer requests for technical clarifications/resolution, using technical product knowledge and analytical skills while adhering to sound engineering principles, standards, practices, procedures.
Identify and evaluate new project development opportunities, ideas and technologies.
Evaluate customer requests, and match to technologies under consideration within the team.
Research and investigate technologies/solutions to supplement existing technology.
Develop project plans from concept to delivery, including technical milestones and outline business cases including:
Coordination of technical due diligence process
Screening/evaluation of technical feasibility/profitability
Manage project progression and identify and resolve issues – escalating when required.
Communicate clearly with multiple departments and internal/external partners to clarify and document all project-related issues allowing progression and evaluation throughout the project life.
Preparation and management of technical documentation, reports, specifications and drawings required to support the project, to the corporate (and external if required) standards.
Analysis of customers and market potential as well as competing or alternative technologies.
Provide commercial teams with technical support for sales and services proposal activities, including tender reviews and negotiations.
Travel typically within EMEA, (and occasionally in other regions) , when required to visit customers sites, partner organisations, presentations or technical investigations.
Development of proactive working procedures for future work efficiency.
Responsible for solving the customer’s technical issues (“end” Customer and “internal” Customer) when assigned by the Engineering leadership team.
To write and or revise Quality Management procedures as and when required.
Ability to understand the voice of customer (VOC) and articulate VOC into executable tasks.
Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.
Customer-focused with agrowth mind-set and proven ability to respond quickly to meet the customer needs.
Ability to work autonomously, take lead in development of solutions, whilst working to deadlines.
Maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity at all times in line with the company values.
To know and implement the quality policy of MHPS-EU.
Comply with all safety policies, practices and procedures at all times.
Protect confidential information by not communicating, disclosing to, or using for benefit of third parties.
Ability to proactively identify and resolve technical issues.
Person Specification:
Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering with a high level of understanding of at least one of the following:
Gas/Steam turbine mechanics and operation
Artificial intelligence and data analytics
Generators
Knowledge and proven experience of energy market.
Ability to plan and develop technical projects.
Ability to prioritise workflow and deliver high quality feedback in a timely fashion.
Effective customer service skills.
Demonstrable organizational skills.
Sound oral and written communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills and team-orientated approach.
Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary team with people with different cultures and nationalities.
Fluency in business English, knowledge of Japanese would be an advantage but not essential.
Ability to produce technical reports in English.
Good knowledge of MS Office suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
You will be able to demonstrate alignment to MHPS Core Values: Discipline & Patience, Creativity & Innovation, Humility & Empathy, Passion & Effort, Accountability & Responsibility, Forward Thinking & Working as One.
MHPS-EU is an equal opportunity employer. It is MHPS-EU’s policy that all persons shall have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement on the basis of ability, necessary qualifications and fitness for work irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, marital status, civil partnership, race, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, disability, age.

About Cyxtera Technologies, Inc.

Cyxtera Technologies combines a worldwide footprint of best-in-class data centers with a portfolio of modern, cloud- and hybrid-ready security and analytics offerings – providing more than 3,500 enterprises, government agencies and service providers an integrated, secure and resilient infrastructure platform for critical applications and systems.
Cyxtera is the secure infrastructure company. By combining a modern, hybrid-ready information security fabric with an uncommonly diverse and distributed footprint of 63 world-class data centers, Cyxtera delivers a secure platform for connecting and protecting dedicated infrastructure, private clouds and public clouds.
For enterprises, government agencies and service providers, Cyxtera offers powerful, secure IT infrastructure capabilities paired with agile, dynamic software-defined security.
Simply put, we’re a new kind of data center company—one with security integrated as a core service offering into the facilities that sit at the nexus of enterprise IT and the cloud. And we’re a new kind of security company—with solutions built for the way we run our applications today
Cyxtera’s secure infrastructure portfolio includes:

• 63 world-class data centers
• A context-aware, identity-centric access control solution that surpasses outdated hardware-defined and perimeter-centric approaches to infrastructure security with a “software-defined perimeter” that increases resilience, simplifies management complexity and reduces costs
• Specialized fraud prevention and authentication services for specific verticals including financial institutions and government agencies
• Advanced investigative and network analytics to help better predict, prevent and detect threats

The Site Manager serves as the central point of contact for all Cyxtera data center technical service and support. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to; service requests from Service Delivery, Service support liaison for clients as well as internal systems and networks, data center security as well as shipping & receiving. In addition, the Site Manager provides day-to-day oversight and leadership of Cyxtera operated data center facilities.

Responsibilities include vendor management of various vendors and suppliers, oversight of maintenance, repair, installation and operation of the facility performed by the data center facilities team provider as it pertains to electrical systems, mechanical systems, capacity planning, project management, customer build-outs, and all other aspects of data center facility operation.

The Site Manager is responsible for managing the daily activities of the data center support team while working in collaboration with the Regional Engineering team, the Central Engineering team and various other internal and external customers. The position reports to the Director, Data Center Operations and will be based in Singapore.

Primary Responsibilities

• Provide leadership to the local data center support team with a broad set of responsibilities; manage tactical and strategic activities with focusing on continuous improvement.
• Responsible for timely execution of data center services such as remote hands, customer installs, and service requests.
• Provides 24 x 7 on-call emergency response & support as necessary for incident management and data center emergency response to maintain the highest level of integrity and availability to data center.
• Manage vendors and contractors to obtain maximum effectiveness and efficiency (safety, cost, equipment longevity, and reliability) and to maintain Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure per manufacturers’ recommendation and corporate specifications.
• Operates and maintains data center to assure 100% uptime to customers.
• Ensures that data centers comply with all local, state, and federal health and safety requirements.
• Ensures consistent risk management, change management, monitoring, and incident response in the data center.
• Development and management of data center budget for maintenance, repairs, capital and general operating costs; bottom-up development of yearly budgets. Negotiation and approval of vendor contracts/agreements
• Works with Sales, Service Delivery and Customers to provide successful build implementations within specified timelines.
• Participates in all Change Management processes including risk assessment and procedural development and review.
• Works closely with the Global Central Engineering team in problem resolution and trending.
• Manages raised-floor capacity, power and cooling in data centers, maximizing revenue space for installed products.
• Manage projects and administration of professional consultants and contractors providing building repair, and capital improvement services.
• Responsibility and oversight for customer implementations, including review and approval of proposed Service Level Agreements and Contract changes.
• Ensure policy and procedure is followed and that all audit requirements are being met daily. Areas of focus include; service delivery, service support, and physical security.
• Act as the escalation point for internal and external client inquiries.
• Responsible for development and implementation of day-to-day tasks related to service level tracking, customer satisfaction improvement, process improvement, perform data center tours and budgetary controls. Consistent with this focus the individual will track operational metrics to provide senior management oversight and control for both snapshot data and long-term trend analysis.
• Works with regional and global operations management staff to leverage existing operational procedures and reference material to expedite implementation, standardize operational methodologies, and facilitate best practices in areas of common interest and business focus.
• Accountable to maintain and evolve internal operational policy and procedural reference documents.
• Operate as a member of the extended data center Operations team to deliver on key business initiatives
• Managing facilities training program and overall staff development.
• Responsible for site safety and environmental compliance.
• Ensures compliance of the data center with various accreditations e.g. SSAE16, PCI DSS, ISO 270001, Uptime M&O. Support various audits in relation of these accreditations.

Experience & Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical) or equivalent experience.
• 15 years of data center support & facilities experience in mission critical environments with 5 years in a supervisory/management role.
• Certifications such as ITIL, MCSE, CCNP, CCSA, CDCP, CDCE desirable.
• Strong management and leadership skills gained through 15+ years’ experience
• managing people, process, and technology.
• Minimum of 10 years of experience with Windows, Linux, Unix, storage and networking technologies
• Working knowledge of data center critical systems, including diesel generators, UPS systems, fuel systems, switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, computer room air handlers, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
• Experience with Vendor Management for outsourcing contract.
• Must have the ability to make solid business decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
• Candidate must display confidence in client-facing situations.
• Responsible for site safety and environmental compliance
• Team player with excellent consultative and communications skills and the proven ability to work effectively with internal and external clients, vendors and consultants.
• Ensures compliance of the data center with various accreditations e.g. SSAE16, PCI DSS, ISO 270001, Uptime M&O. Support various audits in relation of these accreditations.

Req ID: 22043

Investment System Analyst

Salary range: £41,620 - £46,245 per annum

Contract: Permanent

The Finance directorate is offering a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic, self-motivated and highly organised individual to join us at an exciting and busy time in Investment Finance as Investment System Analyst.

The role involves working with our Development, Sales & Marketing, Asset Management and Regeneration colleagues to provide support on monitoring project financial viability through maintaining the systems to be used for the appraisal of schemes and enhance the system performance. You will liaise with the system vendors and ICT staff on any technical issues including system upgrades.

As a valuable member of the team, you will play a vital role in the continuous enhancement of Pamwin system reporting and performance, provide training and support to Pamwin system users and support the Head of Appraisals in the continuous review of schemes viability. To do this, you will need to have excellent IT skills, knowledge of appraisal techniques, an eye to detail and ability to use own initiative.

Collaboration is central to success in this role. We will rely on you to provide Project Managers and Sales & Marketing colleagues project information from Pamwin System to enable them to monitor the project viability and accurate sales forecast. You will also assist the Head of Appraisal in the scheme viability assessment and provide various schedules to be applied in monthly reports for inclusion in the Group's monthly results pack, project appraisals or in Board reports.

This is a varied and challenging role. You will be trusted to act as the Pamwin system administrator ensuring users are properly authorised by the appropriate manager, carry out system housekeeping, ensure that the Pamwin conversion tables are updated, liaise with the internal IT colleagues to constantly improve the appraisal software deliverables, oversee the interface of the Sun system with Pamwin to ensure all transactions are transferred between the two systems efficiently.

You will need to have recent working experience of financial appraisal using Pamwin System. Your advanced level IT skill in the use of VBA and SQL will be invaluable in conveying the right message to the business.

You will need to be a finalist and actively working to be a member of CCAB recognised accounting body.

In return we offer a competitive salary, generous annual leave, health cash plan, season ticket loan, life assurance and a generous contributory pension offer as well as other benefits packages.

To apply for this role, upload your CV and supporting statement. Please note a supporting statement is not a cover letter. You will need to address the behaviours and essential criteria listed on the role profile and provide examples of how you demonstrate these skills and well as your experience.

The Regeneron GCP Quality Management Lead (QML) is a key position that will provide guidance and leadership for preparation and conduct of Regeneron-sponsored clinical trials from the time of synopsis generation and protocol authoring through final CSR. You will build strategic partnerships and direct risk-based quality management activities with Clinical Study Teams. Furthermore, we expect the QML will be responsible for assuring that the Clinical Study Team and all relevant documents are inspection ready at all times. The QML will partner with other members of the GCP Quality department to identify trends through metrics in order to diagnose and remediate systemic quality issues. S/he will also have responsibility for ensuring that no study goes live until all basic requirements are met (including but not limited to executed study plans and live systems (EDC, TMF, etc.)

In this role, a typical day might include the following:


Responsible for leading all aspects of 2-4 studies from a quality perspective within a program in conjunction with business and Associate Director/Director, QML

Lead Quality Risk Management activities on all Regeneron-sponsored clinical trials within assigned studies

Lead Quality Risk Assessment and Control Tracker (QRACT) activities at the time of Protocol development predicated on ICH E6 R2

We review quality risks throughout the study and adjust the plan as necessary

Partner with Regeneron Clinical Study Lead/Oversight Monitoring/CRO to supervise site level quality risks

Participate as an active Clinical Study Team (CST) member

Work with Associate Director and Director, GCP Quality Management Lead, to roll-up study information and trends

Perform periodic TMF reviews to assist teams in achieving a real-time approach to inspection readiness

Participate in Quarterly Quality Metrics Review

Supervise the study Green Light process assuring that no patient is entered into any clinical trial until all study level plans are approved and EDC, IxRS and ePRO have gone live

The Role
The Chief Operating Officer (COO) is a key senior leadership role within the FCA, reporting directly into the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and sitting on the organisation’s most senior decision-making committees, including the Executive Committee. As COO, you will oversee the development of our strategic, financial and business priorities as well as implementing organisational operations to deliver and report against our performance against those priorities. You will ensure financial discipline across the organisation and play a central role in the forthcoming zero-based budget review. You will lead the drive for strong performance and management data to support Board and executive decision-making.

The post-holder will be required to exercise their judgment over complex cross-organisation projects in a highly demanding stakeholder environment, including reforming our ways of working and use of technology in light of the pandemic.

This role will play a central part on the FCA’s transformation, taking the lead on operational changes that will make the FCA as efficient and dynamic as possible. As well as ensuring the right structures, systems and processes are in place to enable this, the COO will drive changes in technology, culture and processes that provide the foundation for the organisation.

Acting as a change agent, the COO will continue to drive forward new ways of working as we adapt to the changing socio-political environment throughout the current pandemic, and post Brexit. Playing a significant role in shaping how we should work in practical and cultural terms going forward.

As a key member of the FCA executive, the COO must be a strong team player and will sit on a number of the Executive Committees, with significant exposure to the FCA Board.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?
A unique opportunity to join an internationally respected financial services regulator at a critically important time in the organisation’s development and the financial services sector and to influence its transformation into a regulator fit for the future.
Organisational leadership – ExCo representative for operations, leading on all strategic and operational activities. You will work closely with the CEO and your peers to deliver the FCA’s Mission

Job Title: UKRI Senior International Policy Manager - Official Development Assistance
Job Description:
Interview Date: 9th December 2020

Background to the Role

What is Official Development Assistance (ODA)?

ODA-funded activity focuses on outcomes that promote the long-term sustainable growth of countries on the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC) list. The main ODA focus for UKRI, managed through the International Development Team, is the Global Challenges Research Fund (GCRF) and the Newton Fund.

The Global Challenges Research Fund (GCRF) is a £1.5 billion fund announced by the UK Government to support cutting-edge research that addresses the challenges faced by developing countries through:

Challenge-led disciplinary and interdisciplinary research
Strengthening capacity for research and innovation within both the UK and developing countries
Providing an agile response to emergencies where there is an urgent research need.

The Newton Fund is a £735 million UK investment Fund, with partner countries providing matched resources within the Fund. The Fund was launched in 2014 and extended and expanded in 2016.

The Newton Fund aims to promote the economic development and social welfare of either the partner countries or, through working with the partner country, to address the wellbeing of communities. It will do so through strengthening partner country science and innovation capacity and unlocking further funding to support this work.

UKRI is the largest GCRF and Newton Fund Delivery Partner, but significant activity is also delivered through the Learned Societies, UK Space Agency, the British Council and the Met Office.

The International Development Team works closely with other UKRI areas such as UKRI International. The team reports to the UKRI International Senior Responsible Officer, Professor Andrew Thompson.

Detailed Role Description

Three roles are available within the UKRI International Development (ID) Team; two are open-ended positions and one is for a fixed term of 12 months. All roles require a similar skill set and support related activities, successful candidate’s preferences, experience and expertise will be used to determine the exact distribution of work.

The main purpose of the roles is to help shape and deliver the Funds by supporting the operation of the GCRF and the Newton Fund. The GCRF and Newton Funds have some very novel characteristics; you will support the design, implementation and management of activities, making an important contribution to the development of the strategy, policies, operations and organisation of GCRF and the Newton Fund.

The roles require a pro-active and imaginative approach as well as excellent planning, engagement and communication skills. You will need to have or be able to quickly gain an understanding of the breadth and complexity of UKRI operations and work effectively with colleagues across the UKRI Councils. You will need to build positive relationships across Councils and with external stakeholders, including internationally.

Posts may include line management responsibilities.

The posts are wide ranging and varied.

Key responsibilities

All roles:

Co-ordinating internal UKRI networks, and working closely with other teams in UKRI
Prepare briefings and provide information and advice on UKRI ODA activities to the UKRI Councils, other delivery partners, the research community (both UK and international), and UK Government departments
Working with, and representing UKRI to, key stakeholders and external networks
Contribute more broadly to the development, management and delivery of the international development team.

International Development Partnerships (Fixed Term, 12-month role):

Contribute to the development of GCRF and/or Newton Fund Strategies, including support for cross delivery partner groups and senior cross-UKRI policy groups
Strategy formulation, stakeholder engagement, facilitation and coordination associated with working on a variety of ODA strategy areas including bi- and multi-lateral partnerships
Developing interdisciplinary research and capacity building calls and running these calls including managing the peer review process
Portfolio analysis, including integration of internal and external information to develop and support the GCRF and/or Newton Fund strategies
Leading and contributing to GCRF, Newton Fund and ODA projects
Developing partnerships with external organisations, including joint programmes and developing relationships within a regional focus.

ODA Policy and Compliance (Open-Ended role):

Lead on the process of continuous improvement to ensure the development and implementation of ODA best practice, policy and compliance, including leading the cross-UKRI approach
Review guidance and best practice for ODA peer review purposes to ensure that councils continue to have the best practice guidance they require to successfully set up, run, peer review, monitor and report on ODA activities and funding
Work with colleagues to ensure that our ODA processes and reporting are fit for purpose for funding assurance requirements
Work with colleagues in the UKRI Funding Policy Team to ensure that new and/or revised funding policies reflect the unique characteristics of ODA funding requirements
Lead on engaging with the Reforming Our Business process to ensure that ODA policy requirements are embedded in new business processes and functions
Work with colleagues in the UKRI Funding Policy and Funding Assurance teams to establish and implement procedures for ensuring organisation eligibility to receive ODA funding from the Councils, particularly for overseas organisations
Provide a focal point for advice within UKRI, other delivery partners and with BEIS on best practice for ODA
Lead projects to develop, implement and promote UKRI ODA policy, responding to external and internal requirements e.g. equitable partnerships, equality and diversity etc
Work with appropriate university groupings and research offices to ensure they are developing and following best practice for ODA activities – particularly through whole life cycle
Ensure the UKRI colleagues have the necessary skills, knowledge, systems and capacity to enable them to fully meet ODA requirements under Newton Fund and GCRF activities.

Preventing Harm (Safeguarding) Policy and Compliance (Open-Ended role):

Lead on the development and implementation of UKRI Preventing Harm policy and compliance, including leading the cross-UKRI approach
Lead on ensuring the policy is responsive to changes in best practice guidance or evolving expectations/requirements from BEIS
Lead on reviewing, evaluating and reporting on the policy’s impact and effectiveness
Actively engage with UKRI research and innovation external community and other external stakeholders – provide guidance and best practice information as required
With UKRI Funding Assurance and UKRI Research Culture Directorate, monitor the implementation of Preventing Harm policy by UKRI funded organisations, including by funded overseas organisations
Contribute to cross-Government safeguarding initiatives, including the UKCDR Safeguarding Project and FCDO-led activities
Work with other funders to ensure, where appropriate, coherence and alignment of approach and expectation
Advise on the cross-UKRI organisational arrangements needed to implement and report on UKRI Preventing Harm policy, including arrangements for incident and casework management
Provide a focal point for advice within UKRI, other delivery partners and with BEIS on Preventing Harm and other safeguarding issues
Work closely with UKRI Research Culture Directorate to ensure alignment with other related policy areas, including bullying and harassment, research ethics and research integrity.

Organization Description

What is UK Research and Innovation?

Operating across the whole of the UK with a combined budget of more than £7 billion, UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world-leading position in research and innovation. UKRI will build on the successful elements from the current funding system and maximise the contribution of each of the component parts to create the best environment for research and innovation to flourish.

Building on success

The UK has a world class research and innovation system. Our expertise spans all fields of knowledge, from the discovery of penicillin and monoclonal antibodies, to the jet engine and the world-wide web. Our inspirational creative industries are strong in art, design and the innovative use of new materials and technologies. Our universities and laboratories produce a disproportionate percentage of the world’s top research, and their academics are highly-sought as international colleagues and co-authors and are among the world’s best at attracting overseas students Nor is this excellence confined to university campuses and research centres. Our engineering, automotive and pharmaceutical industries are successful in part because of the superb graduates they can hire and the top rate researchers that support them.

Our partners

The nine UK Research and Innovation partners each bring unique assets to this cooperation. Innovate UK helps businesses to identify the commercial potential in new technologies and turn them into the new products and services that will drive economic growth and increase productivity; Strong discipline-facing Research Councils encourage breadth and diversity, curiosity-driven research, and priority-driven initiatives; Research England’s work on knowledge exchange will focus on capacity and culture in universities and provide balance to the funding system. It will drive quality and impact through the REF and work closely with its counterparts in the devolved administrations.

Shortlisting and Interview Criteria

Essential:

Research policy: A comprehensive understanding of the work and role of UKRI, and the broader UK and international landscape for research and innovation
Interpersonal skills and relationship management: experience of working with senior leadership, able to develop relationships with senior leaders and a wide range of senior stakeholders
Strategic insight: demonstrate an understanding of the wider political and strategic context, together with experience of strategy development.
Communication: demonstrate strong oral and written communication including experience in provision of high quality written and verbal advice suitable for executive and senior level decision makers
Team working: Ability to influence and persuade others, and to work with people of all levels and to build good relations with them
Leadership: experience of leading activities and teams
Ability to work under pressure: experience of working in a fast-paced environment, dealing with competing priorities and tight deadlines.

Desirable:

Experience of developing and/or delivery of research and innovation calls for proposals, including peer review support and call guidance
Experience of working in an international development/ODA context and an understanding of UK Aid strategy, the contribution of research to overseas development and Official Development Assistance (ODA)
Experience in undertaking desk-based research
Degree or equivalent experience
Foreign language skills
Experience in international/cross-cultural working.

As the posts may involve some overnight UK and international travel the successful candidate will be expected to, and must be able to, undertake such travel as necessary.

UKRI supports research in areas that include animal health, agriculture and food security, and bioscience for health which includes research on animals, genetic modification and stem cell research. Whilst you may not have direct involvement in this type of research, you should consider whether this conflicts with your personal values or beliefs.
