Job Title: Software Engineer (Generalist C++ for Engine, Platform & Framework)
Job Description:
Software Engineer (Generalist C++ for Engine, Platform & Framework)

Position Overview

Our shared technology team are looking for people with a passion for core engine systems in a cross-platform environment.

As a generalist, you have a love for programming and software engineering across multiple platforms to make code easy to understand and maintain, well documented and portable. Through excellent software engineering principles, you can make your code work across multiple platforms and devices as well as projects and products that use our engine and frameworks.

You have a great eye for clean and well-designed code, and you can architect systems from ground up to meet all requirements.

You will be joining our dynamic shared technology team, reporting into the Technical Director, where you will be improving and maintaining existing core systems as well as adding new functionality across our engine and frameworks. You will also be ensuring optimal performance.

You have worked with multiple programming languages, but your main language is C++. You are up to date on the latest developments in the language and have experience with modern C++.

The work we do is fundamental for all our games as well as internal and external tools.

Key Responsibilities

Identify and fix issues in our engine code across several platforms on a variety of devices and operating systems.
Improve and replace existing functionality across our code base.
Re-engineer existing code to meet new and changing requirements.
Implement new technologies.
Own areas of engine code and maintain and support them across all supported platforms.
Improve our tools, workflows and working practices.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience

Excellent C++ knowledge, including modern C++.
Minimum three years of professional experience using C++ as the main language.
Experience with cross-platform development, working on code that is used across multiple platforms.
Experience of writing core engine systems, frameworks and other shared code that is used by other teams, projects, and products.
Experience of developing for iOS or Android is beneficial.
Ability to write clean, maintainable, portable and well documented code.
Excellent understanding of performance and optimisation.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team as well as independently
Experience with other programming and scripting languages.

Studio Overview

Sports Interactive (SI) is a multi-award-winning game development studio and the world’s leading developer of sports management simulations. Founded in 1994, SI became a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA in 2006. Based at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London, the SI team continues to expand as it brings its titles to an ever-growing audience via an increasing variety of delivery platforms.

SI has enjoyed sustained commercial and critical success for its extremely detailed and immersive simulation experiences. Its games are amongst the highest-rated PC titles (according to Metacritic) and frequently occupy both the ‘top selling’ and ‘most played’ charts on Steam.

The Sports Interactive team is diverse and international, bringing together world class and high potential talent with a combined passion and drive for creating genre-defining games. Team members enjoy a flexible working schedule and a relaxed studio environment that encourages a close-knit, collaborative approach to game development.

SI is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI offers a generous benefits package to all full-time team members including gym membership, in-house massage therapy and private healthcare (including dental). The studio is also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boasts one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry with just over 30% of the current full-time team members having been at the studio for 10 years or longer. SI also has many longstanding partnerships with leading charities, local schools and major sporting organisations.

Further information on Sports Interactive, its games and life at the studio can be found at www.sigames.com.

About the job
Summary
The Business Strategy Directorate is at the forefront of the Department’s agenda to join up and reform our services and ways of working by developing innovative approaches to solutions, adopting a strategic approach, actively building relationships, influencing and driving activity to effectively deliver DWP ambitions and objectives.

This is an extremely high profile and exciting area of work that, whilst challenging, is pivotal to setting, embedding and proactively accelerating forward the future vision for DWP.

The successful applicant will have an opportunity to design, shape and landscape the programme of work with colleagues across the Department. Stakeholders include senior leaders (e.g. Executive Team and their representatives), major change programmes, digital, people and capabilities, analysts and business architects.

By collaborating with colleagues both within Business Strategy Directorate and across the wider Department, you will support the Director and Deputy Directors and other senior leaders to understand the key strategic choices that we need to make in order to achieve DWP’s future business strategy.

This role will give you the opportunity to demonstrate new ways of working and influencing with a wide range of stakeholders, embedding and leading multi-disciplinary activity to actively drive the business strategy, ensure that barriers to delivery are understood, choices are grounded in evidence and ministerial priorities are reflected.
Job description
You will lead a small flexible team within the business strategy division, progressing work in two main areas, the roles will require the post holders to:

· Set the direction for DWP through the Target Operating Model (TOM), interim operating models (IOMs) and supporting products, collaborating across the organisation to communicate a coherent vision for service delivery in the future, the sort of organisation we want to be, the capabilities we will need and how we will meet the changing needs of customers who interact with us.

· Lead DWP’s input to wider Civil Service Reform, utilising the champions network in DWP and across Government to influence plans for reform and to ensure DWP views are represented.

· Understand and use the TOM and IOMs to influence and actively progress design decisions, strategic reviews, evidence gaps and alignment with other operating models, through strategic stakeholder engagement to create deep understanding and adherence throughout the business and its functions.

· Help re- set the organisation following the coronavirus epidemic and ensuring the DWP strategy is at the heart of many difficult choices the department needs to make.

· Work closely with colleagues across the department engaged in strategic and transformation activity to develop a coherent plan of long term activity which gets us to our long term vision for the business strategy, ensuring this fits with financial planning (including the Spending Review) and developing tools to measure progress and track performance along the way.

· Build strong positive relationships across and beyond the Department, with external stakeholders and with the Executive Team and their representatives to promote the value of the business strategy, the TOM and supporting products, gaining buy-in and collaboration.

· Identifying the business needs and priorities and developing the right skill sets to achieve the division’s objectives.

Responsibilities
Essential criteria:

You have a track record of strong leadership – with the ability to build high performing teams, understand business needs and respond by identifying the capabilities required to deliver these. You will be comfortable working with ambiguity, working proactively and independently and thrive in a fast-moving, changing environment. Delivering complex work at pace; be flexible in approach and thinking, to learn quickly in a high profile environment.

You are a highly articulate communicator and are able to engage and influence stakeholders internally and externally. Comfortable at communicating effectively at all levels with the ability to adapt your style to ensure maximum impact. You demonstrate the ability to be an excellent storyteller, able to communicate our vision and ambition to a range of audiences and to persuade and inspire colleagues and stakeholders.

You will have experience of engaging and influencing stakeholders internally and externally. Very strong relationship management skills are required – building credibility and a powerful network of partnerships and engendering trust and consensus to enable collaboration at all levels.

You have experience of working strategically. You have strong strategic thinking skills and the ability to focus on the long term whilst understanding and articulating complex issues and collaborating on the development of cross-cutting policy or delivery solutions. You are able to generate new ideas and opportunities; thinking laterally and have the ability to give life to those ideas, negotiating across boundaries to achieve the right outcome. You are able to produce high quality work at pace.

You have a broad understanding of DWP business – you are comfortable with DWP's governance and decision making models at both a process and cultural level.

You have a good understanding of programme disciplines and agile ways of working, ensuring that work is effectively planned, managed and risks mitigated, and that we take a test and learn approach.

You have well developed analytical skills – experience of analysing various complex sources of information and intelligence coherently and succinctly, bringing together a variety of perspectives and sources to identify key trends and emerging issues, as well as the ability to weigh up data from various sources, recognising when to bring in experts/researchers to add to available information.

Desirable skills:
Knowledge of Systems Thinking and how to apply this and other business design methodologies (e.g. soft systems methodology/organisational change approaches). including knowledge and curiosity about how other organisations, both in the public sector and beyond, are leveraging technology to transform the way they deliver value to their customers.
Understanding of the wider business environment into which solutions will land and ensuring alignment to the Departmental Business Architecture and its Capability Models.
The ability to blend a creative and innovative outlook with deliverability, translating and understanding how concepts and ideas are brought to life in a practical setting.
Strong workshop design and facilitation skills and translating outcomes quickly to keep momentum.

Organisation Details

Cabinet Office supports the Prime Minister and ensures the smooth running of government - from developing policy, to modernising public services. We welcome talented people from all backgrounds with the skills and the commitment to build a career in the Civil Service.

The Cabinet Office Purpose is:
• to maintain the integrity of the Union, coordinate the security of the realm and sustain a flourishing democracy;
• to support the design and implementation of HM Government’s policies and the Prime Minister’s priorities; and
• to ensure the delivery of the finest public services by attracting and developing the best public servants and improving the efficiency of government.
The work Cabinet Office delivers is vast and therefore presents opportunities to develop your skills and experience in a variety of critical government agendas.
An organisation of approximately 7,000 employees, the Cabinet Office is a vibrant, modern and exciting place to work, attracting a diverse workforce which represents the people we serve. Our main offices are in London, but we have staff based around the UK.

At the heart of this are our Cabinet Office values. To deliver our Purpose and help make Cabinet Office a great place to work, we all commit to:-

• treating everyone with Respect
• actively Collaborate, and
• build Trust

We have an aspiration to become the most inclusive employer across the Civil Service. We have a number of staff benefits, including flexible working, and access to a number of staff support networks to ensure we meet this.

Business unit information

The award winning Commercial Capability Team was formed in 2014/15 to bolster departments in improving their commercial capability. A new concept for government, we have developed a suite of capability services that central government departments and wider government bodies can access. A Commercial Recruitment Hub has been created, offering a centralised recruitment service for departments to fill commercial vacancies starting from Commercial Managers progressing up to Senior Commercial Specialists. Within this hub there is a pool of centrally-employed and accredited commercial professionals that can be assigned to departments to work on commercial assignments. Once in the role, these individuals have access to training and accreditation programmes, they are assigned their own commercial career coach and benefit from a tailored talent management service. We want to be the best commercial function in the United Kingdom. Thus the Commercial Capability Program has been created to attract, retain, develop and reward these specialists, to ensure we appeal to the best in the commercial sector to come and join us. Along with providing departments with this talent pool, as a Commercial Capability Program, we also support central and wider government in commercial capability training, advice and guidance.

This role will sit within the Commercial Blueprints Team, a team critical to the success of the overall Government Commercial Function (which the Commercial Capability team sits within). It supports Commercial Directors across Whitehall to explore, test, strengthen and articulate their functional strategy and delivery plans in areas such as operational models, organisational models, functional governance and influence, stakeholder relations, systems and technology usage and so on.

The scale and complexity of this function means that we must have data at the heart our work; using insights to underpin commercial strategies, enable effective decision-making and improve the overall understanding of the function.

Working in the centre of government you will influence how the GCF uses data to create insight that improve our strategy, policy and delivery.

Current working from home arrangement apply. Post Covid-19, the role will be based in London (10 South Colonnade, Canary Wharf) or Manchester (Trinity Bridge House, 2 Dearmans Pl, Salford, M3 5BN). If based in Manchester, travel to London may be required on occasion to attend team meetings etc.

Job Description

ROLE OVERVIEW

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a unique organisation at the heart of Government and to create a lasting impact on how we make decisions about business strategy.
Reporting to the Head of Blueprints, you will be a crucial member of the Blueprints team, responsible for delivering functional, operational and commercial insight to internal stakeholders and other Government Departments in order to improve central policy, departmental strategic planning and operational delivery capability.
Working across all Government Departments (and increasingly the Wider Public Sector), you will develop effective data collation, analysis and communication methods. This will involve improving and defining the processes and tools used by the Blueprints Team to analyse departmental data and feed into the wider Blueprint process.

The role offers the opportunity to undertake a varied set of tasks, these include developing departmental specific dashboards, conducting analysis across large datasets to establish benchmarks, identifying trends and generating important insights to develop recommendations that will lead to improvements in the overall commercial functional strategy and operations.

Although there are core deliverables, we would like you to shape the future of the way we conduct, promote and make use of data and insight in our work.

The outputs will benefit the departments who will use these cross-departmental benchmarks and department-specific insights to strengthen their operating model and identify areas of transformation focus. It will also benefit the Function who will assimilate a macro picture of the function, thus informing central functional strategy and priorities.

We are looking for someone eager to learn, motivated and inquisitive about trends, who will inspire others to look to data for the answers. A passion for research, for accuracy, for seeking the story within data and communicating it effectively is key for this role, as is the ability to engage effectively with the senior stakeholders across Whitehall, the wider analytics practice and other colleagues within GCF.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Study data from a range of sources and systems from across Government, providing insightful and actionable reports back to the team and wider colleagues across Cabinet Office.
• Coordinate data collection and data cleansing; ensure data requests from central teams are produced in a way that is aligned to data standards and a common data model. Identify and develop opportunities to improve data completeness, timeliness and quality.
• Conducting deep-dive research to explore and explain emerging trends, providing concise summaries and recommendations based on the insights found.
• Building and managing a network of technical, commercial, legal and policy colleagues across core Government Departments to improve common understanding of data and help create a ‘Community of Practice’.
• Identifying innovative ways of communicating insights to a variety of stakeholders, reflecting the diverse nature of the Blueprint’s customers (from Permanent Secretaries through to less technical stakeholders).
• Suggesting and implementing improvements in the way Government uses data to inform commercial decisions.
• Bolster the team in monitoring departmental spend, benefits/impact analysis and providing internal reports for management.
• Opportunity to help shape internal systems design for cross-Government data visualisation.
• Work with stakeholders from each department to identify, develop and refine management information.
• Issue data requests to departments, keeping track of progress, actions and next steps.
• Provide support and guidance to departments in making effective decisions based on data available.
• Be a good team player who is proactive and able to work effectively with little direction.
• Work with other parts of GCF to improve service and data automation, including working with GCF Data and Insights team to build a sustainable plan for Blueprint’s data over the coming years.
• Maintain and update dashboards for departments and the GCF.

EXPERIENCE / SKILLS / CAPABILITIES

Essential:

• Highly numerate and technically skilled
• A good communicator - ability to engage with colleagues, host workshop/working sessions and the ability to address issues from departments when necessary
• Excellent analytical skills – ability to draw insight from data (with high proficiency in tools such as MS Excel and Power BI to support this).
• Understanding of advanced analytics solutions (NLP, Machine Learning, statistical analysis) including Python or R.
• Knowledge of data visualisation best practices

Based in Skipton House (London), the Provider Development directorate works with regional teams, local health systems and the provider sector to ensure that we have strong and successful providers, working collaboratively within strong and successful systems, in the best interests of local patients, populations and staff. Provider policy sits within this directorate.

We are a friendly team responsible for developing evidence-based advice and recommendations on high profile, important issues to support NHS England and NHS Improvement and the provider sector to make decisions that improve the delivery of care.

Our team looks beyond the headline questions to understand the real issues behind them, drawing on multiple sources of information on the provider sector and our knowledge of the policy and regulatory landscape. We use a range of structured tools to tackle each issue and engage widely to understand different perspectives and move thinking forward.

Our current work programme covers a broad range of high profile and interesting areas, including:
• delivery of NHS long term plan commitments to support small rural acute providers and facilitate provider collaboration with systems
• deep dive reviews into important issues facing providers in response to Covid-19 that fall at the interface between national policy and operational delivery
• policy development and advise on providing-facing issues, including the NHS oversight framework, legislation, independent provider regulation and policy.

The role of the Policy Analyst is to support the delivery of the Provider Policy work programme. This includes analysis and research, project management and support and preparing documents. The role involves working closely with other team members and developing and maintaining good working relationships with colleagues across NHSE&I and with external stakeholders on specific projects. The post holder is required to present complex and conflicting information in a meaningful way and, with support from more senior team members, will develop their ability to present information to influence decision-makers. The role offers opportunities to develop high level problem-solving skills combined with exposure to policy thinking and decision-making at a national level.

About the job
Summary
Do you want to help the UK reach its climate change goals? Do you have a passion for using evidence to underpin policy making? We want enthusiastic professional analysts to join our Energy and Security Analysis team, working on issues that have a real impact on everyone’s everyday lives.

In 2019, the Government set an ambitious target for the UK to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2050. To help us reach that target we need to make decisions now about the way we generate and use energy in the future, as well as ensuring that our energy system is both affordable and secure. Those decisions need to be underpinned and informed by high quality analysis. In the Energy Security and Analysis team, we play a fundamental role throughout the policy cycle, from development through to implementation and evaluation. The team of around 50 multidisciplinary analysts work together using a range of techniques including modelling, appraisal, evaluation and data management, to help set the direction of policy. We are a friendly and encouraging team dedicated to professional development, equality and diversity, and offering an accommodating working environment. Many people in the team have flexible working arrangements, including part time and compressed hours

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Job description
We are looking for a number of professional analysts to join the team. The roles are open to badged Government Operational Researchers, Statisticians, Economists or Social Researchers, OR those who can demonstrate the relevant knowledge and experience to meet the professional membership requirements at Grade 7 level (more details provided under “Person Specification”).

International energy trading and offshore networks

In this role, you will be responsible for building the evidence base to support policy decisions about how we trade electricity and gas with Europe. Your modelling of the energy system and appraisal of the different options for future trade will inform both our negotiations with the EU as well any legislative changes which follow. As we establish a new energy trading relationship with the EU and form new trade agreements with non-EU countries, you will lead our analysis on the role that interconnectors – the undersea cables through which we trade electricity with other countries – will play as we move towards a decarbonised and flexible power system.
Alongside this, you will be responsible for building the evidence base to inform policy decisions about the way that our offshore electricity networks are developed. This is an increasingly important area of focus as the UK aims to quadruple its offshore wind capacity over the next 10 years.

Gas decarbonisation

The way we use gas at the moment – for heating, industry and power generation – will need to change as part of meeting our decarbonisation goals. We are expecting the use of natural gas to decline as electricity takes over in some areas, whilst hydrogen and green gas will play a growing role alongside.
In this role, you will be responsible for building the evidence base to inform how we decarbonise the gas system, with a particular focus on understanding the impacts on gas networks, security of supply and market structures.
Additionally, Net Zero will require the UK’s oil and gas industry to change. An additional part of this role is to support the industry’s transition, considering the impacts on jobs, infrastructure and the changing supply and demand of fossil fuels out to 2050.
This is an emerging work area in BEIS which will add to a growing programme of work on our Net Zero gas strategy.

CfDs

Contracts for Difference (CfDs) are the Government’s flagship policy and delivery mechanism to meet our renewables ambitions and ultimately contribute to our net zero target. The contracts are determined by a series of auctions that have a number of design parameters that need to be developed through robust analysis to meet policy objectives and provide value for money.
This post is critical to successful delivery of those auctions to make sure that we get the renewable electricity generation that we need. In this role you will be responsible for leading a policy facing analyst team to develop the evidence base, input into the auction design and articulate the trade-offs of different choices.
This is a challenging role that will contribute to a high profile policy area with critical delivery milestones in the next 12 months.

Electricity systems modelling

This is a key post for BEIS, working on the department’s model of the GB power market, to ensure the delivery of robust and influential analysis. Achieving net zero by 2050 is likely to rely on electrification of a range of sectors, making analysis of the electricity market key to understanding the overall trajectory of decarbonisation.
Our main modelling tool, the Dynamic Dispatch Model, is used to project generation and investment decisions. The timescale of analysis ranges from the next few years (to inform decisions over e.g. carbon pricing or security of supply) out to strategic analysis of 2050 and beyond. The model underpins all major electricity policy decisions, and its importance is recognised by senior colleagues, ministers, other government departments and industry.
You will be working as part of a multi-disciplinary team, taking responsibility for updating and developing parts of the model, and delivering analysis on a range of different policy areas.

Nuclear policy analyst

The UK’s current nuclear fleet forms an essential part of a diverse energy mix, providing reliable and carbon-free electricity generation. Nuclear policy areas range from new nuclear builds, disposal of nuclear waste, decommissioning of plants at the end of their life, protecting the UK’s civil nuclear infrastructure, exploring the potential of new nuclear technologies and more!
This role sits within the analytical team supporting the two nuclear directorates within BEIS and provides an excellent opportunity to be involved in the delivery of legislation over a range of areas.
You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and be involved with longer-term projects, as well as quick turnaround ad hoc requests for data and analysis, in a role that will involve working with senior policy officials and analysts within BEIS as well as other public bodies and Government Departments.

Responsibilities
In all cases, the roles will provide opportunities to:
• use existing models and analytical tools to build the evidence base and inform thinking in relation to the UK energy system;
• lead analytical work programmes, including developing new analysis and tools – e.g. through developing novel methods or procuring external research and consultancy;
• work with a range of partners, such as legal, commercial and technical specialists from within the Department, across other Government departments as well as external organisations such as Ofgem and National Grid; and
• oversee and develop junior analysts.

Person specification:

We are seeking someone with an enthusiasm for developing and using analysis to help influence policy decisions.

Essential criteria:

• A proven track-record of developing and overseeing high-quality and influential analysis, such as data analysis, modelling, cost-benefit analysis, option appraisals, quantitative research or evaluation.
• Strong communication skills, in particular, around ensuring analysis is accessible to decision-makers and the public.
• Proven leadership and organisational skills to manage analytical workstreams and ensure delivery of both fast-paced work and longer-term projects.
• Strong collaborations skills to work with policy teams and external partners.

Technical requirements:

You must be a full member of one of the analytical professions Government Social Research Service (GSR), Government Statistical Service (GSS), Government Economic Service (GES) and Government Operational Research Service (GORS).
Or
You must be able to demonstrate that you satisfy the eligibility criteria and have the competence at the required grade (Grade 7) for one of the professional bodies. Links are provided to the relevant professions below:

Government Economics Service -
https://civilservicelearning.civilservice.gov.uk/sites/default/files/ges_cpd_-_grade_7_and_6.pdf

Government Operational Research Service - http://www.operational-research.gov.uk/recruitment/competencies/
Government Statistical Service - https://gss.civilservice.gov.uk/policy-store/competency-framework-for-the-government-statistician-group-gsg/
Government Social Research Service -
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/the-government-social-research-competency-framework

To join one of these professions, you’ll need as a minimum to meet one of the following qualification standards:

Statistician: A degree at 2.1 (or above) or an MSc in a subject with substantial statistical content e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Sciences, Business Studies, Psychology, Geography or similar)

Find out more at https://gss.civilservice.gov.uk/careers/joining-us/

Social Researcher: For qualification route, must hold an undergraduate degree at a minimum of 2:1, or 2:2 with a postgraduate degree, in a social science subject. Qualifying social science subjects are those that contain substantial social research methods training (comprising around one-third of modules taken in the course).

For professional experience route, must hold an undergraduate degree at a minimum of 2:1, or 2:2 with a postgraduate degree, in any subject, or hold a degree equivalent, and have at least 4 years’ social research practice experience. Social research practice experience consists of experience working in a research agency, market research agency or specialist research team.

Economist: A degree at 2.1 (or above) in an undergraduate degree with at least 50% economics content, or an MSc in Economics and be able to demonstrate substantial current experience in your career as a professional economist.

Operational Researcher: A degree at 2.1 (or equivalent) or an MSc in a highly numerate subject, or equivalent experience, and be able to demonstrate relevant experience in your career in a relevant profession.

What you will inherit will require shaping and redevelopment, where you will provide Quality counsel for GCP and Research QA, you will also manage all the GxPs (incl. PhV, GcLP, GCP, IMP, GMP), including redevelopment of the quality management system, top level policies and SOPs.

This smaller organization has a vision for their specialty medicinal area (all their NMEs are novel), and this role reports to a VP of Regulatory who will support you build your own vision and the overall quality philosophy in the organization. This VP has their own regulatory objectives to deliver on, so we really are looking for a stand-up professional, who can take the mantle and run with it.

This role is a position which will in time have a full-time team reporting into it, at first it will be semi-virtual, using a mix of contractors and freelancers but as the company grows from their mid / late phase pipeline, this role will also grow into a full QA departmental head leadership role, with eventually full-time Quality / QA Managers / Sr Specialists supporting you!

The company is using a fair number of Contract Labs and Manufacturers, as well as CROs, which will also fall under your remit of course, for Quality Oversight, so working with vendors, on technical agreements, compliance, and OOS/Investigations, or Audit findings, will also be part of this role. Additionally, you will be responsible for the European region, for any inspections preparation and hosting, regardless of which GxP it is.

I cannot think too much of what this role does not include in terms of quality assurance and quality management, so you will have to work with the leadership team to educate, escalate, and prioritize, based on your compliance expertise, and risk-based assessment, to decide where your short-term and long-term efforts will be needed.

Experience & Background

This role is applicable to Director or Associate Director levels ready to take the next step, ideally you will have good GCP and/or exp from auditing, process improvement or quality assurance management roles. Good leadership and people management skills are required.

Equally, we welcome applications from individuals who have led a quality career with a larger pharmaceutical company, and now would like something smaller, where you can have fuller oversight and ownership of all the GxPs and quality / research quality processes.

Package, Benefits & COVID

We have a digital hiring policy in place and you can be both hired and on-boarded remotely, pending the office reconvening. There is a certain amount of flexibility after Covid, in terms of working from home.

The role comes with a competitive salary (even to larger pharmaceutical companies), a decent performance bonus and a stock plan.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Global Go to Market
Job Description:
Who We Are:

Founded in 2005, 2K publishes some of the most popular video games on the planet including Borderlands, NBA 2K, Sid Meier's Civilization, BioShock, Mafia, WWE 2K, XCOM and PGA. Our Global Go to Market (GTM) team is comprised of highly experienced marketing, project management and brand specialists who are passionate about these games and work together to facilitate Global GTM strategies to help to drive sales for 2K's multi-format videogame releases around the world.

2K has experienced phenomenal growth these past few years and its exciting growth has made it one of the leading game publishers in the world. Our success has resulted in international expansion that has warranted the creation of our Global Go to Market team. If you have experience thriving at a company growing quickly and transitioning to meet ambitious goals, please read on.

Role Purpose:

Reporting to the Global GTM Director, the successful Senior Manager will play an integral part of the Global marketing function and will be a key advocate and marketing contact for 2K's territory offices throughout the Americas, Europe and Australia for allocated titles.

As a Senior Manager, Global GTM, you will work hand in hand with other global functions in the development of strategic plans, being the voice and champion for Territory-based marketing teams whilst partnering with them to deliver best-in-class campaigns that meet / exceed KPIs and business goals.

Added responsibilities include pro-actively monitoring campaign performance, conducting sales analysis, managing the marketing communication process and in conjunction with other functions producing and distributing required marketing assets to Territory marketing teams to enable a successful release of each title and a healthy lifecycle thereafter.

Key Responsibilities Include:
Contributing to the development of the Marketing Business Input with the relevant global/territory insights and information to guide the strategy development
Be the expert on the nuances of all key market audiences, insights and needs to input into the Global Marketing Strategy and Creative and to support development of the best go to market plans
Assist Director of GTM to project manage the marketing project lifecycle, communication and process between Global Marketing and Territory Teams (including global and market presentations); focus coordination and project management on EMEA region
Manage individuals or small teams of GTM Managers and Jr GTM Managers, guide the groups thinking and support team growth and learning
Build strong relationships with our internal teams and territories, including our brand team to help develop sales promotion assets
Coordinate on-going Marketing Spend Effectiveness reviews for each stage of the Campaign pre-launch, launch, sustain and holiday to create an deep understanding of territory performance and areas to optimize efficiency or effectiveness looking at media strategy, social, digital, merchandising, events and other key marketing areas
Ensure all marketing materials developed in market are on brand and facilitate approvals with Brand team and other stakeholders as required
Partner with commercial planning in partnership with cross functional teams to identify current business challenges/opportunities and optimize go to market plans as needed
Partner with Global Creative and Brand function to deliver locally relevant creative that addresses defined, and agreed on, business needs


Who We Think Will Be a Great Fit:
Minimum 10-12 years of experience driving global or regional marketing strategy and campaigns at a multi-national company - preferably with purview over EMEA and in coordination with marketing colleagues covering North America, Asia or other regional markets;
1-3 years in the video game, entertainment, retail, ecommerce, consumer tech or consumer products goods CPG industries;
1-3 years of direct management experience and understands providing the right level of guidance and autonomy to direct reports who also have a great deal of responsibility;
Strong ability to multi-task whilst working with varied timelines/deadlines and monitoring multiple budgets;
Attention to detail and high degree of accuracy in recording and reporting;
Excellent oral and written communication in English; intermediate or fluent knowledge in another European language highly preferred;
Diplomatic communicator and leader, sensitive to cultural differences yet savvy enough to persuade, motivate and regularly help problem-solve and resolve competing or conflicting priorities
Must be comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-placed culture; we are growing so rapidly that in many cases we have to "build the plane as we fly"
Self-motivated, independent and a flexible, can-do attitude, not happy with complacency
Professional and mature attitude with a strong desire to succeed
Although not essential, a keen gamer, with knowledge of the video game industry
This is a global function and early or late calls will be necessary in order to work with team members around the world, especially those at our Headquarter offices in Novato, California, USA.
About 2K:

Founded in 2005, 2K develops and publishes interactive entertainment globally for console systems, handheld gaming systems and personal computers, including smartphones and tablets, which are delivered through physical retail, digital download, online platforms and cloud streaming services. 2K publishes titles in today's most popular gaming genres, including shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, sports, casual, and family entertainment. The 2K label has some of the most talented development studios in the world today, including Firaxis Games, Visual Concepts, 2K Marin, 2K Czech, Hangar 13, Cat Daddy Games and 2K China. 2K's stable of high-quality titles includes the critically acclaimed BioShock®, Borderlands and XCOM® franchises, the beloved Sid Meier's Civilization series, the popular WWE 2K franchise and NBA 2K, the #1 rated and #1 selling basketball franchise. 2K is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO). For more information, please visit www.2k.com.

Introduction
Promontory, an IBM company, is a premier strategic, compliance and risk consulting firm for companies across the globe. We are proud to be the home of professionals from top law firms, leaders of regulators and global organisations and specialists across the industry who work alongside leading organisations assisting with their most pressing, sensitive and complex assignments.

We have one purpose; to be a Trusted Partner. Through our values of Superior Expertise, Innovative Solutions and Collaborative Community we seek to provide our clients with solutions to their wide variety of complex problems. Across the business our consultants have a unique blend of legal, regulatory, and management expertise and we are looking to add further experience to our Financial Crime team.

Our team specialising in Financial Crime works across a wide variety of clients assisting in the development and execution of a wide range of financial crime related topics including Anti-Money-Laundering, Sanctions and Anti-Bribery and Corruption.

Your Role and Responsibilities
The Analyst position is the first step in your career with Promontory Financial Group, an IBM Company, which is a premier risk management, strategy and regulatory compliance consulting firm focusing primarily on the financial service industry. As an Analyst, you will have a unique hands-on experience in business development, client work, and other projects. You will be challenged to develop your knowledge in our areas of expertise, and our client’s business issues while building your skills in communications, problem solving, and consulting.

Companies throughout the world seek our expertise in strategic planning, risk management, controls, operations and technology, capital and liquidity, compliance, and governance. We excel at helping clients solve their most difficult, technically complex, and sensitive challenges, particularly those at the intersection of strategy, risk, and regulation. We provide thorough, objective reviews that identify the sources of our clients’ issues and concerns. We work side-by-side with client project teams to implement the changes that address these issues and concerns, including those related to business process and technology.

From our U.K. offices in London, we are often called upon to assist a range of clients from banking, insurance, wholesale markets, credit and financial market infrastructure businesses. Our work involves supporting clients in complying with requirements related to:
Regulatory matters, including compliance reviews, preparing for regulatory visits and interviews, and skilled- person reviews
Risk management
Evaluation of governance frameworks, policies, and processes against industry and regulatory standards
Customer file reviews and remediation programmes
Complex and unique circumstances that require thoughtful, tailored, solutions

Your Role and Responsibilities:
Provide support and research to projects involving strategic qualitative analysis of UK regulatory developments, drawing on your knowledge and experience of the Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) and Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) regulatory strategy and objectives, and financial quantitative analysis of materials provided to us by firms regulated by the PRA and FCA.
Gather, analyse, and interpret data related to the scope of the project. In your analysis and interpretation, you will draw on your knowledge and experience of practices at other regulated firms you have dealt with.
Prepare presentations and participate in crafting other documents for the project team and client. You will align these presentations and other documents with relevant FCA and PRA regulatory standards and good practice for presentations and documents at regulated firms.
Participate in interviews of financial executives, corporate directors, and regulators. Your involvement may entail taking notes of the interviews and turning those into formal records. You will rely on your understanding of current regulatory priorities and standards to help you follow and interpret what the interviewers and interviewees say.
Assist with project planning, team organisation, and coordination.
Participate in business development and in the client strategic planning processes. Your role in this will be varied. Your understanding of our core offering – which includes matters such as governance, risk management, compliance, prevention of financial crime and consumer protection – will help you to make your contribution accurate from the very beginning.
Analyse legal or regulatory requirements, including as developed through administrative or judicial proceedings.
Review and analyse client written materials, such as policies, procedures, and governance artefacts or such as customer onboarding documents or sales records. Your analysis will draw on your knowledge and experience of PRA and FCA regulatory requirements.
Monitor and prepare reports on UK and global financial regulatory developments.
Travel as required to client sites in the UK and internationally.
Time spent travelling varies depending upon the project.
Perform additional duties as assigned.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Superior writing and editing skills with the ability to construct well-founded, clear, and concise analyses and recommendations.
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
Knowledge of PRA and FCA regulatory strategy and objectives.
Understanding of the PRA and FCA regulatory regimes and ability to navigate their published rules and guidance.
Experience of PRA or FCA regulated firms, the issues they deal in their regulated business and the expectations of general standards that apply to such regulated firms.
Knowledge of the key elements of good practice in the core areas of our business, such as governance, risk management, consumer protection, prevention of financial crime and regulatory (PRA and FCA) processes.
Ability to handle complex information, solve problems, and manage multiple tasks.
Ability to communicate effectively with clients and within all levels of the organisation.
Ability to establish and maintain positive relationships and build teams.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Entry level position with demonstrated previous experience with organisations focusing mainly on legal, financial, or regulatory matters.

Job Title: Project Delivery Adviser - The Infrastructure and Projects Authority
Job Description:
Location
Birmingham, London
About the job
Summary
Please note this role is for the Infrastructure and Projects Authority, Government Digital Service supports departments across government with DDaT (Digital, Data and Technology) recruitment.

The Infrastructure and Projects Authority (IPA) is the government’s centre of expertise for infrastructure and major projects. We sit at the heart of government, reporting to the Cabinet Office and HM Treasury. We have a unique view from the centre of the whole portfolio and our purpose is to continuously improve the way infrastructure and major projects are delivered. We aspire to create the best performing project system of any country in the world.

Projects in government cover a very wide spectrum, from massive infrastructure projects such as HS2, through to military equipment, information technology and transformation projects. Additionally, the Government has embarked on a Transition Period after our exit from the EU that has a large portfolio of enabling programmes. The breadth and diversity of our portfolio is greater than any in the private sector.
Job description
You will hold a critical role within the Project Delivery Team of the Infrastructure and Projects Authority, leading challenge and support activity across a number of Departments.

You will have accountability for improving project performance through strategic and tactical support, advice and appropriate assurance of Departmental portfolios. This includes projects and programmes that form part of, or are candidates for, the Government’s Major Project Portfolio (GMPP). The role will have a particular emphasis in developing and providing support to DDaT projects.

Responsibilities
As the Project Delivery Adviser your key responsibilities will include:

• Leading the IPA’s delivery challenge and support across a significant part of the Government’s portfolio working across multiple Departments and project types with an emphasis on Digital, Data and Technology;
• With and through your team, building and maintaining the assurance and approvals framework for your Departments. Engage Cabinet Office and HM Treasury partners to align perspectives, as well as controls, in the interests of successful delivery; representing IPA on HM Treasury approval panels;
• Taking shared leadership accountability for meeting key performance indicators and assisting Departments to deliver their Comprehensive Spending Review commitments while taking a balanced view on wider transformation.
• Build and cultivate strong, trusted relationships with senior stakeholders (e.g. Senior Responsible Owners and Programme Directors) to enable collaborative working relationships. Creating strong professional networks at the heart of government including across other Government Functions (particularly the Government Digital Service) and with HM Treasury.
• Where needed, Support the activity and actions of G6 Project Delivery Advisers on senior/complex projects.

As the pace of technology adoption remains unabated, it is increasingly important for the IPA to ensure our staff have the right expertise to advise on an ever increasing number of digital transformation programmes in order to deliver the Government's priorities.

As a Project Delivery Adviser you should have:

• Robust leadership maturity and excellent management skills. Must be capable of promoting and delivering continuous individual and team development to enhance people capability
• Major project delivery experience, including a robust understanding of the end-to-end project life cycle and the risks that need to be managed in major projects particularly in the DDaT space
• Ability to think strategically in Government, working with senior leaders to maintain oversight and provide challenge and support to project delivery
• Very acute stakeholder engagement skills; confident in influencing and negotiating with both peers and very senior leaders
• A well founded track record in building good working relationships across diverse business areas and functions
• Effective critical thinking and analysis skills for problem-solving;
• Confident and effective personal communication; highly developed drafting skills
• Experience of working to a Project Methodology.
Benefits
• Access to learning and development tailored to your role
• 25 days annual leave + an extra day off for the Queen's birthday
• flexible working options to enable you to achieve the work life balance that right for you
• civil service pension with an average employer contribution of 22%
• training and development opportunities
• interest free season ticket, tenancy deposits and holiday advances
• an in-year bonus scheme
• bike loans
• eye care vouchers

Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is developed vetting.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.

In the Civil Service we use our success profiles to outline expected behaviours and we will use these as part of our wider assessment during the interview process.

For this role, the following behaviours are the most relevant:

• Seeing the Big Picture
• Making effective Decisions
• Communicating & Influencing
• Delivering at Pace

When assessing strengths we will be looking to understand your aptitude for the particular type of work you’ll be carrying out, in particular we are interested in candidates:

• Challenger
• Emotionally Intelligent
• Problem Solver
• Resilient

If successful you must hold, or be willing to obtain, security clearance up to DV (Developed Vetting) level.

Simple, hit apply. We only ask for a CV and Cover Letter/Statement of Suitability to be uploaded to our job portal. Important tip - please ensure that your Statement of Suitability includes how you meet the skills and experience listed in the Person Specification above.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.

The Role

To implement and maintain effective management systems and procedures in the delivery and continuity of service of the Mechanical, Electrical, Transport and Public Health Services to the Tenant, while protecting and enhancing landlord assets within the Building / Estate. To contribute to the management of Health, Safety and Wellbeing for all users of the building/ estate.

Key Responsibilities
Contract Management. Organise and attend Monthly meetings with associated contractors. Monitor, analyse and interpret the correct functioning of plant and systems via the Building Management System or other means. Carry out random checks of critical plant operation. Review Contractors reports and any proposals. Carry out regular audits and inspections of all plant, related areas and equipment. Review contractor’s proposals and switching schedules for electrical shutdown works to ensure optimum level of service to Occupiers and systems. Attend site during shutdowns and essential works as necessary. Attend site as necessary in the event of any emergency work or call out.
Compliance with all current legislation and recommended standards. Verify Contractors Risk Assessments are up to date and appropriate to building and maintenance tasks. Ensure Pressure Vessel Written Scheme is up to date. Ensure Contractors Emergency Lighting Log Records up to date. Management of Water Treatment regime ensuring that Water Treatment Manuals are up to date. Manage status of Lift Inspections and report via Lift minutes. Ensure that all statutory inspections are carried out by the due date and manage/monitor progress of actions via external reports spreadsheet attached to appropriate minutes.
Provide day-to-day technical and operational support to Building Managers and Occupiers.
Support to Building Management with Permit to Work System and check method statements where appropriate. Liaise with Building Management and Occupiers regarding operational and technical matters such as plant shutdowns and work impacting on Occupiers operation.
Review Occupier License Applications. Review and comment on drawings, specification and reports submitted by the Occupiers and advise the Landlord accordingly of any impact on base build operations or any technical or lease concerns. Liaise with tenant consultants on any technical or operational revisions. Monitor tenant fit-out work and liaise as necessary to ensure that work complies with the approved License for Alteration. Carry out random inspection of fit-out works and report, liaise on findings as necessary.
Undertake regular audits of maintenance programme. Review call out sheets and investigate as necessary. Review Concept PPM sheets / reports and investigate as necessary. Carry out random inspections of PPM / reactive works completed and in progress.
Preparation and Management of engineering service charge budgets, to include procurement as per BEL’s policies. Budget control, preparation of relevant specification, raising orders/instructions/ contracts and verifying (processing) invoices. To develop, implement and manage Environmental and Energy Conservation Programmes, (working with others where necessary) ensuring optimum usage of energy. To advise on potential problems, improvements and possible savings. Analyse monitoring & targeting reports and investigate and action as necessary. Arrange independent energy audits as necessary and action recommendations as necessary.
Analysis and management of all engineering data/reports, ensuring that appropriate action/follow up is achieved. Identify & agree specialist consultant roles and review consultants brief on a regular basis. Manage other audit reports. Review actions/progress and monitor monthly via external reports spreadsheet attached to M & E minutes.
Implementation, management and development of the Concept planned maintenance system, ensuring information, plant history, drawings and technical information is accurate and up to date. Develop and maintain the base building asset register. Review and develop site-specific maintenance tasks. Ensure drawing and O & M’s are updated to reflect any changes carried out to the installed systems. Develop, implement and maintain site-specific plant replacement Programme. In conjunction with budgetary control.
To ensure that the production of engineering service specifications, contracts and associated documentation properly represent the service requirement of the premises and are presented and executed in accordance with company guidelines. Prepare contract documentation to include: - Tender Documents, agreements and specifications. Manage tendering procedures. Analyse Tenders. Undertake Post tender interviews. Produce Client Contract Placing Report. Manage contractor closely during mobilization period and through to completion.
To ensure that the WCP Client Services Director and Building Management are regularly appraised of any new developments or issues of a problematic nature. Report on any emergency incident that occurs. Report on any concerns relating to plant operation. Report on any tenant relationship related issue. Report any issue that could or will involve the HSE or EHO.
To ensure new buildings and areas of public realm are handed over in accordance with WCP and BE guidelines and that all manuals are in place as soon as is reasonably practicable.
Set up new utility contracts for handed over buildings and public realm as required.
To ensure that the Property's Electronic Security Systems are fully operational and maintained as per the Manufacturer's guidance and current best practice. Report on any concerns relating to plant operation. Liaise with the Systems Department as required, regarding contract specifications, maintenance regimes, auditing, equipment upgrades, documenting changes etc. Ensure maintenance contracts are in place
To ensure the requisite engineering standards executed in the management of buildings are commensurate with those standards promoted by the Board and detailed in the operations manuals.

Position: Associate Director: Pricing, Access & Tenders

Division/Department: Market Access

Key Accountabilities :

Primary Role

· The Pricing and Market Access Associate Director is primarily responsible for developing optimal pricing and market access strategies for pipeline products, and also supports in-line brands and selected non-promoted brands.

· He/she will play a key part in developing pre-launch plans and securing resources from WW/Global to support effective preparations for launching new brands.

· Understanding the optimal pricing and market access approach (including clinical evidence versus standard of care, NHS budget impact, Cost Effectiveness, Payer attitudes, Reference Pricing, developments within evolving NHS).

· Cross functional working (HEOR, Medical, Clinical, Marketing, Market Research, Homecare Services) as well as the ability to balance these factors in analysis and decision making is required.

· Pro-actively identifies market access opportunities for the organisation through effective planning and development of financially sound business proposals.

· Responsible for liaising with WW/Global colleagues and external stakeholders in order to benefit from their expertise and to gain alignment across functions.

· Builds strong relationships with organisation and industry peers to strengthen BMS image, competitive position and performance.

· Manage an agreed portion of the BMS mature products portfolio (for UK & Ireland), to maximise the value.

· Lead BMS national, regional and hospital level tenders where relevant for BMS portfolio products.

Essential Function Responsibilities

The development and management of portfolio-wide strategies and tactics for an industry leading offering to support pipeline and promoted products, plus mature/non-promoted brands in the UK and Ireland;

Leading and driving excellence in maintenance of value for mature brands/non-promoted products across business units, working together with all relevant local functions and World Wide teams;

Responsible for development and successful execution of local solutions, with input from World Wide teams.

Reports to Director, Market Access & External Affairs;

Mature products portfolio management

· When relevant, work with Business Unit Directors to plan transition from promoted to non-promoted brands;

· Define mature brands value maintenance pricing/tender approaches as part of a wider pricing LCM framework;

· Define and execute market access opportunities for mature brands and obtain local management buy-in;

· Support Corporate initiatives in relation to mature brands rationalisation and implement in UK & Ireland;

· Understand the optimal pricing and market access approach for mature brands;

· Manage BMS pricing tool (APEX or PAS) with Finance team support, and liaise with Customer Service team to update SAP;

· Work closely with Distribution Strategy & Pharmacy Team to ensure product availability in UK & Ireland;

· Prepare sales forecast in collaboration with Commercial Analytics and Finance for all projection/budget cycles;

· Liaise with Regulatory to ensure licenses are up to date;

· Monitor competitor trends.

Tender management

· Define and execute tender strategy for prioritised and non-promoted brands liaising with General Manager, Finance, Business Unit, Legal, and Pricing team colleagues (for prioritised brands);

· Own CBS tool (tender management tool);

· Ensure tender prices are approved in CBS prior to submission deadlines;

· Work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure timely and accurate submission of tenders in CMU tool;

· Act as a point of contact for CMU.

Compliance

· Perform all of the above duties in an ethical and legally compliant manner, adhering to the BMS Principles of Integrity, BMS policies and procedures applicable to the role and relevant local legislation and industry codes of practices.

· Contribute to the effective operation of the company’s quality management system and maintain the highest standards of quality. Ensure all required trainings are completed and documented in the appropriate in e-learning system.

· Alert your line manager or Compliance & Ethics Lead to possible compliance issues.

· Report any adverse events or product quality complaints immediately to Medical Information in accordance with the relevant BMS complaint reporting procedures.

Experiences Desired:

· Good numeracy and analytical skills are essential

· Ability to communicate well researched recommendations and influence senior stakeholders

· Proven track record of strong access performance

· Demonstrated experience in a matrixed team working with peers and superiors

· Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations and being able to make difficult decisions

· Ability to think strategically

· Patient-centric and service oriented mindset

· Strong enthusiasm with a drive to succeed and the ability to work independently

· Ability to drive multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver results

· Business acumen and budgeting skills

· Excellent communicator with strong written and verbal presentation skills

· Leverages external network to ensure BMS adopts and adapts best practice and shares best practice across the BMS portfolio.

Knowledge Desired:

· Life Sciences Degree / Economics Degree / Finance Degree

· Good understanding of the NHS payer environment and how funding flows

· Knowledge and understanding of the UK health system

· In-depth knowledge of UK market access issues

Domain. Experience with business intelligence, analytics, data, or databases required.

Company Description

At Octopus we’re transforming the industries we operate in and improving the lives of millions of people. We’ve built market-leading positions in a number of specialist sectors, including smaller company financing, renewable energy, healthcare and property finance. We employ in excess of 800 people and manage more than £9.1 billion on behalf of more than 50,000 investors. Our products don’t just help real people solve real life problems, they also make a positive impact on the world around us.

The Octopus Group incorporates Octopus Energy, Octopus Renewables, Octopus Real Estate, Octopus Investments, Octopus Ventures and Octopus Labs. Our aim is to have an impact in everything we do, and to make a vital contribution to the UK economy by helping people, companies and institutions generate wealth. And we’re always on the look-out for smart, talented people who share our values.

Job Description

Octopus Renewables

Octopus Renewables sources, invests in, and actively manages a wide range of utility scale energy assets. We are looking to expand our team as we continue to scale our investments base.

Since entering the renewables market in 2010, Octopus Renewables has grown to become the largest investor of solar power in Europe, and a leading investor in onshore wind. We currently manage a global portfolio of over £3bn renewable energy assets. The operational portfolio includes over 300 energy generating companies, delivering revenue in excess of £250m pa. The operational activities include solar power parks, wind farms and gas fired peaking generators.

Our energy investment and asset management team of c.70 professionals is one of the largest and most experienced in Europe. The team is structured to support our rapid growth ambitions and long-term ownership of energy assets.

About the role

We are looking for an experienced Asset Manager to take a key role in managing the assessment of the technical and contractual parameters of new acquisitions and managing new assets through the transaction process and onboarding them into the Octopus Renewables’ portfolio.

Reporting to the Solar Asset Director in the Octopus Renewables Asset Management team, she/he will advise and be responsible for the management of new deals as they are onboarded in the operational portfolio. She/he will be required to manage a range of stakeholders to ensure each project meets the necessary standards required and allow for the smooth transition of new assets into the operational portfolio. The role will be London based with travel to Europe required on occasion.

Whilst we are looking for a permanent appointment we will consider fixed term contract. Please advise in your covering note whether you are looking for a permanent or fixed term contract.

Outline of responsibilities
Work closely with investment teams to identify contractual and/or commercial risks with new deals, in the process preparing the asset management teams for asset on-boarding
Development and management of due diligence tools and the asset risk register throughout the process.
Manage asset management team engagement in the process, ensuring appropriate procedures are in place to allow for the efficient assessment of new projects
Maintain and enhance the risk monitoring framework in place, designed to identify any issues early and resolve them in a timely fashion
Design and implement processes to provide necessary rigour and enable appropriate technical and commercial input from the asset management team. Including stage-gate and checklist creation and management
Review contractual structure on new deals to ensure deals are appropriately structured for ongoing operational management of the assets
Management of relevant technical advisors throughout the process to ensure scope is focused on critical risks
Perform initial risk assessments of new counterparties through a pre-qualifying questionnaire process
Summarise key areas of risk in new deals to senior management to support investment process
Prepare new assets for onboarding into the operational portfolio, including dataroom creation and management, system preparation and awareness of key personnel
Support internal Octopus fund reporting
Qualifications
Good experience of renewable energy industry, with a particular focus on solar
Significant knowledge of typical project contractual frameworks (including SPAs, PPA, O&M and EPC contracts), the regulatory environment and how the industry operates
Ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines on multiple projects simultaneously
He/she will be an excellent communicator at all levels, particularly when translating technical information for non-technical teams.
Flexibility and “can do” attitude
Willingness to train and support others
Able to critically examine and question information from a variety of sources
High commercial and numerical acumen
Additional Information

Our Values and DNA

At Octopus we don’t just focus on what we do but also how we do it. Everyone shares our values of being straightforward, helpful and bold. And while these are the principles that guide us as an organisation, our DNA goes even further, by revealing our inner strength:

We are loyal: we fully buy-in to the company’s vision and believe in everything that Octopus stands for. We are respectful: we live and breathe the Octopus values of being helpful, straightforward and bold. We are resilient: we have an inner strength that means we never give in We are intellectually curious: we seek to understand how the world works and we’re always learning, adapting and improving We understand who our customers are: and because we know them really well, we always give them our very best.

What we offer

Octopus has built an exciting and inclusive high-performance culture where employees feel empowered. This means we welcome discussions around flexible working hours. We also understand the value of diversity, and we have a team dedicated to promoting gender, ethnic, socio-economic, LGBT and disability equality, to make sure we back up our words with actions. All Octopus employees are given the opportunity to develop new skills, aim higher and accelerate their careers.

Job Title: Risk Management/Compliance – Independence Manager (Business Relationships) - London, Birmingham, Leeds
Job Description:
The opportunity

The UK Independence Team, which forms part of the Risk Management (RM) Group of EY UK, currently has a permanent, full-time vacancy for a Risk Management - Independence Manager. This is a great opportunity to join a wonderful and diverse team that is very much central to the firm, at a time of significant regulatory change within the UK audit profession.

Applications are considered for individuals seeking a permanent, full-time role.

Individuals with prior independence, compliance, audit or other relevant regulatory experience are encouraged to apply.

Team / Department

Within the professional services environment, appropriate risk management is fundamental to the successful delivery of our client services and promotion and protection of our brand. Within EY, the Independence Team forms part of the Risk Management (RM) Group and reports directly to senior management. There are currently almost 30 members in the Independence Team (including conflicts) and a combined total of well over 100 individuals within RM.

The Independence Team is responsible for ensuring EY UK and Ireland maintain compliance with auditor independence rules and regulations imposed by external regulatory bodies (including the UK Financial Reporting Council, US Securities and Exchange Commission, US Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, Irish Auditing & Accounting Supervisory Authority, and the International Ethics Standards Board for Accountants) as well as Global EY Independence and related rules applicable to all EY member firms. This includes ensuring that new audit clients and engagements can be accepted by the firm and do not result in an ethical, legal or regulatory conflict.

Your key responsibilities

Your day to day responsibilities will be varied and cover a broad spectrum of the activities undertaken by the Independence function expected of a Manager, including at least some of the following:
Management/coaching of junior members of the Business Relationship team
Review and approval of business relationships entered by the firm
Answering technical Independence queries from the business, and others within the Independence team, with respect to business relationship matters
Production of reports/analysis for Independence leadership, as required
Management of Independence detect controls
Acting as a key Independence point of contact for core areas of the business e.g. Procurement, Finance, Property, Legal
Conducting due diligence reviews with respect to potential firm acquisitions and alliances
Conducting business relationship training to the business
Supporting the UK Independence Leader and Directors on independence related initiatives/campaigns
Supporting the Independence team with other aspects of Independence e.g. consultations with regards to non-audit services, audit pursuits etc
Skills and attributes for success

Desired
Independence professionals with current experience at Manager level. If currently at Senior Associate (or equivalent) level, significant experience at that level and evidence that the individual is ready to step up and act as a Manager
Experience of managing a team
Considered
Individuals with relevant professional qualifications
A strong working knowledge of the concept of Ethics and Auditor Independence, in particular under the UK FRC Ethical Standard, IESBA Code of Ethics and the US SEC regulations.
Extensive experience of other financial services related rules and regulations.
To qualify for the role you must have
Ability to manage and coach junior members of the team
Strong communicator with colleagues at all levels including delivery of tough messages to senior leaders within the firm
Ability to build strong working relationships with the business
Strong analytical and interpretation skills with excellent attention to detail
Ability to think strategically and handle complex concepts
Proactive and capable of working using own initiative
Ideally, you’ll also have
Proven leadership and team management skills
Adaptable and flexible with good team working skills and the ability to multi-task
What we look for
Strong project management skills and proficiency at driving projects to a close
Ability to work to pre-determined deadlines and meet objectives under pressure
What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.
About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Please note

Prior to finalizing your application, you will be asked to provide personal information across several dimensions of diversity and inclusiveness. The information you provide is kept entirely confidential and will not be used to evaluate your candidacy. We collect this data to help us analyse our recruitment process holistically and implement actions that promote diversity and inclusiveness. While optional, we encourage you to provide this information to hold us accountable towards our goal of building a better working world. Read more about our commitment to diversity & inclusiveness here. We ask because it matters!

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.
