H-Farm College is a new independent provider of HE and executive courses from within the UK, delivering online/blended learning in Management, Entrepreneurship and Digital Transformation. Although H-Farm College will deliver a blended learning model, there will also be a physical presence and base in the UK. While longer residential schools are offered initially in Italy, other activities, such as labs, visits, and short courses will be designed for our students and professionals within the UK. With time, H-Farm College is planning to expand the campus in a similar manner to a more traditional UK HE provider, to provide students with fundamental services.

H-Farm College, although independent and based in the UK, benefits from the extensive resources and facilities within its Italian counterpart. This represents the centre of gravity of H-Farm education activities, enabling us to specialise our offer in undergraduate and postgraduate courses with experiential, contextualised practical opportunities in subject areas linked to innovation, management and technology through meaningful residentials.

H-Farm College is in the process of gaining validation with a partner institution and in the future will be applying for registered status with the Office for Students. The IT Manager will play a fundamental part of our progression plans, from input and development of systems, through to daily maintenance.

Please visit our website for further information: https://www.h-farmcollege.org

The founding group H-Farm, where H stands for Human, is a hub where Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Education are combined and entwine with each other. H-Farm is a leading platform where innovation, entrepreneurship and education coexist and create synergy using a digital approach, supporting the creation of new business models and the transformation and education of people and companies.

Founded in January 2005, H-Farm were the first in the world to adopt a model that combined investment, business consulting and digitally driven educational programmes all in one place.
H-Farm have invested 27.3M to date in the development of over 120 innovative companies. H-Farm actively work with over 200 of the most important international brands and teach more than a thousand students through an international and digitally driven educational path that includes four international schools.
In Italy, H-Farm is located just outside of Venice and is the site of a massive architecturally sensitive development that will transform the campus. Utilising 14 thousand square meters of buildings spread over 20 hectares of parkland with 42 thousand square meters of buildings all distributed over 51 hectares, it is destined to become one of the most important European hubs for innovation.
Since November 13, 2015, H-Farm has been listed on the AIM section of the Italian stock exchange and is open to public investment.

Please see our group website for further information: http://www.h-farmcollege.org

Summary of Overall Role Purpose

The Marketing Manager is a senior post within H-Farm College reporting to the Managing Director of H-Farm College and the College Board. This post is responsible for the development and implementation of the marketing and advertising plans for undergraduate, postgraduate, executive, and professional programmes, including the generation of enquiries, applications, and the recruitment of students. The post holder will manage the UK student recruitment strategy and outputs, the student experience during the initial application and will work closely with Heads of School, Faculties, continental counterparts, external agencies, web/internet development teams and publications teams. The Marketing Manager will play a key role in contributing to the development of the future direction of H-Farm College and will be the main point of expertise on student recruitment matters.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

Duties include but are not limited to:
Work with the Managing Director and senior management, to develop the executive, undergraduate and postgraduate marketing strategies for the College in line with the strategic objectives of the College.
Undertake and coordinate the provision of market intelligence to provide insights into market conditions, pricing, competitor activity and sector behaviour, both nationally and internationally.
Work on all aspects of the CRM system, including the implementation and maintenance of the CRM system to ensure all data is up to date and accurate.
Keep up to date with external changes affecting student recruitment and advise on changes and how these affect marketing strategy and recruitment.
Prepare an external events strategy and to manage the planning, delivery and evaluation of executive, undergraduate and postgraduate student recruitment events.
Run social media channels (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn) to enhance student applicant engagement.
Identify other event opportunities to support recruitment objectives.
Undertake and coordinate an advertising strategy and to manage the planning, delivery, and evaluation of advertising.
Track marketing performance and return on investment and prepare weekly or monthly reports for management.
Lead and manage the calendar of activities to generate executive, undergraduate and postgraduate applicants.
Develop and manage effective communication and contacts with local, regional, and national schools and colleges.
Manage the content, use and distribution of printed and electronic student recruitment marketing material.
Manage the development and implementation of marketing and advertising campaigns to generate enquiries and applicants.
Oversee the enquiries and application process and to ensure it is in line with the aims of the College.
Lead the development of campaign and marketing materials to generate applications and enrolments from students.
To work closely with the senior management, Heads of Schools and College boards and be responsible for the student application experience, educational partnerships and widening participation.
Work closely with the Heads of Schools and other staff to manage the involvement of professional and academic staff in marketing executive, undergraduate and postgraduate student recruitment activities.
Advise senior managers on changes to policy and procedures affecting the recruitment of UK students.
Work closely with the College Registry to ensure admissions policy and procedures provide the best experience for applicants.
Work closely with external partners to oversee the development of appropriate relationships and partnerships with stakeholder and feeder institutions.
Work closely with Alumni and International teams to manage Open Days.
A problem-solving ability of a high level is required. It is essential to be able to communicate and work effectively across departments, with a clear perspective of the issues faced by staff and the contexts within which they operate.

To provide administrative and secretarial support to the Rapid Diagnostic Centre (RDC) clinical team.

To manage and prioritise a busy workload using a high level of initiative.

Main duties and responsibilities

To have an understanding of a range of secretarial and administrative work procedures and practices.

To provide administrative support to the clinics, including weekend clinics. This time will form part of the working week.

Preparation of clinic letter templates for patients prior to each clinic.

To type clinic letters to patients (live typing in clinic) with the clinical team. Speed, accuracy and attention to detail are essential.

To deal with all initial and routine enquiries from patients, staff members and external contacts, communicating in a friendly, professional and courteous manner at all times and to provide and receive confidential and sensitive information.
To be proactive and use initiative to deal with urgent/important/confidential matters that have been notified to the office, ensuring that clear communication and consultation with appropriate managers takes place in order for appropriate decisions/actions to be made as soon as possible

To maintain information and reference systems.

To have a workable knowledge of Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint, Clinical Records Service (CRS) and the radiology reporting system (PACS).

To maintain office filing systems and create/update systems where required.

General

Use own judgment and logic to resolve issues.
Prioritise workload based on urgency and importance.
Use initiative and common sense to foresee what work needs to be done.
Set a high standard, and work in a positive and mature manner.
To seek appropriate advice and help when issues cannot be dealt with at own level.
Adopt an objective view and be a good team player.

To report briefly to the Senior Project Manager what issues have been dealt with and draw attention to any issues that may have certain effects/consequences.

To assist with induction and on the job training of new and bank members of staff.

About the job
Summary
Do you want to be at the heart of transforming acquisition and approvals in Defence?

We need to be able to harness the potential of technology if we are to deliver battle winning capability into the hands of our Armed Forces. To do this our approach to acquisition needs to be more flexible and agile so that it can deliver at the pace we need. Improving our approach to acquisition will not only improve how effectively and efficiently we acquire equipment and support (on which we spend some £16bn a year) but will also improve how we buy other goods and services across Defence.
To deliver the changes that are needed across the Defence enterprise, the acquisition and approval transformation portfolio is driving forward three challenging programmes:

• Category management - will put in place procurement strategies for items that are purchased in multiple parts of Defence. Specialist teams will also bring improved market engagement and market direction to each category. This initiative is expected to deliver significant savings.

• Technology Exploitation - will make the changes necessary in the acquisition and approvals systems that are essential to the delivery of fast-paced, innovative technology to the front line, at a pace matching that of evolving threats, ensuring currency of technology through life.

• Culture Change - will enable the necessary shift in thinking and behaviour to make the Category Management and the Technology Exploitation programmes successful and embed a more judgement rather than process led approach, where “appropriate risk” is taken.

The role provides executive secretarial support to the AAT Portfolio Director and Deputy Director as well as the Category Management Programme Deputy Director post holders. The role will also provide wider Portfolio Business Management Support.

• Responsible for arranging away days, ensuring best value for money and efficiency.
• Maintain security and confidentiality at all times.

Job Title: Risk Management/Compliance – Independence Manager - London, Birmingham, Leeds
Job Description:
The opportunity

The UK Independence Team, which forms part of the Risk Management (RM) Group of EY UK, currently has a permanent, full-time vacancy for a Risk Management - Independence Manager. This is a great opportunity to join a wonderful and diverse team that is very much central to the firm, at a time of significant regulatory change within the UK audit profession.

Applications are considered for individuals seeking a permanent, full-time role.

Individuals with prior independence, compliance, audit or other relevant regulatory experience are encouraged to apply.

Team / Department

Within the professional services environment, appropriate risk management is fundamental to the successful delivery of our client services and promotion and protection of our brand. Within EY, the Independence Team forms part of the Risk Management (RM) Group and reports directly to senior management. There are currently almost 30 members in the Independence Team (including conflicts) and a combined total of well over 100 individuals within RM.

The Independence Team is responsible for ensuring EY UK and Ireland maintain compliance with auditor independence rules and regulations imposed by external regulatory bodies (including the UK Financial Reporting Council, US Securities and Exchange Commission, US Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, Irish Auditing & Accounting Supervisory Authority, and the International Ethics Standards Board for Accountants) as well as Global EY Independence and related rules applicable to all EY member firms. Job Title: Head of Workplace Design Standards G6
Job Description:
Location
Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Sheffield
About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

The Design Standards team works from project inception through post occupancy evaluation to ensure that the DWP’s property portfolio is aspirational in its approach to design, inclusivity and sustainability.

The Head of Workplace Design Standards is responsible for leading a team of design engineers/architects and space planner SMEs to deliver guides, tools, standards, advice, assurance and leadership within DWP for all things Estates design related. They should have a passion for design; an understanding and appreciation for navigating change in large organisations; and a desire to drive transformational improvements. This is a unique opportunity to lead the design specification for a large government property portfolio at a significant time, where design will be at the forefront of wider decisions of ways of working, culture and portfolio change.
Job description
Key accountabilities

• Oversight and leadership for the creation and maintenance of technical property standards for various building types across the portfolio ensuring, as a minimum, legal compliance but aspiring to the achievement of a ‘great place to work’ or engage with the DWP, ensuring meaningful engagement and collaborations with internal stakeholders.
• Ensure robust design compliance assurance process are in place, including auditing of third party design consultants and act as the responsible officer for standard exceptions processes.
• ‘Design Authority’ and lead advocate for change within DWP Workplace Transformation programmes, ensuring Estates led design is aligned with other transformational aims (e.g. cultural, digital, etc).
• Manage relationships with supply chain design partners, ensuring understanding of departmental design requirements and advising instructing parties on competence and suitability.
• Responsible for the Design Standards risk register and mitigation activities.
• Ensure design guides, standards, vision and approach is grounded in up-to-date methods, industry best practice and sustainability requirements.
• Drive and lead the strategic and tactical Design Standards plans, ensuring alignment to the DWP Estates and Departmental plans, including utilisation of innovative ways to improve efficiency of processes and approach; compliance in design; and data stewardship (inc. technical library).
• Monitoring and reporting on design progress within all programmes, including responsibility for the creation and ongoing delivery of timely MI and/or dashboards.
• Lead, motivate and develop a team responsible for:
• the preparation and implementation of Design Guides and ensuring the products complement and support the Governments wider design strategy (inc. PAS 3000) and regulatory compliance.
• Overseeing and assisting design consultants directly delivering projects relating to the DWP’s requirements.
• Ownership of all Furniture Fixtures and Equipment product design standards
• Design brand compliance within estates projects
• Oversight of design solutions and supporting the delivery of ‘reasonable adjustments’ building modifications.
• Leading on space planning and space optimisation, inc. the creation, maintenance and utilisation of tools and systems to support efficient modelling.
• Providing design input into property business case development
• Leading the delivery of ongoing training sessions with the various supporting teams and consultants to improve performance and understanding of key areas for development
• Representing the Estates team and wider DWP with other Government Departments on technical and performance improvement matters. Sharing best practice and attending cross government workshops, working groups or conferences as appropriate

Responsibilities
Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience

• Extensive knowledge of statutory processes, Building Regulations and construction related legislation able to evidence involvement in complex estate change in either office/ retail/ banking or educational environments
• In depth understanding of construction methods and materials and fully conversant with CDM Regulations
• Experience of dealing with technical, legal or regulatory design issues at a policy and practical level
• Experienced in new build, conversions, extensions and major refurbishments & developments
• Final responsibility for validation, assurance (design, specification etc) and sign off of schemes and projects typically up to £10m
• Demonstrable Furniture Fixings & Equipment specification experience
• Proven experience of managing design
• Excellent written and oral communication skills
• Ability to use evidence alongside analytical thinking to make decisions
• Strong analytical skills including research and investigation
• Ability to present at a senior level, sometimes in larger forums, in a clear and concise style varying the presentation according to the target audience
• Ability to work collaboratively with mixed teams, consultants and stakeholders
• Comfortable challenging the status-quo to achieve a better outcome

Leadership attributes and behaviours

• Effectively leads people through organisational change, establishing a strong vision for their area and engaging with people in a straightforward, truthful and candid way
• Consider the full impact of implementing changes on culture, structure, morale and impacts on the diverse range of end users, including accessibility needs
• Works collaboratively by building effective relationships across a wide range of people within and outside the Civil Service, welcoming challenge even when it’s uncomfortable
• Ensure delivery of timely quality outcomes, through providing the right resources, reviewing and adjusting performance expectations and rewarding success
• Uses sound judgement, evidence and knowledge to arrive at accurate, expert and professional decisions and advice
• Continuously develops their knowledge and skills through a strong focus on personal development
• Effectively organises resources to deliver high quality performance
• Prioritise and role-model continuous self-learning and development, ensuring individuals take full advantage of learning and development opportunities available to them

Qualifications/professional memberships

Desirable

• Working towards RICS (MRICS/FRICS) with a preference if already held
• Working towards RIBA with a preference if already held
• Relevant Project Management Qualification (e.g. PRINCE2/APM/MSP etc.)
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Changing and Improving
Working Together
Managing a Quality Service
Benefits

• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension

Job Title: Trust Fellow in CATS (Children's Acute Transport Service)
Job Description:
Trust Fellow in CATS (Children's Acute Transport Service)

2x Trust Fellows – to start from May 2021 for 6 months
3x Trust Fellows – to start from August 2021 for 6 months

The Children's Acute Transport Service (CATS) stabilises & transports critically ill & injured children into Intensive Care facilities in North Thames. Previous experience in Transport Medicine is desirable but not essential as the post entails full training in the transport of critically ill children by road and air.

Based in central London, GOSH offers flexible working, help with childcare and travel, excellent training and development opportunities and assistance with finding somewhere to live.

THE ROLE

We are seeking a talented, passionate Customer Service Representative for a 6 months Fixed Term Contract. This is an opportunity to have a huge impact on the success of a growing, profitable business and to accelerate your career in the process.

Our Organisation

NHS England and NHS Improvement came together on 1 April 2019 as a new single organisation. The NHS Long Term Plan focuses on delivering integrated care to patients at the local level and we can best support the NHS to deliver this as a single integrated organisation.

At the NHS, we are reminded every day of how important life is. As a flexible working friendly organisation, we want to be sure that you can work in a way that is best for us and for our patients, and for you. In addition, although the role advertised may have an ‘home’ office base indicated, we remain committed to supporting flexibility around workplace locations. Our new operating model represents a strong shift to regional delivery supported by expert corporate teams. Local health systems are supported by our integrated regional teams who play a major leadership role in the geographies they manage.

We are jointly committed to creating and maintaining a fair and supportive working environment and culture, where contributions are fully recognised and valued by all and staff feel empowered to carry out their duties to the best of their abilities. This underpins our values as set out in the NHS Constitution, supports us to be an Employer of Choice and ultimately enables our employees to support the effective care of our patients.

The aim is to deliver high quality strategic estates advice across the NHS, facilitating STPs/ICSs to create better healthcare environments and generate cost efficiencies that will benefit clinicians, patients and the wider health economy.

SELs will be partnering with senior stakeholders in STPs to support delivery of the NHS England Five Year Forward View (FYFV) by developing estates strategies and programmes which empower the transformation of care and are clearly linked to other infrastructure enablers. Critical skills in stakeholder management, thorough knowledge of the NHS, oversight of capital project delivery, commercial awareness, estates operational issues and programme management are required to be most successful.

This is a results focused role, which requires a full understanding of national health policy objectives to ensure that consequential benefits in efficiency, surplus land release, capital receipts and new housing targets are achieved.

Job Title: Grade 6 Project Delivery Roles *Closing Date Extended*
Job Description:
Each of these G6 posts is different, depending on the type of work being delivered, but a typical post holder at Grade 6 will lead a team that includes several Grade 7 led teams. The Grade 6 role will work alongside other G6s including typically a Project manager and will report into a Defra Deputy Director as part of a wider, collaborative and supportive team of 20+ people. Outside BFP these roles will be expected to work closely with and to influence the policy owners in APHW to make sure we have a clear policy mandate to implement and deliver.
You will be expected to work with a number of internal and external stakeholders including Ministers, industry bodies, non-government organisations and other key delivery bodies.
Your involvement today will contribute to policy, projects, and initiatives that will continue for years to come!
To be successful in these posts you will need to:
• Possess a diverse range of skills and personal qualities; combined with experience of working in a delivery focused context
• Be composed and have the ability to recover quickly from setbacks, able to work in an environment of uncertainty and continual change. You will need to feel comfortable making decisions and setting direction without having the full picture and re-focus as details emerge.
• Use a measured and considered approach to diffusing problem situations, making effective decisions and take a lead role to drive the programme forward.
• Be highly driven – someone who not only inspires others but who can quickly establish mutual respect and trust, effectively building long lasting relationships with a wide range of stakeholders.
• Take in the wider picture when giving direction, seeking to analyse a wide range of information and be able to consider the long-term implications of their decisions.

The roles available include:

Head of Strategy and Delivery
As a Head of Delivery, you will be responsible for leading a team to deliver a specific outcome or outcomes for the border following the UK’s Exit from the European Union, focused in particular on animals, plants and their products to safeguard UK biosecurity and public health.
The roles take in a mix of policy and delivery, with the two often developing at the same time – you may be looking ahead to long-term policy while also delivering rapidly what’s needed now, providing both breadth and depth to the roles. On the policy side, you will be supporting the development of current and future strategies as we reach the end of the Transition Period while on the delivery side, you will be planning and delivering the UK’s new border regime from January 2021, including things as varied as infrastructure, specialist border staff, lab capacity, systems and legislation.
This is set against a moving landscape – negotiations with the EU on a free trade agreement continue and has the capacity to alter delivery plans. These are therefore fast-paced and challenging roles, and you will need to be alive and connected to wider developments, keeping delivery planning under constant review and able to deliver in times of ambiguity, building the capability and resilience of your team to do the same.
You will be working extensively and collaboratively across Whitehall and beyond, including with ports and traders, public delivery partners, Devolved Administrations and Crown Dependencies among others. The roles lead significant engagement with – and receive the scrutiny of - the most senior committees, officials and Ministers in Whitehall.

Responsibilities

In broad terms, your work will include:
• Taking the oversight and lead responsibility to work with policy colleagues to drive development of a range of crucial policy areas to a state where they can be delivered to meet deadlines associated with our leaving the EU;
• The provision of effective planning and prioritisation activities to deliver high quality results to time;
• Working with a range of stakeholders, both within and outside of Government, to help ensure that you are able to deliver the best results
• Using a combination of evidence and your expertise to help guide decisions on the most effective approach to strategy development and delivery;
• Taking the lead to brief Ministers and senior officials on your key areas;
• Developing your team’s capability and resilience

Head of Business Readiness, Comms and Engagement

There is one Business Readiness, Comms and Engagement role available working across two teams within the SPS Borders and Boundaries programme – the Northern Ireland Protocol (NIP) project and the EU / GB Borders programme.
The Business Readiness, Comms and Engagement Lead plays an important role in the team which will develop and implement the long-term strategic vision for Defra – with an initial focus on plants (and plant products) and then to the longer-term goal of a single trading platform. They will ensure that businesses are aware of proposed changes, consulted, and appropriately involved in the development of the strategic solution.
The G6 Business Readiness, Comms and Engagement Lead will be able to lead on lead a team that ensures businesses and external affected bodies are updated on the latest developments regarding the strategic solution for Defra trade; and ensures businesses have the opportunity to share feedback and concerns regarding this strategic work
They will also be responsible for conveying business feedback and concerns into the wider EU / GB & NIP team programme team. This will include ensuring that feedback is appropriately acted upon and communicated back to stakeholders.
Finally, the Business Readiness, Comms and Engagement Lead will ensure engagement on the strategic solution is ‘joined-up’ with the engagement being undertaken by the rest of the wider SPS programme, wider Defra group and other government departments.
Responsibilities
The specific responsibilities of the role will consist of:
• Developing, maintaining and delivering a business engagement plan
• Collaborating with key stakeholders to ensure the business change is planned and delivered effectively and on time
• Providing the programme team with weekly updates that show progress against the plan, as well as the latest feedback from businesses
• Developing and updating lines to take and core messages – ensuring buy-in from relevant internal stakeholders
• Maintaining an up-to-date understanding of the latest project developments, as well as those within the wider programme which may have an impact.
• Undertaking a regular pattern of engagement with trade associations and key businesses – to ensure the development and maintenance of good relationships with these organisations
• Liaise with other relevant parts of Defra to ensure effective coordination.

Head of NI Boundary Operability
The G6 Head of NI Boundary Operability and Intelligence will be responsible for developing, testing and implementing an operating model for the movements of plants, animals and their products across the NI/GB boundary. This will initially focus on the end on the end of the transition period in December 2020.
The role holder will develop a detailed understanding of the trade flows that support movements of animals, plants and their products between GB and NI and alongside this an understanding of businesses’ trade priorities, requirements and concerns post-transition. The start point of these trade flows will be free circulation of these goods in GB for movements from GB to NI and the end point will be free circulation of these goods NI. NI to GB movements will have equivalent start and end points.
The will also lead the development of detailed process maps that describe both ‘as-is’ and ‘to-be’ trade flows including the development and evaluation of specific ‘to-be’ process workarounds that may be required to support continuity of trade in animals, plants and their products.
The Head of Operability will lead the testing and proving of these processes with both Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (DEFRA) and business stakeholders to ensure the goal of NI boundary operability is achieved. This will require engagement with DEFRA and the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (DAERA) stakeholders and other government departments (OGDs) but also businesses on both sides of the GB/NI boundary.
The role holder will lead a small team that includes of business analyst, policy analyst and project management resources. They will provide leadership and direction but also coaching and support to this mixed team of contractors and civil servants.

Job Title: Field Service Engineer Reading or Guildford
Job Description:
The Zonal group are one of the UKs largest technology providers to the hospitality industry. Our products are used by over 11,000 pubs, restaurants and hotels. Customers include national brands like Pizza Express, JD Wetherspoons and All Bar One.

We provide our customers with the solutions they need to make their business a success. These solutions include mobile apps for ordering and web apps for engaging with consumers either through loyalty or reservations. By linking these solutions to Zonals EPoS (till) system, we help hospitality brands to understand their customers behaviour and preferences, enabling them to excel in an increasingly competitive market.

If you have booked a table or hotel room, ordered, and paid for food and drinks, received loyalty offers, or downloaded your favourite hang outs app, you will likely have used a Zonal product.

We are a family business with Scottish roots. We operate from our modern head office in Edinburgh to our Marketing Technologies Division in Staffordshire, or our Innovation Centre in Abingdon and hotel management solutions base in Cardiff.

What youll do

Maintain Zonal products at sites around the UK and abroad according to Company standards of customer service, Service Level Agreements, and Health and Safety requirements.

The Technical Service Department consists of the Technical Support, Technical Consultancy, Repair Centre, Production, Warehouse and Service Engineer teams (reporting ultimately to the Operations Director).

Support is provided based upon the SLAs in place with the customers. These are monitored on a daily basis and reported back to the customer at regular intervals.

Responsibilities will involve:-

Daily liaison with the Engineering Scheduler. Close calls with the Engineering Scheduler as soon as these are completed.
Provide the Engineering Scheduler with regular updates on progress, details of any other relevant issues, or further action to be taken.
Diagnose and/or repair faults on site or remove to workshop for more thorough repair.
Carry out programme upgrades on site.
Carry out Data copies if required to preserve critical data.
Liaise with the R&D department during product trials: report any problems that occur during installation, usage or removal to ensure which require further attention.
Full and detailed completion of all appropriate paperwork.
Present a positive Company image.
Provide a timely, polite and efficient service.
Provide on-call cover on evenings and weekends on a rotational basis.
Ensuring the delivery of product features into product releases at the required level of quality
Pro-actively participating in the full development lifecycle
Monitoring and reporting on the production usage of the product to help identify areas of weakness/risk
Championing expertise to ensure quality of product throughout all stages of the development lifecycle

Who you are

Essential:-

You will live within a 10 mile radius of either Reading or Guildford
Minimum 18 months experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally in the hospitality/leisure industry.
Background knowledge in computer hardware (pcs, IP networks and WIFI)
The ability to provide 5 years of continuous past work history and satisfactory references to enable the candidate to obtain an airport pass successfully.
Clean driving licence is essential.
PC literate (all MS Office suite) and aptitude to pick up new software packages quickly.
Planning and organisational skills; able to establish efficient and appropriate plans for self and others and adapt quickly and effectively to unexpected changes whilst still ensuring objectives are met. Customer service; understands and responds to customer needs (internal and external) and exceeds expectations where possible.
Communication and team working; works co-operatively with others to achieve a common goal and communicates information in a clear, concise and accurate manner.
Problem solving and decision making; analyses information appropriately in order to find best solutions and takes a balanced view to reach logical conclusions and make relevant decisions. Commercial and organisational focus; demonstrates understanding of overall business and commercial issues facing company.
Commitment to results; is committed to obtaining results through taking responsibility, demonstrating a positive attitude and ensuring quality is built into work.

Desirable:-

EPoS background
Experience of maintaining and installing EPoS equipment
3 years or more experience in a field based customer service engineering role, ideally within the hospitality/leisure industry

What we value

Passion, Teamwork, Innovation and Professionalism are the values we believe make us the company we are. Were looking for someone who understands great culture and will help us shape it as it evolves.

We are one of the largest and busiest acute Trusts in the North West of England, comprising of the Wirral’s only Emergency Department. We provide a high quality range of acute care services and employ over 6,000 staff, who serve a population of approximately 400,000 people across Wirral, Ellesmere Port, Neston, North Wales and the wider North West footprint.

We have approximately 855 beds trust-wide and our financial turnover is in excess of £337m.

The Wirral is easily accessible to major airports and has excellent transport links including motorway, train, bus or ferry and within easy reach to the major cities of Liverpool, Chester and Manchester as well as neighbouring North Wales.

WUTH is committed to building on our strengths to become the first choice healthcare provider for our communities. We are focused on exceptional customer service through the delivery of integrated, seamless, continuous pathways of care, enabled by innovation and leading edge technology. Underpinning this commitment are our values and fundamental belief that our patients must be at the heart of everything we do.

who has the ability to contribute to the development of the work of a Board operating in a very challenging and regulated environment.

Job Description
Product
NEC Biometrics in the United Kingdom is managed under Northgate Public Services, an NEC company. Our role is to globally commercialise NEC’s biometric solutions including our world leading facial recognition technology via our NeoFace Watch product. To date, the product is deployed to 57 countries and territories with an excess of 100 million enrolments and thousands of real-time cameras in markets as diverse as public safety, policing and national security through to retail, gaming and finance.
Role
As a Senior PreSales Manager, your role is to provide a single point of contact to our global network of partners. You will work closely with account managers, presales and engineering counterparts, with a responsibility to strengthen the relationship with designated accounts and increase licence sales of our biometric products.
The role calls for a diverse set of skills, demanding someone who is equally comfortable discussing business strategy and updating pipeline information as they are responding to a tender and carrying out hands-on activities such as small proof of concepts and trials. Such activities may cover various biometric solutions including, face, fingerprint or iris recognition.
This role is part of our existing international PreSales team and reports directly to the Operations Director within the biometrics team. The position is home-based within the United Kingdom and requires regular travel both within the United Kingdom and internationally.
Candidate qualities
We are seeking a motivated self-starter, comfortable both working alone and as part of our existing PreSales team, carrying out a mixture of technical and commercial work on a daily basis. The successful candidate will have a background blending technical, commercial and customer facing competencies and will demonstrate five key principles:
Relationship: Establish and cultivate long-standing relationships with stakeholders from partners and end customers at all levels of the business, ranging from executive through to end user. Use these relationships to build a strong two-way dialog built upon trust and transparency.
Market: Understand the biometric market and work with partners to define a strategy which meets NEC’s wider international objectives whilst maximising regional opportunity. Work with the partner network to anticipate their needs to drive success within their region.
Commercial : Take ownership of commercial decision making, working with various stakeholders as part of a team responsible for defining commercial strategy within the region. This also includes tracking opportunities within the pipeline and providing pricing.
Technical: Provide technical guidance and advice, ranging from technical documentation such as High-Level-Designs, hardware sizing and basic IT best practice guidelines. Hands-on skills with Windows to deploy small proof of concepts and demonstration systems.
Leadership: The wide ranging and senior nature of the role calls for an individual who can take ownership of an issue, calling upon various stakeholders and steering projects to success.
Essential Responsibilities
Build strong and trusted relationships with NEC counterparts within your region(s) with specific focus on regional account managers, commercial executives and the presales staff.
Work closely with regional NEC teams, system integrators and end-customers to identify and qualify opportunities, helping partners to develop and execute a commercial strategy to deploy biometric solutions within the region.
Ensure that updates from the regional stakeholders are accurately reported via the pipeline, tracking ongoing projects and reporting opportunities for new business to help grow the regional footprint.
Provide commercial guidance, factoring in regional considerations and the competitive landscape, to ensure that our partners strategy is consistently viable and that the pipeline information remains accurate.
Assist technical experts within the partner network to understand the best options to configure biometric solutions and ensure they are maximising its potential within the market.
Provide technical project documentation to assist with the tender process, such as high level design and project documents, hardware recommendations and general technical guidance.
Influence and input into the tender response process, responding to RFI / RFPs, inputting into the win strategy and completing gap analysis.
Deploy small proof of concept and trial deployments onto customer environments, typically within the Microsoft product stack.
Carry out basic data analysis for projects, including basic statistical analysis of biometric accuracy data.
Attend trade events to promote our biometric capabilities.
Present biometric solution, particularly NeoFace Watch, via live demonstrations and through customer presentations, both remote and face-to-face.
Host biometric product training sessions both remotely and face-to-face.
Work closely with all stakeholders across the business to ensure appropriate allocation of resources
Qualifications
Qualifications & Experience
Extensive and demonstrable experience working with technology vendors and systems integrators.
Experience of video analytics, facial recognition or biometrics’ is preferable but not essential.
Detailed understanding of IT systems infrastructure, design and deployment, including:
Operating Systems : Windows Desktop (10), Server (2012, 2016, 2019) and Linux.
Databases: MS SQL (2014, 2016).
Networking: TCP/IP, Switching, Routing, VPN, etc.
Technology: On-Premise, Cloud (AWS, Azure), Virtualisation.
Security: Base understanding of IT best practice, firewall configuration, IDS, etc.
API: Understating of integration via web-based API’s such as SOAP / XML, RESTful, etc. Ability to script (JavaScript, Python, etc) is advantageous but not essential.
Detailed understanding and experience of the end-to-end bid process from inception to award, including responding to RFI/RFP’s and defining the service package.
Mandatory Requirements
All candidates must comply to the following mandatory requirements:
Based within the United Kingdom.

Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services. We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

The Business Assurance Support role will be based within the Policy and Compliance Team of DWP’s Estates Directorate, and provide support for commercial governance and assurance. This is a critical team that underpins the DWP Estates Business Plan, acting to support the Delegated Financial Authority of the Estates Director and their budget of £500m+.

Job Title: Senior Research Policy Officer: Research Delivery Networks (SEO)
Job Description:
Location
This post is available at either our London or Leeds site.
About the job
Summary
Overview of the post/area of work:

This is an exciting opportunity to work in the Department of Health and Social Care’s (DHSC) Science, Research and Evidence (SRE) Directorate. The Secretary of State for Health has a Statutory Duty to promote research and the use of research evidence, and SRE plays a central role in ensuring he is able to fulfil this duty. We do this by providing leadership, direction, and strategic oversight of the NHS, Public Health and Social Care research system, and through the National Institute for Health Research (NIHR), the UK’s largest funder of translational and applied research.

The NIHR was established in 2006 to improve the health and wealth of the nation through research. NIHR delivers against this mission through: funding, supporting and delivering high quality research; engaging and involving patients, carers and the public; attracting, training and supporting the best researchers; investing in world-class infrastructure and a skilled delivery workforce; partnering with other public funders, charities and industry. The NIHR research infrastructure aims to speed up translation of discoveries from basic science into leading-edge early translational (experimental medicine) research, through clinical research and via applied health and care research. The NIHR research infrastructure supports translation into patient benefits and drive economic growth by creating and harnessing world-class research infrastructure in the NHS and wider health and care system.

The role sits within the Faculty, Infrastructure and Growth team and provides a unique opportunity to influence the research ecosystem and develop national research policy/strategy that delivers patient benefit and contributes to UK growth. Working closely with the Portfolio Manager for Research Networks, the Deputy Director for Research Faculty, Infrastructure and Growth, DHSC SRE Senior Management Team and colleagues in other Government Departments, the Senior Research Policy Officer will develop and implement policies and initiatives that aim to improve the delivery of clinical research (including clinical trials) in the NHS and wider health and care system.
Job description
Key responsibilities for the role:

Working within the Research Faculty, Infrastructure and Growth branch in
SRE, the post holder will:

• Support the management and oversight of strategy/policy development, implementation and delivery of a large portfolio of NIHR research infrastructure that support the delivery of research across the whole innovation pathway. This includes the NIHR Clinical Research Network, NIHR Clinical Research Facilities (CRFs) and NIHR/CRUK Experimental Cancer Medicine Centres (ECMCs). This portfolio represents a budget of circa £340 million per annum.

• Support the development and implementation of policies and initiatives that aim to create the best possible environment to deliver both commercial and non-commercial research that benefits patients and the public and contributes to growth. This will include supporting on initiatives such as policy issues related to research costing, service support and excess treatment costs, and increasing collaboration across NIHR research delivery infrastructure to deliver a diverse portfolio of research.

• Contribute to strategy/policy development for NIHR research delivery infrastructure so that it provides greater support for public health and social care research.

• Contractual management for NIHR Clinical Research Network involving contract oversight and performance monitoring, maintaining accurate financial records and returns, leading on any new procurement exercises and issuing new contracts.

• Working with NIHR Central Commissioning Facility and Cancer Research UK to support management of the portfolio of NIHR CRFs and ECMCs

• Provide briefing for Ministers, the Chief Medical Officer and senior officials as required.

Responsibilities
Key requirements for the role:

Essential

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with a variety of senior individuals both within DHSC and externally (life sciences industry, universities, NHS, research funders and other government departments).
• Strong analytical skills, demonstrating the ability to take information and evidence from a variety of sources to form recommendations about policies and initiatives.
• Strong evidence of delivering goals, targets and competing deadlines at pace.
• Ability to appropriately handle and manage changing and competing priorities.
• Excellent team work, including experience of working with a range of stakeholders and across a number of teams to deliver objectives.

Desirable

• Experience of project management and budget management.
• Experience of R&D management and/or delivery within an NHS or University setting.
• Understanding of the role health research plays in improving the health of the nation and its contribution to economic growth.
• Understanding of how the health and care system supports and delivers life sciences clinical research, including the role of the NIHR Infrastructure.

Job Description:
We welcome and encourage applications from everyone, including groups currently underrepresented in our workforce and pride ourselves as being an employer of choice. To find out more about how we champion diversity and inclusion in the workplace, visit: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ministry-of-justice/about/equality-and-diversity

This position is available for external applicants as well as existing civil servants on level transfer or promotion. New recruits to the Civil Service joining MoJ are expected to join at the band minimum. For an exceptional applicant and under exceptional circumstances, managers have discretion to set starting salaries above the pay range minimum.

Background

Her Majesty’s Court and Tribunals Service is an agency of the MoJ and provides the supporting administration for the judiciary across England and Wales. It delivers services to the public directly in court and tribunal buildings, remotely via business centres and some limited services via the internet.
There are high expectations of all staff regardless of the job they do and good performance is expected from everybody. The organisation is continuously adopting new or better ways of working to ensure that it focuses on just that which is essential.
HMCTS has a once in a generation opportunity to transform the entire Courts and Tribunals Service through the HMCTS Reform Programme, enhancing the provision of a world-class justice system, in a manner that provides an improved user experience at reduced cost to the taxpayer. This will contribute to consolidating the UK’s position at the forefront of an increasingly competitive international legal market as well as ensuring access to justice for all.
The programme includes modernising the court estate, updating and replacing its technology, speeding up and streamlining working practices, refurbishing buildings to reduce maintenance costs and provide much improved services for service users, especially vulnerable witnesses and victims. Effective staff engagement at this time of such significant change will be critical to success; maintaining a positive and lasting connection between HMCTS management and its staff.
An effective courts and tribunals service is fundamental to our democracy, underpinning the rule of law. This is an opportunity to work in a role that will support and enable a major transformation programme, designed not just to give our courts and tribunals a sustainable and affordable future, but improve delivery of justice.

Overview

HMCTS is a continually changing organisation. Strong leadership is a critical element in this being successful. As a leader and manager within HMCTS the jobholder must provide clear direction and focus and visibly championing the changes which deliver greater efficiencies. HMCTS Senior Management Team expects all leaders to operate in a culture of openness and honesty, demonstrating a commitment to change through involvement and empowerment, and by delivering results.
This is an exciting opportunity to join a busy and friendly team in the HMCTS Property Directorate. In this role you will use your skills and experience to develop policy around how we use our court and tribunal buildings and how we will make decisions about their location, capabilities and capacity. You will draft persuasive papers for executive boards, answers to parliamentary questions and accurate and informative briefings for ministers and senior executives. You will have the opportunity to understand and contribute to the development of our future strategy and will present the priorities and approach of the directorate at meetings.

Key Interactions:

• Ministers and Private Offices
• HMCTS Communications teams
• Press Office
• HMCTS Reform Programme
• HMCTS HQ and Regional colleagues
• Policy and legal teams within MoJ

Key Responsibilities:

Policy Development

• Provide support to the Head of Estates to assess policy proposals across the justice system and impacts upon HMCTS, delivery models and services.
• Identify the priority deliverables and support development for property consultations and consolidations.
• Work with Property Directorate colleagues to align policy and strategy work providing input into strategy development where necessary.
• Update, manage, and present data related to estates policy and our future strategy.
• Provide policy support for wider Property Directorate functions, including facilities management, maintenance and asset management.

Internal relations

• Work collaboratively with Private Offices, HMCTS Communications Teams, HMCTS HQ and Regional teams to develop and deliver objectives.
• Be visible to staff and internal stakeholders and regularly undertake activities to engage and build trust with people involved in priority areas
• Establish relationships with a range of stakeholders to support delivery of business outcomes and be confident in representing the directorate at meetings.
• Provide support for the development of communications regarding facilities management and issues with our estate.

Representation of the Department

• Represent HMCTS both internally and externally in areas of property policy development
• Stand by and promote own and team’s actions and decisions where needed
• Lead by example, role modelling ethics, integrity, impartiality and the elimination of bias by building diverse teams and promoting a working environment that supports the Civil Service values and code.

Ministerial Support and Parliamentary Handling

• Produce briefings to deadlines which support the strategic priorities and recommendations of the Property Directorate and HMCTS Reform Programme.
• Manage the team responsible for the drafting of answers to parliamentary questions. Engage appropriately with Property Directorate and MoJ colleagues to produce accurate answers.
• Provide support on assessing property policy requirements for HMCTS Reform

Team leadership

• Lead, coach and mentor members of own team and develop capabilities in line with business needs
• Responsible for the line management of a small geographically dispersed team.

Accountability

• Reporting to the Grade 7 Head of Estates Policy

Other duties

The post holder is required to work in a flexible way and undertake any other duties reasonably requested by line management which are commensurate with the grade and level of responsibility of this post.

Location of Post:

We will consider base locations at HMCTS locations across the country, as well as arrangements for working from home. Regular travel to other HMCTS sites may also be required as part of these working arrangements. In line with the department’s policies, travel, subsistence and, where appropriate, overnight accommodation will be available in line with organisational policies.

Essential Criteria:

• Experience in drafting for boards or external uses.
• Strong communication skills and experience dealing with external stakeholders.
• Proven ability to perform consistently to tight timescales with a high degree of visibility.

Desirable Criteria:

• Experience in dealing with ministerial and parliamentary processes.
• Experience in developing policy and presenting this through papers and presentations
• Experience in roles related to the estate strategy or property change.
• Proven ability to drive through significant change while maintaining strong client and internal relationships.

Terms & Conditions:

Fixed Term Appointment

This appointment will be made on a fixed term basis, due to the time limited nature of the Reform Programme.
For existing civil servants, whilst the role itself is time limited, at the end of the fixed term period, you will retain your permanent status but will be placed on the re-deployment register. Successful appointment on promotion will secure this grade on a permanent substantive basis.
Secondments and loans will be considered on an individual basis.

Flexible working options

HMCTS offers a flexible working system in many of its offices.

Job sharing and reduced hours

All applications for job sharing or reduced hours will be treated fairly and on a case by case basis in accordance with the MoJ’s flexible working policy and equality policy.

Excess Fares and Relocation Allowances

This job is not eligible for relocation allowances, but excess fares may be considered in accordance with MoJs excess fares allowance policy.

Job Description:
We are MUFG. 360 years of heritage. A world-class set of businesses. And more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. It’s no surprise that MUFG has grown to become one of the top five banks in the world. Our services include commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.

Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it.

Overview of Department/Section

As part of a leading global financial group, MUFG is required to act with integrity and meet our corporate responsibilities in the fifty-plus countries and regions where we operate. Ensuring we have a comprehensive financial crime compliance program is one of our most important responsibilities. MUFG has established the Global Financial Crimes Division (GFCD) in New York, USA to lead the program.

The GFCD Conformance function is responsible for driving adherence to GFCD Quality Assurance (QA) and Monitoring Standards in the first line of defense through technical advisory and training support, and building an effective second line of defense QA capability that will be predominately located in GFCD Centers of Excellence.

MUFG’s financial crime compliance framework includes control processes designed to help the Bank detect, deter, and prevent financial crime as well as assess and mitigate related risks (i.e. money laundering and terrorist financing risk, sanctions risk, and bribery and corruption risk) in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws, rules, regulations, supervisory guidance, and commensurate with the Bank’s risk profile and risk appetite.

Main Purpose of the role

Reporting into the Head of GFCD Centers of Excellence (CoE) Conformance, this new position has been created for the purpose of establishing a globally consistent approach to Financial Crimes Conformance for MUFG.

The role holder will be responsible for the implementation and oversight of CoE QA frameworks, QA execution modules, Management Information (MI), Monitoring, controls Subject Matter Expertise (SME) and training to promote consistent Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) Quality Assurance methods and practices across all the CoE’s (USA - Tempe, Charlotte, Texas; EMEA; APAC – India, Singapore; Japan and China) in the MUFG Group. The QA will cover all global GFCD activities delivered across a variety of in-scope businesses, functions and geographies across the MUFG Group.

Key Responsibilities

In connection with the Global Financial Crimes Program :

E stablish and implement consistent Quality Assurance validation approaches, QA execution and implementation of the applicable sample testing requirements to drive consistency across businesses, functions and geographies;
Develop and lead CoE QA oversight activities in conjunction with the GFCD Monitoring program;
Provide frequent FCC SME support to CoE GFCD QA teams maintaining globally developed QA practices and high standards of QA delivery;
Actively engage with regional QA Heads, CoE Heads and other stakeholders to deliver analysis and assessment of key risks, control weaknesses and improvement opportunities;
Liaise and collaborate with GFCD functions (AML, Sanctions, AB&C) to ensure alignment to global policies and requirements as well as appropriate coverage for key financial crime risks identified by the global leadership team;
Provide leadership and oversight to CoE QA managers when responding to Compliance Testing, Audit or Regulatory queries and exams;
Advise regional QA Heads on the development of program methodology for process and control design effectiveness assessments to establish Quality Assurance design parameters for their region;
Be versatile and knowledgeable to develop and execute solutions that support QA and CoE strategies while enhancing our ability to monitor and manage risks in any environment;
Design key measurements, dashboards and reporting requirements for regional QA assessments for management and oversight of financial crime risk;
Identify key control requirements and design assessments to strengthen and enhance the control framework;
Develop locally required addenda to the global standards to ensure full coverage of both global standards and local regulatory requirements;
Oversight of the Monitoring Programme implementation and execution activities per region;
Initiate, drive and embed change initiatives as necessary to meet business demands and evolving regulations.
Work collaboratively across functional teams within GFCD to ensure effective and efficient operations with clearly defined roles and responsibilities.

Liaise with vendors and 3rd parties in connection with the global program to resolve related issues.

Work with the Central Project Management Office to collate and provide routine updates to GFCD leadership, senior management, and appropriate governance fora.

7 plus years of internal or financial industry and compliance experience, preferably within a global organisation in a role directly involved with driving change, program enhancement and critical program evaluation.

Global Financial Crimes Compliance SME expertise, including managing diverse global regulatory expectations.

About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is s a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

This senior management role based within the Policy and Compliance team, reporting to the Head of Estates Health, Safety and Environment, will be the key link to the asset management compliance on behalf of the Estates function. With over 200,000 assets, it will involve working across the Estates teams and closely with the Integrator and supply chain to monitor and drive continuous improvement in asset management data accuracy and timely completion of statutory inspections, testing, planned preventative maintenance and associated remedial work. You will be the focal point for Estates in relation to asset compliance and will be reviewing systems such as computer aided facilities management systems to ensure the Estates function receives accurate and timely reports and checking the delivery of the scheduled work so that asset and building compliance can be maintained.

The Infrastructure and Projects Authority (IPA) is the government’s centre of expertise for infrastructure and major projects. We sit at the heart of government, reporting to the Cabinet Office and HM Treasury. We have a unique view from the centre of the whole portfolio and our purpose is to continuously improve the way infrastructure and major projects are delivered. We aspire to create the best performing project system of any country in the world.

Projects in government cover a very wide spectrum, from massive infrastructure projects such as HS2, through to military equipment, information technology and transformation projects. Additionally, the Government has embarked on a Transition Period after our exit from the EU that has a large portfolio of enabling programmes. The breadth and diversity of our portfolio is greater than any in the private sector.

Job Overview

You will hold a critical role within the Project Delivery Team of the Infrastructure and Projects Authority, leading challenge and support activity across a number of Departments.

You will have accountability for improving project performance through strategic and tactical support, advice and appropriate assurance of Departmental portfolios. This includes projects and programmes that form part of, or are candidates for, the Government’s Major Project Portfolio (GMPP). The role will have a particular emphasis in developing and providing support to DDaT projects.

The Role & Responsibilities

As the Project Delivery Adviser your key responsibilities will include:

Leading the IPA’s delivery challenge and support across a significant part of the Government’s portfolio working across multiple Departments and project types with an emphasis on Digital, Data and Technology;

With and through your team, building and maintaining the assurance and approvals framework for your Departments. Engage Cabinet Office and HM Treasury partners to align perspectives, as well as controls, in the interests of successful delivery; representing IPA on HM Treasury approval panels;

Taking shared leadership accountability for meeting key performance indicators and assisting Departments to deliver their Comprehensive Spending Review commitments while taking a balanced view on wider transformation.

Build and cultivate strong, trusted relationships with senior stakeholders (e.g. Senior Responsible Owners and Programme Directors) to enable collaborative working relationships. Creating strong professional networks at the heart of government including across other Government Functions (particularly the Government Digital Service) and with HM Treasury.

Where needed, Support the activity and actions of G6 Project Delivery Advisers on senior/complex projects.

Who you are

As the pace of technology adoption remains unabated, it is increasingly important for the IPA to ensure our staff have the right expertise to advise on an ever increasing number of digital transformation programmes in order to deliver the Government's priorities.

As a Project Delivery Adviser you should have:

Robust leadership maturity and excellent management skills. Must be capable of promoting and delivering continuous individual and team development to enhance people capability

Major project delivery experience, including a robust understanding of the end-to-end project life cycle and the risks that need to be managed in major projects particularly in the DDaT space

Ability to think strategically in Government, working with senior leaders to maintain oversight and provide challenge and support to project delivery

Very acute stakeholder engagement skills; confident in influencing and negotiating with both peers and very senior leaders

A well founded track record in building good working relationships across diverse business areas and functions

Effective critical thinking and analysis skills for problem-solving;

Confident and effective personal communication; highly developed drafting skills

Experience of working to a Project Methodology.

About this fairly unique Quality Leadership opportunity!

I am seeking that certain special kind of Quality leader, one who thrives on bringing structure and organizational processes and thinking to new and growing smaller innovator organizations. What you will inherit will require shaping and redevelopment, where you will provide Quality counsel for GCP and Research QA, you will also manage all the GxPs (incl. PhV, GcLP, GCP, IMP, GMP), including redevelopment of the quality management system, top level policies and SOPs.

This smaller organization has a vision for their speciality medicinal area (all their NMEs are novel), and this role reports to a VP of Regulatory who will support you build your own vision and the overall quality philosophy in the organization. This VP has their own regulatory objectives to deliver on, so we really are looking for a stand-up professional, who can take the mantle and run with it.

This role is a position which will in time have a full-time team reporting into it, at first it will be semi-virtual, using a mix of contractors and freelancers but as the company grows from their mid / late phase pipeline, this role will also grow into a full QA departmental head leadership role, with eventually full-time Quality / QA Managers / Sr Specialists supporting you!

The company is using a fair number of Contract Labs and Manufacturers, as well as CROs, which will also fall under your remit of course, for Quality Oversight, so working with vendors, on technical agreements, compliance, and OOS/Investigations, or Audit findings, will also be part of this role. Additionally, you will be responsible for the European region, for any inspections preparation and hosting, regardless of which GxP it is.

I cannot think too much of what this role does not include in terms of quality assurance and quality management, so you will have to work with the leadership team to educate, escalate, and prioritize, based on your compliance expertise, and risk-based assessment, to decide where your short-term and long-term efforts will be needed.

Experience & Background

It is likely you will have around 15 years’ experience in quality assurance, ideally for GCP although this could be from auditing, process improvement or quality assurance management roles, and ideally 5-8 years in a leadership role, with people management.

Equally, we welcome applications from individuals who have led a quality career with a larger pharmaceutical company, and now would like something smaller, where you can have fuller oversight and ownership of all the GxPs and quality / research quality processes.

Package, Benefits & COVID

We have a digital hiring policy in place and you can be both hired and on-boarded remotely, pending the office reconvening. There is a certain amount of flexibility after Covid, in terms of working from home. Relocations will be considered!

The role comes with a competitive Director level salary (even to larger pharmaceutical companies), a decent performance bonus and a stock plan. The company are willing to buyout a certain amount of stock and bonus from you potentially leaving your current employer, for the right person.
